name: Madisun Rhodes
text: I have gone here my entire life. By far the best dentist- clean office, sweet people, educated staff, comfortable environment. I would highly recommend this place to anyone! They have a special place in my heart.

name: Renea Marks
text: Today was our first visit here and my daughter and I absolutely loved everything about this dentist they don't let any parents go back if your child is older but my daughter said the ladies in the back were super nice and they took care of her really well and they were really fast as well we are super excited that this is our new dentist home

name: Jennifer Dunn
text: They are the best! They have the nicest staff so my children actually enjoy going to the dentist instead of fearing it.

name: Jennifer Boully
text: We have been seeing Dr. Nicrosi for 7 years.  All four of my daughters have had a wonderful experience here.  The entire staff is so kind and comforting.  They have always taken the time to explain charges on our account and work with me when needing to schedule payments.  The environment is perfect for kids with toys to play with in the back to help ease them into the whole process.  They only use non scary terminology when speaking about procedures to avoid upsetting the kids.  It's really a great office to take your kids to.

name: Timothy Tumblin
text: Loved seeing you guys at Hayden Day! Wonderful office! Friendly, on time, and treat your kids like they were their own! Highly recommend! My kids love Jennifer!

name: Ryan Partridge
text: Amazing office and friendly people! Ashley is an awesome hygienist with a great personality! Would highly recommend you visit.

name: Shaun Henry
text: The staff here is top notch! Always professional and they genuinely care about their patients and parents. I highly recommend this dentist office if you are new to the area and looking for a great family friendly pediatric dentist.

name: Leslie
text: I have three children, one who has special needs. They are so wonderful with all of them. Caring and thoughtful! I cannot say enough great things about this place!

name: Quin Watson
text: We are new to the practice, but we are already in love. My 5yo really enjoys coming and they try their best to make it a pleasant experience for her. The staff is very friendly, professional, helpful, and informative.

name: Marci Schreiner
text:
Best pediatric dental office in Alabama. We drive over two hours from Thomasville, Al to use Dr. Carol Ann  and her fantastic staff. They explain everything in depth
To the  parents and make the children love going to the dentist all while providing state of the art dental care.

name: Barbara Meyer
text: Our first time at the dentist was traumatizing for my son and for me. We started out at a different dentist in Gardendale and we were not impressed. Decided to try this office, and what a difference! Their staff is amazing and I’ve never seen so many kids that happy to be at the dentist.

name: Jennifer Fivas
text: Wonderful dentists.  We love the staff,  they're all so sweet!!

name: Cilia Smith
text: We love using Dr. Nicrosi. Our daughter has special needs and they are very accommodating! They also have a fantastic office staff.

name: Robin Claborn
text:
We absolutely love Dr. Carol Ann. My daughter is always excited to go visit the dentist.
Ms. Ashley is always so friendly when calling my daughter back for her check. I am so pleased with the service and the professionalism of the staff.

name: Jennifer King
text: My kids do not want to leave! They love it here. We love the staff. They are so helpful and loving to me and my kids.

name: Wendy Baker
text: Absolutely wonderful!  Landin doesn’t even realize when he gets a shot.  Everyone is so friendly and caring!  100% the dentist of choice for our family!!

name: Breanna Dooley
text: We see Dr. Nicrosi, and we have been very pleased with our visits. My daughter loves going to see Dr. Nicrosi. All the other staff members are great as well!!

name: John Hodgens
text: Great staff!  My kids loving going to the dentist because everyone makes it a fun place visit. Awesome dentist for young kids.

name: Alyssa H.
text: The staff always has smiles on their faces. The environment is stress-free, and my child is never afraid to go to the dentist because they make experience enjoyable and fun. We are always pleased with the care he recieves.

name: Brenna Hollis
text: i’ve been coming here for a long time. i love it! jennifer is definitely my favorite!!

name: Laurie Johnson
text: We have used Dr. Nicrosu for many years and have always been thrilled with the level of service we have received! It’s great when your kids love going to the dentist! ❤️

name: Helen Beasley
text: My kids are never scared to come to the dentist and I know it’s because of the great doctors, hygienist and staff. It’s always a positive and great experience!

text: We love everyone in the office! They’re all super sweet, understanding and take amazing care of our children and their smiles!!

name: Cassandra Mackey
text: The staff is phenomenal there!! From the phone call to confirm I was coming to my appointment to the day I went into the office, they are so sweet over the phone and even nicer in person. I saw Dr.Moore and Dr.Kyatt they both were very kind, caring, and compassionate. They sat with me and explained all of my different options until I completely understood all of my treatment. All of the assistants, hygienist and all of the girls up front and the office manager were so great! The office manager worked with me financially, I was able to pay monthly which really helped. She explained everything in detail. This office is very thorough, professional, and empathetic. Definitely recommend to anyone needing dental work!!! I will never go anywhere else for my dental needs!

resp.text: I'm happy the team took great care of you, Cassandra. I hope you continue to have 5-star visits in the future! Keep smiling. - Mitch, ADMI

name: Vonda Moore
text: Worse dental facility ever. I started off with a really good hygienist and turns out she was the only professional there. I got a root canal and they acted like I was a car on an assembly line and same with my wisdom teeth. You’ll have to look up information on the internet to get real after care instructions because they don’t care. I can’t even count the cancellations. I took off work for a cleaning and guess what? Another cancellation. I don’t understand how they still have customers. I was as patient as I possibly could be.

resp.text: I'm sorry your experience didn't live up to expectations, Vonda. If you would like to share more detail about your visit, the Patient Satisfaction team would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Mitch, ADMI

name: brooke gilliland
text: I love this place! Everyone is so caring and goes above and beyond to help patients needs. Dr. Kyatt and Dr. Moore are wonderful doctors! I would definitely recommend to my friends and family!!

resp.text: It's a joy to hear this, Brooke. I'm glad you've had wonderful experiences with the team and I hope you enjoy your future visits just as much! - Krista, ADMI

name: kevin camp
text: Called with tooth pain.  Talked to a very nice gentleman who got me an appointment in the town I was going THE NEXT DAY!  Everyone from the receptionist at the front desk forward during my visit were EXTREMELY NICE!  Got my teeth cleaned and a filling done THAT DAY!  WILL BE RECOMMENDING THEM AND USING THEM GOING FORWARD!!😊😊😊

resp.text: I'm happy to hear that, Kevin. It’s great that you felt at ease with the team, and I hope that you continue to have 5-star experiences. - Cindy, ADMI

name: Melissa Simmons
text:
If I could  rat this dentist a zero I would I am so horrified at the experience I have had at this place about a month ago I went in and had a root canal done and paid cash money to have it done fast forward to now I called them Tuesday and told them that I was having severe pain in that tooth and I need to see the dentist the lady at the front desk told me that I will have to see the Dentist that perform the root canal this is also the lady that try to charge me $150 for a toothbrush  When I went in to get my teeth clean and asked her why it was so much and she said this is how much we charge for a cleaning and found out later that she had added that $150 on my bill for A toothbrush she know I didn’t  want ((((scam)))the only available dates that they whole have will be next Tuesday I explain to her the severe pain that I was having and that I could not wait till next Tuesday because I didn’t know if it had became infected or what was going on she say I’m sorry but you have to wait till that day To me this is gross negligence I do not understand for the life of me why they could not let the dentist that is on call  look at it to tell me what is going on and why I am having such severe pain it is now Saturday and I am not even able to get out of bed because it hurt so bad it is making my head hurt and the side of my face hurt it has turned black around my tooth I am unable to eat or drink anything  and the sad part about it is it not even hurt this bad before I got the root canal and I paid all that money to fix a problem that is now not even fixed!!!!!!!!  And now I am going to have to pay out more money because I am going to the ER to try to figure out what is going on because I am in so much pain !!!!!!!!! I would like a full refund so I can go to a Dentist that actually cares and don’t just push you out the door after they have gotten your money!!!!!!!! I do not trust this place and I refuse to pay them another dime out of my pocket!!!!!! This needs to be fixed and it needs to be fixed now!!!!!

Update I am now running a high fever on my way to the ER!!!!!!!!!

name: Xavier Cortez
text: The staff was very nice and helpful.  I found the visit was comforting , considering the reason for the visit. The doctor was very good at what he does.  I was given antibiotics for a week before he can remove the molar,  cost was $202.00 to remove the molar.  The initial visit and exray was free of charge. I would definitely recommend Aspen Dental of Gadsden to my friends

resp.text: I'm glad that you felt at ease with the team, Xavier. Thanks so much for sharing that you had a 5-star experience at the Aspen Dental practice in Gadsden. - Emily, ADMI

text: first of all we were there for four hours it was our first visit and was just an initial visit. After my daughter was taken back she was treated rude and talk to you like she was nothing. That would ask her a question and interrupt her in the middle of her trying to answer it. But back to the dentist as far as they go I believe this is where all the title loans and the Advance Cash payment check stores have went to. My daughter's teeth are fine she needed a cleaning and 1 filling before she was getting her braces put on and instead of going to our normal dentist we decided to just get it done faster and go to Aspen Dental. Worst mistake ever all they want is money money money. My daughter's teeth are fine she brushes twice a day she goes to the dentist on a regular basis. They told her she had gum disease and needed to have a gum debrilement before she could even have a cleaning done. It was going to cost us $1,400 And we have the best dental insurance you can get. We get free cleanings and free X-rays and free fillings it's good insurance. These people are quacks and are money hungry and all they want is to charge you for stuff you don't need.

name: Sandy Allen
text: This is the second time I saw the hygienist Renee and she couldn't have been any sweeter actually the whole staff up to dr. Merrill have been incredibly nice

resp.text: I'm happy to hear that, Sandy. Thanks for sharing! - Dawn, ADMI

name: Susan Gifford
text: I just have to say THANK YOU to all the employees at Aspen Dental in Gadsden, Alabama. You have literally given me back my smile. For the last few years, I've been self conscious of how my smile looked, and either hid my mouth with my hand or just didn't smile as much. Now, thanks to their expertise, I am smiling bigger than ever. The entire staff has been extremely caring and so friendly, that there is no reason to dread going to "the dentist"  anymore. Thank you especially to Cassandra, Eric and Ashley!!

resp.text: It makes me so happy to hear that, Susan. Enjoy your new smile! - Emily, ADMI

name: Rey Bryant
text: I had a awesome visit for my first time , the staff is a awesome group of lady's that really know how to treat a patient, I look forward to my return visits !

resp.text: I'm happy to hear this, Roy. It’s so great to hear this about the team, and I hope that you continue to have 5-star experiences. — Dawn, ADMI

name: breneda schmale
text: Wonderful staff and doctors,they take very good care of their patients. Very affordable and excellent quality. I highly recommend you visit them for your dental work.

name: Rita Corona
text: Loved my doctor, very nice and gentle. Explained everything to me as she did it.

resp.text: It's so nice to hear that, Rita. I'm glad the team helped you have a 5-star experience, and I hope you enjoy your future visits just as much. - Michelle, ADMI

name: Emmalee Keef
text: I got text from this office on 12/27/19 that my appointment was at 10:00 I live 45 minutes away from Gadsden. We drove all the way down here to see a paper on the door that says they are closed. Which also we had a appointment to fix the problem yesterday and they didn’t fix the problem with a hour and a half long visit.

name: Lea Johnson
text: I had the best experience ever! They were so amazing! I had an appointment for Monday the 10th, but came in because I was experiencing TERRIBLE tooth pain. They fit me right in and Dr. Singh made sure I was completely comfortable before my procedure and wouldn't let me leave until I wasn't in pain anymore! He explained the procedure in detail and was very helpful! Very gentle dentist! The staff was very helpful and patient. They stayed an hour over closing time to give my root canal. I love Aspen Dental of Gadsden and will continue to go there!

resp.text: It's so nice to hear that, Lea. I'm glad the team helped you have a 5-star experience, and I hope you enjoy your future visits just as much. The office will be so happy to read this.  — Kelly, ADMI

name: Cassie Rhodes
text: This is one of the best dentist offices that I have been to. If you don't have lots of money, no worries. They will work with you and allow you to make payments. Jamie, the lady who handles the financial part of the business is a sweetheart. She was so thorough and patient with me and all my questions. I learned that I am in the early stages of periodontal disease. The dental hygienist, Renae, worked through her lunch break to perform a periodontal treatment on me because I told her it was VERY important that I had it done before the next week. The dentist, listen, you will read reviews saying that she's rude, etc. My goodness, here in the south we tend to be big babies. She isn't rude, at all. She's just very professional and straight to the point. I am sure that she never intended to come across as rude to anyone that's just how she may seem but NOT rude, by any means. I, also, read a lot of reviews where people complained that they tried to force them to buy a toothbrush or only cared to make money. I have a feeling that all of these people, unfortunately, misunderstood a lot. They, too, told me about a certain type of toothbrush and gave me a pamphlet on it. There is nothing wrong with feeling strongly about a toothbrush. Electric toothbrushes clean your teeth and gums far more thoroughly than one that is not. I am sure that the dental hygenist, who recommended the toothbrush to me, doesn't pocket a dime for the people who purchase the toothbrushes. Please don't be misinformed or mislead by other reviews. Give them a try. I am recommending them to you, just like they were recommended to me by a coworker. I will be going back to Aspen Dental! :-)

resp.text: I'm so glad the team helped you have a positive experience, Cassie. I hope you enjoy future visits just as much. - Julie, ADMI

name: Patrick Brown
text:
As soon as I walked in this newer facility, the employees from the front desk attendant to the young lady who did the X-rays made me feel welcomed and glad I made the decision to come there. Ms. Catherine took her time to study my films and make out a plan that would benefit me the most for my dental health.
From Courtney to the district manager they all made me feel at ease.
I have to go back and comment to the X-ray girl. She had a very jovial disposition and had a very professional attitude while making my visit welcoming.
They set up a working plan to correct my issues while taking my time into consideration which is always a big plus to a working person.
In closing, I would recommend Aspen to anyone looking for a dentist and a place that makes you feel at ease and important as well

resp.text: That's so nice to hear, Patrick. It’s great that you felt at ease with the team, and I hope that you continue to have 5-star experiences. - Emily, ADMI

name: Kym Maxwell
text: EVERY member of the staff from the dental assistant to the dentist to the office manager were amazing. I have EXTREME anxiety about the dentist, and they could tell, so they did everything they could to help put me at ease. There was one worker named Sonya and she was ABSOLUTELY wonderful, she was so kind and went above her duty to calm me down. I would HIGHLY recommend Aspen Dental to anyone.

name: Crystal “Nashea” Rolen
text: Very great, friendly, detailed on what they are going to do and will work with you on paying them. I love them!!

name: Cathy Martin
text: I went to my appointment in pain. I left my appointment in pain. They did NOTHING for my pain nor did they do anything for my infected tooth. Not even a prescription.

resp.text: I'm really sorry to hear that, Gemma. If you haven't called the Patient Satisfaction team yet, my team would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Michelle, ADMI

name: Janice Jennings
text: Great service,great staff,i had 3 teeth extractied and they were real good with me.

resp.text: I'm glad that you felt at ease with the team, Janice. Thanks so much for sharing that you had a 5-star experience. - Emily, ADMI

text: My husband went in for a free consultation and we found out today that they charged his insurance $110. It's not gonna make us or break us but thats $110 less than his yearly maximum of $1500 for insurance. Also, when they gave him a quote they where at least double what everyone else charges. Don't use these crooks.

If would like to discuss the care plan you received during your visit or you need any additional care in the future, we’d still be happy to help or address any questions. — Julie, ADMI

name: Bonnie Palmer
text:
Right Now I can't give any Higher.
Once I go back to them this Thursday,  I'll know more about them. ??
My First Visit was Very Nice and Dr Sing and Staff were Very Nice as Will.
It's Just That I Am SCARED TO DEATH of DENTIST. 👹👹👹👹 And the thought of Having All MY teeth pulled at Once is KILLING ME!! 😖😖😖  Please say a Prayer I will get through this and I Promise I Will Let You All Know How it Went and Goes.

name: Marty Jacobs
text: My experience here at Aspen dental was as pleasant as any dentist appt could be. The entire staff is friendly, informative, and not the least bit judgmental.  Everyone made me feel comfortable despite my anxiety, and I would highly recommend them (and have already) to my friends and family. Also the costs are significantly lower than other places I've checked especially without insurance, and they are more than willing to help you in any way possible.  I actually can't wait to go back!

resp.text: It makes me so happy to hear that, Martha. I'm glad you felt at ease with the team, and I hope that you continue to have positive experiences. - Emily, ADMI

name: David Dixon
text: I went as a new patient. I was in pain from a broken tooth. They got me in on the day after I called. I did sit in waiting room for an hour on an 7:15 appointment time, but at least they got me in. They did a complete X-ray and tooth evaluation on all of my teeth. I left there still in pain, but with some scripts for meds to help with the pain. I have another appointment for next week. I hope it doesn’t hurt until then. Thanks for getting me in on short notice as a new patient.

resp.text: Thanks for taking the time to let us know, David! We’ll be sure to pass this along. — Dawn, ADMI

name: michelle Dozier
text: If I could leave NO stars I would.  I visited this location about a year and a half ago and everything was fine.  Had initial appointment where they did Xrays and evaluation and then had four teeth pulled the next day.  Was way overcharged compared to other dentists in the area, but because they were able to extend a credit line I paid the over priced services for relief from tooth pain with little money out of pocket.  Fast forward to today.  I have severe tooth pain that has had me away all night. I called at 7:30 this morning and the lady that took my call offered me appointments starting at 7:45 (which was the earliest appointment and I took it), and then just about every 15 mins increments after that for the rest of the day.  When we got to my name and information, she stated I was already in their system and would need to call back when the office opened to schedule my appointment.  I just called to schedule the appointment and they can not see me until late afternoon. I asked the lady could they not see me this morning, that I was in a lot of pain and had been up all night and she said no, that 2:30 was the earliest they could see me.  So I questioned why "new" patients could be seen as early as 7:45 am and every 15 mins forward, and walk in patients as their website says, can be seen this morning, but existing patients who have already spent a LOT of money with them are not able to be seen until later in the day.  She had no answer other then that is the earliest I could be seen.  Not to mention, even though it has only been a year and a half, I have to do all the exam and Xrays all over again just like a new patient, would not be treated that day for what was hurting and  would have to schedule another appointment to have any work done after the initial appointment.  So this place wants to charge me to complete new patient services, however does not want to give me new patient scheduling times.  I was willing to pay their ridiculous costs because I still have $3000 in credit with their finance company, but I refuse to sit her in pain all day while they schedule new patients in front of me............   Terrible, awful and ungrateful staff and services. Will not recommend and will advise everyone I know against them.

resp.text: I certainly understand your frustration. Please call me at (844) 296-0187 ext. 201706, so I can assist you with this — Dawn, ADMI

name: Jessica Harp
text: My visit was pleasant and more informative than any other dentist's office has been. I've had some horrible experiences with other dental offices and Aspen Dental is the dental office that is now repairing and fixing the horrible dental work I've received in my past. My first visit I received more xrays and examination than I've ever received elsewhere. They are very thorough and take the time to explain all of your options to you. The lady dentist I spoke with was so helpful in helping me make the right choice for the dental work that I need to have done.

resp.text: Thank you, Jessica, for sharing this outstanding informaton! I will be sure to pass it along! Tammy ADMI

name: Kaci Watts
text: My visit here was nothing short of uncomfortable and unprofessional. I arrived early for my appointment with my new patient paperwork, dental insurance card and valid I.D. in hand when I arrived. My appointment was scheduled for 7 a.m. and I was not called back until 7:40. After my exam the office manager told me they wouldn't be able to clean my teeth that day that I'd have to reschedule after my appointment was for a cleaning. Fast forward to the check out process and the office manager informed me for 2 fillings and a cleaning would cost me $370.00 (this is with my dental insurance) well turns out the only thing I would actually owe would be right at $60.00!!!! They tried charging me $135 for a toothbrush and $52.00  cancer screening I never even asked for! Very rude and inconsiderate of your time!!

name: Mary Harper
text: This is the worse dental place I have ever been to.. You get over charged for everything. I looked at the papers they have me and they charged me 3 and 4 times for the same thing, then told me that the teeth cleaning is charged for each quadrant of my teeth. This was never explained to me and I have never been to a dentist that charged that way, they did the same thing that other dentist do, and charged me for each quadrant of my teeth, said I had a gum disease, my gums are pushed up over my enamel on my teeth caused from me over brushing them, and brushing them the wrong way,, I did this when I was a child and brushed my teeth 8 to 10 times a day, because my Mom's teeth were so bad and I have seen her in so much pain from bad teeth, so I was over brushing my teeth. I was told that everything would be charged through Genesis Credit, I got a card from the credit company and never activated it... But they don't tell you that the charges are for your first visit only.. Then get the bill and for the few things they did my bill was $1013 and some change.. I went to only get a filling done on a tooth and the dentist was drilling out my tooth that needed filled and kept bouncing off my tooth he was drilling on and kept bouncing off my tooth and hitting a tooth behind the one he was working on, so now I have the tooth he kept hitting with the drill that has to be filled.. I was suppose to go back to get my 2nd cleaning and I was told I would have to pay them in cash for it, then found out that it had already been charged on the credit company, so there they thought they were going to get paid twice,, so Aspen Dental was going to make you pay 2 times for the same thing, as they did on my bill... I was told that the special mouth rinse and special toothpaste was included with the Oral B toothbrush kit, and looked on my papers and was charged 3 and 4 times each for the mouth rinse and toothpaste.. This is the worse dental place I have ever been to... And I have called the Customers Care line and am told they would have someone call me by tomorrow, I have been told this for several times, and the ones that call me tell me to call back if they haven't called me within 2 days, to call them back.. I have been calling them since right after I had my dental appointment and got the paperwork on all the charges and I almost fell over,, I was lied to by the employees, the dentist, and customer care... This is ridiculous... Aspen Dental is a ripoff.. Everyone I have talked to that has been there has nothing good to say about Aspen Dental in Gadsden Alabama.. I have tried to get this straighten out about being overcharged on what was done, and am always told if you don't hear back from me in 2 days, to call back, I have been doing this for months, and they have done nothing to resolve this problem... So my advice to everyone that is bringing about going to Aaron Dental in Gadsden Alabama DON'T USE THEM, THEY ARE CROOKS!!!!!!!...This is the sorriest place I have ever been to... I'm trying to get this straighten out or I'm going to turn them in to the Better Business Bureau, and see if they can do something about them!!!!!!

text: I made an appointment for getting cosmetic dental work done,  which would be a cash transaction.  On the day of the appointment,  I received a text saying that the appointment was canceled. I was told that  they had been too short staffed the day before and had had to close the office because of it. A new appointment was made for the following week.  Day of the appointment,  same thing happened,  only this time in addition to not enough staff, the dentist also did not show. What kind of business is this? I'm sitting here with cash business and can't get seen. This is a bad sign for me; i am taking my business elsewhere

name: Konnie Taylor
text: Came in knowing I had several cavities that would need to be filled. Was seen fairly quickly and the cavities confirmed but told I have an infection that needs to be treated before the fillings. Left with an estimate but no antibiotics, cleaning or fillings. I came out no better than I went in. Really was actually a waste of two hours of my day to be honest. I won't be returning.

resp.text: I certainly understand your frustration Konnie. I am sorry the team did not address your concern and should have explained our new patient visit. Our new patient appointment includes x-rays and full comprehensive exam with the doctor and hygienist, to determine and discuss any treatment that may be needed. If you need any additional care in the future or would like to discuss the care plan you had received during your last visit, we’d still be happy to help. You can reach me directly at (315) 454-6000 ext. 201526. — Kelly, ADM

name: Logan Holfelder
text: Great people, the day I went was little busy which probably explains why i was there from 7-10. They were only able to do my cleaning and had to reschedule my filling due to them closing at 12.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing Logan, we appreciate the kind words and value your feedback. — Kelly, ADMI

name: Darlene Harcrow
text: The staff was GREAT, BUT the price was ASTRONOMICAL!!!!  The price I was quoted with my insurance was $6400 and that was without a partial.  I went to another local dentist in the area and with the price of a partial with my insurance, my out of pocket cost is $710. Apple to Apple comparison,  The only thing different was the local dentist was only pulling one wisdom tooth and repairing one of the other ones, the other 2 were perfectly fine with no cavities, but Aspen wanted to pull them all.  And Aspen quoted doing an entire deep clean on my mouth with 21 day round of permanent antibiotics in my gum, NOT, and the other dentist said it looked like only one quadrant may need to be deep cleaned but that because of a bad tooth in that quadrant, you could get a false reading, so we needed to pull that one and then access the deep cleaning at my next cleaning.  Was told by the local dentist that my teeth were in good condition just needed some cavities filled and 2 teeth pulled.    So great staff or not, the money difference is not worth the visit.

text: Everyone was very nice, caring and considerate. Nice, clean and comfortable setting. The only negative thing I can think of is how long we were there. I would still return and refer others to Aspen Dental in Gadsden, Alabama.

name: Samantha borders
text: Just want to start by saying these people only want your money. This facility is very new and clearly they need to meet there quota to pay it off. Staff is very nice but when it comes to experience and knowing what they are doing, the lack all of the above. Went to have a simple cleaning and they tell me I have a gum disease. Ok, fair enough I use to smoke so it happens. So I proceed to allow them to do the procedure but wait first I had to pay $180 before I could have any treatment which to my understanding was suppose to cover everything and my insurance cover the rest. Then we go on. They say one of my back teeth js decaying and needs to be uprooted. I allow it to happen because I had bothered me for years. In the most of pulling the tooth the dentist breaks the bone off that holds the tooth in process of pulling it. I told him multiple times before pulling it that I would soon be getting braces and I didn't want that to affect it. Well now that has caused issue with getting braces. So on, I have cavities. A total different dentist is doing this procedure days later. He and the women helping carried on the whole time and was more focused on there conversation than fixing my Cavaties. That being said he didn't fill the tooth the complete way so now I have sensitivity for sweet hot and cold things. The other day I get a bill from them. $172 it was. Going back to the gym disease. I had to "pay everything up front" before I could have the procedure done right. At least that's what the lady said. I just got off the phone with them. They begin to tell me the bill is only $126.??? So why did I get billed $50 more than that. Or better question why am I even being billed period when I supposedly had to pay everything that my insurance didn't cover up front.??? Absolute worst experience and place to go. Don't waste your time or your money.

resp.text: Hi Samantha, I'm so sorry to hear this. I encourage you to let the Patient Satisfaction team at 1-866-273-8606 know about your experience so they can address concerns. If unresolved, they can also help with billing issues. - Emily, ADMI

name: Jennifer Gibson
text: My daughter has been seeing Dr. Curtis since she was  4 weeks old when we had to get her tongue tie revised. As a new mom of course I was nervous about the revision but Dr. Curtis was very professional  and gave us great advice about how to care for my daughter and her teeth. We have been seeing them every 6 months since then and Dr. Curtis has always been just as professional and caring. Yesterday was my daughters 2 year old appointment and even though my daughter was scared of someone else brushing her teeth, Dr. Curtis was very quick and efficient at cleaning her teeth and singing a special baby shark song to make her feel more comfortable. I keep reading reviews about how people are saying Dr. Curtis is mean or unprofessional and I honestly have a hard time believing it. I would recommend his office to anyone looking for a pediatric dentist. He is quick, efficient, knowledgeable, and caring and has been with my daughter for the last 2 years. We look forward to every visit!

name: The Stever’s
text: Do not like this doctor at all very judgmental not good fit for our family

name: Sarah Mitchell
text: My child was a patient here about 2 years ago so this is a late review but running across this, I want to share because our experience was terrible. My daughter is terrified of going to the dentist. Dr. Curtis knew this coming in and still was not comforting or compassionate at all. He was ill the entire time with her. You can’t have a scared child do what you want them to do if you’re cold towards them the entire time. Being a pediatric dentist, this should be normal to him but between my experience and other reviews it’s clear he lacks patience for children. He made me feel at fault for her reaction to him when it was clearly his demeanor. The dental assistant was no help either. She wouldn’t hardly speak and when she did it was very direct.  He went on to tell me that he will not take my daughter as a patient as they weren’t a good fit. I was okay with this as my mind was already made up that I would never bring her back anyway. That was the only thing we were in agreement about. I would never recommend this office to anyone and hope some will take this review into consideration before choosing to call this place.

name: Caitlyn Roberts
text: I usually don’t give reviews but after my experience with Dr. Curtis today and reading other reviews I feel like I should. The very first visit back in June to get my sons teeth cleaned for the first time Dr. Curtis was very nice and patient but my son was very calm and did everything that was asked of him. So we’ve had to wait two months to try and get a cap on my sons tooth because of scheduling. which is fine but after all that happened we didn’t even get to have it done. It was my sons first time being in an actual dentist chair and laying down. So obviously he was scared. Between the very sweet hygienist and I we calmed my son down and got him to lay down. But once Dr. Curtis came in he got scared again. I would get my son calm and laid down but if my son even moved Dr. Curtis would start to get frustrated and tried to be stern with my son. My son is 4 so every time Dr. Curtis would try to talk stern to him  and tell him he couldn’t talk to me, my son just had tears pouring. Dr. Curtis just kept telling my son he needed to talk to him that I was going to have to leave if he wanted to talk to me. So it just made my son scared. Dr. Curtis finally got mad and just said okay it’s not going to work. He can come back and try this again when he’s older and more mature. Didn’t even get the laughing gas on my son. He wasn’t even kicking or screaming. He was just crying and wanted to sit up to be with me. I didn’t want to force my son to do it but I wish Dr. Curtis would’ve handled it better and had more patience and wouldn’t have just stormed out. I’m giving it two stars because all of the women/staff/hygienist are wonderful. They never once got upset and were so sweet to us. When they decided to paint my sons teeth to kill the bacteria he didn’t cry once for them. However it was $120 to have this other procedure done.I don’t think we will be going back after this experience.

name: Chiera Cominotto
text: Fantastic dentist! So friendly, informative and good with kids!

name: Christina Holcomb
text:
Been seeing Dr. Curtis since my son was born! He has always been great. Unfortunately I have to dive my kids a hour to see him. Upon arriving for my 10 year old daughter (who is scared) to get a tooth pulled for the first time. I had no one to leave my 4 year old with! My mother was out of state, due to my grandmother having a stroke. My husband, father, and brother all work out of state. So it wasn't ideal to take him to watch his sister, but I didn't have a choice. Doctor said it was an extra tooth that needed to come out soon or her mouth was going to become over crowded. We was greeted at the door and they said due to covid my daughter would have to go by herself or we would have to leave. My daughter was already in tears when we showed up, from being scared. I even told them I didn't have a choice, but to bring him. They turned my child and I away!!! Then my daughter left crying because when we was there on the 5th just 9 days ago, the doctor stressed the importance of getting her tooth out!!! This was an extenuating circumstance that they could of handled completely differently, and have chosen not to.
We are looking for a new dentist!!!

name: Jess Darby
text: Very knowledgeable! Using him as our regular pedi dentist and to revise my youngest's tongue tie. Conservative with treatment, which I love. Very happy at this practice!

name: Lorrie Eakes
text: I would not recommend this office to anyone. My three-year-old grandson was referred to this dentist office and unfortunately his appointment was scheduled on the day his mom had to be in the hospital to Welcome his baby sister to the world. So unfortunately we had to cancel his dentist appointment. We had to wait for his mom to get over having a new baby to reschedule his appointment. We rescheduled the appointment and then by the time the appointment arrive to covid- 19 has already set in. Once again unfortunately we had to cancel his appointment due to we had not been taking the children out in public to keep them safe. We called and explained this to the dentist. They said okay call back and reschedule when everything is better. Today we tried to reschedule my grandson's appointment and are told they're not going to take him in this office because we canceled to appointment. This is just ridiculous. With the covid-19 virus around us everywhere and they can have no compassion for the fact that we wanted to keep our little ones safe. I guess I should say I am glad they did this after reading the reviews of how sorry their service is we might of dodged a bullet.

name: Racheal Lamar
text: My daughter had to have tongue and lip tie release when she was 8 days old. We were referred by my lactation consultant. I was terrified, but Dr. Curtis did an amazing job.  His knowledge and guidance helped me feel better about the procedure and healing process.  When I took her back at 6 months old, he was great with her.  I am looking forward to our 1 year check up in a couple of days.  I would recommend Dr. Curtis to anyone with young children.

name: Melissa Jarrard
text: I had high hopes with the good reviews I saw a year ago. We had awful experiences here with my 7 year old. I would not recommend this dentist to anyone. We questioned his way of doing things (doing mostly caps and a few fillings) and he did not like it. From then on he completely ignored me when I sat back with my child. He pretended I didn’t exist, not even a good morning. Wouldn’t tell me what would be done that day, which I specifically asked for. I am my child’s parent and I need to know what they are going to be doing before they start! He got very frustrated and stormed off multiple times. He does not seem to have patience with certain children, like mine, who are very anxious. We have since found a wonderful, CARING dentist who cares about my child’s feelings and actual dental health and who respects me as the parent. We were ejected from Dr. Curtis’s practice after it was made known I was unhappy with my treatment there. They had scheduled oral surgery for my daughter who desperately needed it. They let me keep that appt for 1.5 months and ejected us from the practice ONE WEEK before her scheduled surgery. Leaving us high and dry for her to suffer with the giant hole in her tooth left by Dr. Curtis until we could finally get her into another dentist. Find anyone else.

name: Amanda Thomas
text: I generally don’t leave bad reviews, but this business has two strikes with terrible customer service. When I tried to reschedule an appointment, nobody answered the phone for several days. It turns out the staff left for training in another state and did not notify patients or leave a message stating they would be gone for a few days. Later that week, I received a voicemail of someone apologizing for lack of notice upon leaving because "they were rushing out the door trying not to miss their flight." However, the appointment was never rescheduled, and being the busy mom that I am, I routinely confirmed the appointment by text. I knew I was not able to take my daughter myself, so my mom agreed to take her but ended up thinking it was for the next day. I called this morning to reschedule and was told that they would not reschedule me. Since they were not able to charge my insurance because my daughter has Medicaid, they said they would have to refer me to someone else because of ONE no show. And because "they have strict policies." This would have been our second visit. I understand if this was a consistent problem with no shows, but this was an honest mistake. No showing is not what I do, and I’m usually very punctual. For a business who specializes in pediatric care, they should be more forgiving. Because of all this, I'm more than happy to go somewhere else. The customer service here is something to be desired.

name: Stephen Rice
text: Our three kids, believe or not, actually enjoy going to the dentist now and are very comfortable here. Dr. Curtis educates the kids (and parents) really well and interacts with them really great. We've even started taking our infant to him and so glad that he specializes in this. We are so happy we found Dr. Curtis, and although it is a 45 min drive for us, it is well worth it!

name: C H
text: Couldn't speak more highly of Dr Curtis and his staff. Though the location is tough for me (I live an hour away), it is a wonderful enviroment for your little ones. Dr Curtis is thoughtful, reassuring and engaging with his patients and his staff have always been very kind and helpful.

name: Bellagrace The baddie
text: My child had a serious infection from his previous work on a tooth... She was there to get it pulled & screamed & was scared.. He numbed her mouth and gave her relaxing medication at the same time he got furious and took off his glove and his impatience self walked out & left my child with her mouth Infected & Gave Up within 5min.. Did suggest she quickly go to the Emergency or Anything just walked out... Sad

name: Kate Smith
text: Exceptionally rude office staff.

name: Lawyer Momof5
text: Ive been through several dentists in and out of state and there are so many things wrong with this dentist. First, he doesnt listen to parent’s concerns, argues with and berates you in front of his staff for disagreeing with his suggested invasive course of action. Second, he undermines your parental authority in front of your children (i told my child he couldnt get a toy reward and he said “yes you can”) Third, he is inexperienced. Because of Dr. Curtis limited experience, he cancelled a cavity procedure after we travelled an hour to be there and he already gave my son gas and partially injected him with anesthesia. He was not willing or able to work with a kids’ normal behavior on a dentist chair. I finally found an experienced dentist in Birmingham who took two sessions with my son what Dr. Curtis said would need general anesthesia procedure in a surgical center that is not even connected with a children’s hospital.

name: Linda Benson
text: Dr. Curtis and his staff are amazing! My children were terrified of the dentist and cried when it was time to go. They were so uncooperative that the pediatric dentist in the shoals area didn't want to see them. Thankfully we found Dr Curtis. It is over an hour drive for us but very worth it. My for year old actually begs to go see him. He also did dental surgery on her and it looks amazing!!

name: Mrs. S
text: We have gone here for years with no problems. Office ladies are great and my children actually like going to the dentist. Changing my stars due to last appt. There was a different vibe with the dr this time. His interaction was different with them too. We all have hard days so I was willing to chalk it up to that. At the end of my appointment though, my children got a clean bill of health and then Dr. Curtis suggested that all of my children (ages newborn to 2nd grade) get a frenulectomy. This was out of the blue as I had not expressed any type of concerns to him nor had he on any previous visits.  When I asked him why he was suggesting this I could not find a valid reason for any of them. He asked a lot of questions about my baby nursing (kind of awkward to be honest) but my babe had no problems nursing so I still didn't see a need.  He wasn't rude about it,  just very firm in his belief that all children should have full range of tongue (meaning that piece of skin under the tongue should be cut all the way back to the muscle) and this was a necessary procedure. It completely contradicted what our pediatric specialist said when my older child was a baby and needed a little help to latch. I expressed this to Dr. Curtis and he did not agree.  I will say, I was talking with a friend who is now successfully breastfeeding and she credits Dr. Curtis for that. As for my children though, I still cannot find a valid reason to have this procedure done. Dr. Curtis would make a good profit from them, but I wont put my children through anything unnecessary.   I can agree to disagree, just not a fan of the vibe.

name: Deanna Patterson
text: We love Dr. Curtis and his staff they are so helpful and sweet and take their time helping you feel safe and also not pressured to have things done a certain way like you have to let me see your teeth before i can brush them or vise versa they are amazing at keeping my 3 year old calm and not scared!!!

name: Adam Garnick
text: Dr Curtis and his staff are the best in the business; went well above and beyond other practices to take care of my familly. I cannot speak highly enough about them!

text: Extremely patient and kind with my babies, my autistic daughter was terrified of the dentist, he has slowly worked with her and now she will go back with out screaming😍 Highly recommended!!

text: We love our dentist! The staff is very nice and sweet and always makes my kids feel welcomed. We moved about 6 years ago and still make the drive to continue to use them! Well worth the drive.

text: We had been on the search for a new pediatric dentist, after having a poor experience elsewhere. We found Dr. Hurst’s office through our insurance search and I am so glad we did. Dr. Hurst and his staff are absolutely wonderful. They were knowledgeable with a few of my teeth/gum concerns and helped with an ortho referral.

name: Rebekah Hewett
text: Took my kids for their first appointment and it could not have been a better experience. They keep asking if they can go back! The staff was incredibly sweet and patient. They came highly recommended and I totally see why!

name: Stephanie Hester
text: I took my baby to Dr. Hurst for her first dentist visit! I was so impressed with the staff! They made her feel so comfortable and made it a very fun experience for her!

name: Jessica Saylor
text: Dr. Hurst is a great children's dentist. He's kind, funny, and most importantly patient. He takes care to make sure my child is at ease. His staff is great too. They are really friendly and welcoming. I would recommend Dr. Hurst to any parent looking for a dentist for their child.

name: Imurpant0mime
text: I brought my two youngest kids in for cleanings and one of my boys had a pretty bad cavity. He has super bad anxiety about the dentist and Dr. Hurst was absolutely AMAZING with him and took care of us 100%! Appointments aren't scheduled too far out and we are always seen quickly, no long wait times. I went ahead and scheduled my older kids to be seen as well. We love the receptionist and Dr. Hurst and the lady who cleaned their teeth, I believe her name was Elle. :) awesome people and great with little kids! I would DEFINITELY recommend to friends and family!

name: Ashley Whitaker
text: Very friendly, gentle staff. Makes your child’s first experience enjoyable and they do not force them to do anything they are uncomfortable with at first.

name: Cynthia Parnell
text: My children absolutely love coming here to have their teeth cleaned! The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. There is never a long wait.  Once, we had to reach out to Dr. Hurst after hours for a dental emergency and he responded to us in less than five minutes.

name: Cynthia Parnell
text: My children absolutely love coming here to have their teeth cleaned! The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. There is never a long wait.  Once, we had to reach out to Dr. Hurst after hours for a dental emergency and he responded to us in less than five minutes.

name: Bethaney Gallagher
text: Dr Hurst is Great! He is always very attentive and pays attention to little details. All of our children get excited when it is time to go see the dentist! Couldn't be happier! We've recommended Dr Hurst & his staff to many of our friends & will continue to do so

name: Deanna Barkley
text: Dr. Hurst and his staff are so caring. They always include the children in their visit to help them feel more comfortable. All 3 of my kids love going to the dentist because of them!

name: Paige Meyer
text: My kids love going to the dentist.  Dr. Hurst mkes it so easy and fun.  He was also quick to see my son when we had a minor dental emergency.  I highly recommend Dr. Hurst and his staff.

name: Mona Dean
text: I have taken my son Brett to Dr. Hurst for 6 years now and have always had a very good experience.  Everyone, from the receptionist to the dental hygentists, is professional, courteous and friendly.  Dr. Hurst is top notch, so patient, and explains everything in great detail. We wouldn't go anywhere else!

name: Keri Adams
text: Dr. Hurst is an excellent dentist who practices dentistry with care and compassion. I have especially appreciated his gentle nature when my kids have had to have teeth extracted. Dr. Hurst and his staff deliver excellent patient care and set their patients at ease with their wonderful “chairside” manner.

name: Lenzy Tipton
text: A very patient hygienist worked with us during our first appointment but for the second appointment neither the hygienist or Dr. Hurst was very patient with my small child. The hygienist said my son was spoiled because he had a hard time during his appointment and Dr. Hurst snapped his fingers at him and told him he would send me to the waiting room (which he did not). My son was 2 years old at the time and we stopped using this practice after this last appointment. The waiting area is super cute though.

name: Angela
text: They are the best!!! Everyone there is great. My 12 yo has Downs and is terrified of dentist due to horrible past experience. Dr. Hurst, his assistant, and the hygienist are so calming with her. Highly recommended

name: Rebekah Hewett
text: Took my kids for their first appointment and it could not have been a better experience. They keep asking if they can go back! The staff was incredibly sweet and patient. They came highly recommended and I totally see why!

text: Dr Lovell and staff are absolutely fabulous. I have taken my daughter there since she was 6. He has seen us through extractions and cavities and supported us through braces. Cannot recommend enough. A true find!

I am so happy we found Lovell pediatric dentistry.
My son has a rare genetic disorder that requires a lot of dental work over his lifetime. Finding a Dentist to be there at the start of the journey was so important to me as I also share the condition. I wanted to provide a better experience than I had growing up. Over the last couple of years Doctor Lovell has been there providing guidance and reassurance. Most recently providing a life changing surgery for my son. I cannot thank Doctor Lovell and his staff enough!

name: LP
text: My son and daughter both see Dr. Sanchez.  She is so great with them.  Very patient and understanding.  She also has a very positive and upbeat attitude and it really helps calm the little ones and keep things light when they are anxious about treatment.  The rest of her staff is great as well!  They are wonderful with children.

name: Ethan Forrest
text: Always a positive and fast experience. Always feel like my teeth have the best possible care. Highly recommend.

name: Brandi Huguet
text:
The office was very polite, and have areas set up for the children to play. The low rating is for how the staff and dentist treated myself and my daughter. My 4 1/2 year old does really well with doctor offices and dentist as long as things are explained and she knows what to expect. For instance, she doesn’t cry when she gets a shot because she knows it coming and knows what to expect. I do understand that medical professionals need to do their job and get the information needed. I respect medical personnel and have good relationship with all my providers and my girls’ providers.
So why the low rating. For starters the moment we walked in to the examination room, the assistant shoved an iPad in my daughters face without my consent. Again, my daughter is very curious and likes to ask question and know whats going on. During the exam, the assistant kept asking my daughter questions, while she’s watching this show (expecting a 4 year old to multitask, wonderful). My daughter was great during the exam, everything was fine until the X-rays. The staff outright lied and said it wouldn’t hurt. They made me and my youngest daughter leave the room for the x-rays, which i was already uncomfortable with. After the first three x-rays, i hear screams on the last X-ray. I wanted to go in to calm her and help her through it but was not allowed. I saw two more nurses go in and heard more screaming... if i hadn’t had my 1 year old with me i would have burst in there; even now I feel horrible for not doing so. Anyway, after they got the final X-rays the dentist and assistant came back in to check her teeth. Of course she lost trust in them and was freaking out. I was trying to calm her down while they were talking over me and physically restraining my daughter without my consent. I signaled them to back off while i talked to her and calmed her down. We will never return there. I wish I would have just walked in there during the X-rays , grabbed her, and walked out. I DO NOT think it is acceptable in non emergency situations to hold a child down like they did, especially without my consent.

name: Tom Wilson
text: Really wish I could put zero stars. Completely unprofessional. My daughter's appointment was scheduled for 9:30. They called after 8am asking if I could bring her in 30 minutes early for her appointment. I made the necessary adjustments to get her from school earlier. I arrived at 8:47. Before I was done signing in the receptionist was already requesting payment for a service yet to be provided. I expressed my reluctance but paid anyway. Was told to sit in the waiting room and wait. After watching the receptionist play on her phone and scroll through yahoo news for a 40 minutes I finally went to the desk and asked if the dentist would be ready anytime soon. She went and ask and told me that the dentist wouldnt be ready for another 30 to 40 minutes! I was furious that they called me in early just to tell me they were running late and at no point were they ever gonna let me know. I asked if they needed to reschedule my daughter and the woman could only say "I dont know...do you?." I finally had enough and said yes to reschedule for Oct. 3rd and demanded a refund of my money they were so eager to take. After waiting over 3 weeks for my daughters appointment they sent a letter saying she had been released from their practice. All because I called them out on their unprofessional practices. Do not take your children here! Worst staff ever.

name: Chickadee
text: I love Dr Sanchez. She is so kind and patient with my daughter. She takes her time and answers questions I may have. Her staff is very nice

name: Phyllis Jones
text: Poor professionalism! My daughter has rescheduled 3 appts with this Bessemer dental office. On the fourth try, which is today, she failed and No one bothered to reach out and call and/or text yo let her know anything. She missed making money because of bad service. My grandson has two cavities to be extracted. Our patience has been exhausted. We in the process of looking for another dentist office that cares.

resp.text:
Hello Phyllis,

We sincerely apologize for any frustration that may have been caused. Your families dental health is of the most importance to us. A member of our team will be in touch with you shortly to see what we can do to improve for you and others dental experiences at our practice.

Regards,
Sarrell Dental

name: Aakre Mahan
text: My daughter went to get her eyes examined on August 27, 2014.  The optometrist recommended that she needed glasses. So we placed our order.  The receptionist stated that the glasses should be back within two weeks and that they would contact me once they got in. Well................. It is now November 4, 2014 and my daughter has not yet received her eye glasses.  I have called twice to see if they have come into the office and every time I call they tell me that they have not come in yet.  They have not even tried to compensate us at all!!! I would not recommend Sarrel Dental Center to anyone. VERY VERY VERY POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE.  I am taking my child to another eye clinic. Tried to give them a chance with the office being fairly new.  BUT I MADE A HUGE MISTAKE. They are surely getting off to a HORRIBLE start.

name: Vanessa skripko
text: Their database got hacked and ever since they have been just mean. I called in August for a cleaning the first appointment available was Dec. 23 I forgot what time. I keep calling to check the time they won't answer. I asked to be put on a waiting list for the first opening and that obviously didn't happen. Just ugggh get my kids information hacked and now can't treat us professional.

resp.text: Vanessa, this location is permanently closed. Please send an email to feedback@greatdentalplans.com with your contact information and a member of our team will be in touch.  Thank you.

name: Daya Cruz
text: WISH I COULD LEAVE A ZERO, WENT TO GET A CLEANING HERE WHEN I WAS 18 WAS TOLD I HAD 2 CAVITIES THT NEEDED FILLED ASAP, I MADE THE APPT AND DUE TO WORK CONFLICTS I CANCELLED THE APPT. I ENDED UP CHANGING DENTISTS BC OF MY AGE (I DIDNT WANT TO CONTINUE GOING TO A PEDIATRIC DENTIST), WHEN I GOT MY CLEANING DONE I EXPECTED THE DOCTOR TO TELL ME I HAD CAVITIES (SINCE I DID NOT GO BACK TO FILL THEM HERE) HOWEVER THE DOCTOR TOLD ME I HAD NO CAVITIES. I MENTIONED TO THE DOCTOR THAT THIS LOCATION TOLD ME I HAD 2 CAVITIES AND DID NOT GET THEM FILLED. DOCTOR TOLD ME I DID NOT HAVE ANY CAVITIES AND THAT THIS LOCATION (BASED OFF WHAT I TOLD HIM) BASICALLY LIED TO ME TO GET $$ ... AFTER EXPERIENCING THIS I TALKED TO  PEOPLE THAT WENT TO THIS LOCATION BEFORE AND THEY ALSO SAID THEY HAD THE SAME ISSUE, I WOULD DEFINITLY NOT RECCOMMEND THIS DENTIST TO ANYONE. THEY DONT CARE ABOUT YOU THEY CARE ABOUT THE MONEY , ON TOP OF THAT IT IS SO HARD TO CONTACT SOMEONE HERE , TAKES FOREVER TO REACH SOMEONE HAVE TO CALL 5 TIMES BEFORE I CAN GET SOMEONE ON THE PHONE..... DO NOT GO HERE .

resp.text: Daya, If you'd like to talk with a member of our team, please send an email with your contact information to feedback@greatdentalplans.com and we will be in touch. Thank you.

text: Jennifer is the BEST in T-town. She’s a very caring, professional. She takes care of her customers and treats you like family. I highly recommend her!!

text: I was terrified to go to the dentist. Dr. Bennett and his staff were extremely empathetic. They took time to explain in detail exactly what they were doing and were very patient with me. name: Kitty Katt
text: This is literally the best dentist I have ever seen.  I am usually very nervous about seeing the dentist and I have had some pretty horrible experiences in the past with the dentist. I also have a few medical issues that make it even worse, so I am so hesitant on going. I had to though due to a cracked tooth and I was looking for a dentist near me. I came across Capstone many times by searching online and asking around. So, I called and scheduled. Boy, am I glad that I picked Capstone! This is the best dentist around and I actually want to go there again! The staff is so awesome, each and every one. And the Dr., she is a miracle worker! The sweetest most understanding and gentle dentist I have ever seen. I had a tooth extracted, and for once in my life, it went so well that I was not scared at all. Not to mention that I was in no pain. She did such a great job and took such good care of me. She even reassured me that if I had any concerns, I could call her anytime. Thank you so much Capstone dental, you are truly a blessing!

text:
This is an awesome dental practice. Dr Dixon and colleta are really great. Thank you for my dental care.

text: Dr. Bennett is absolutely awesome....My husband and I are so appreciative of his kindness and the kindness of the staff.❤️

text:
It's a bit hard to find, being tucked up in the back of a strip mall located off the highway, and requires a U-turn to get to if you're coming from the school. The location has baffled more than a few of my uber drivers.

But the service itself is great; the office is very clean and pretty, the staff are polite and prompt, and the service is ideal. They haven't yet tried to upsell me some braces, so that gets them a five star rating in my book.

text: I have been going here for years they are always polite, professional, and always happy to help you with your dental needs. I highly recommend choosing Capstone Dental.

name: Dana Farrar
text: Great dentist and hygienists. They are very safe and clean. My family and I have gotten excellent care from Dr. Dickson and her staff for everything from routine cleanings to mouth guards to very complex reconstruction with porcelain veneers. Always very attentive and great results!

name: Ted Waldrop
text: This has been a great practice for me and my family for several years. Very friendly staff, great hygenist and I love my dentist. Dr. Dickson is the best!

name: Mia G
text: Capstone Dental Care has been wonderful over the last 2 years that I have been seeing them. They are always available for last minute emergency dental work. They are not condescending, which is great for those that are scared of dentists. They offer an in house insurance plan and have waived some costs, which is great for those that don’t have dental insurance.

name: T. P.
text: Awesome experience. Coletta did an excellent job with my cleaning.

name: Ginger Kizziah
text: Great friendly staff! Yall go see Kassidy!

name: Jim Roebuck
text: Dr. Dixon (and Dr. Bennet) and the staff of Capstone Dental Care are FANTASTIC!!!.  Their work is excellent.  I could not be more please with the new "bridge" installed by Dr. Dixon and totally appreciate the consideration and accommodation of the entire staff.  I highly recommend CDC.

name: Michelle Lewis
text: You’ll are the best. Very professional, clean , and etc!!!

name: Shanda Johnson
text: I had the best experience at Capstone. I was extremely anxious due to a previous horrible dental experience 5 years ago at another dental office. So I basically avoided the dentist for 5 years. I had this horrible toothache for 3 weeks and been to the ER to try and get some relief. My sis in law uses Capstone and took me there this morning. From the moment I walked in I knew this was going to be the day I finally get some help. The entire staff was extremely professional and treated me like family. Dr. Bennett spoke to me and explained everything thoroughly. Everyone went above and beyond to help me. I HIGHLY recommend them. You won’t regret it!!! Thanks again for everything!!!!

name: Robert McMillan
text: My wife and I are always made to feel welcome at Capstone Dental Care , the staff is always friendly and professional and provide exceptional services. The facility is always clean and up to date.

text: They took very good care of me!  I highly recommend!

name: Dameeta Burton
text:
Capstone is the best! The staff are so nice and friendly. Capstone will always be my #1.
I never had an bad experience the job are always well done. Try Capstone for yourself, I promise you won't regret it!!!

name: Cassandra Sommerville
text: Capstone Dental did an excellent job on my cleaning and procedure. They were so helpful in referring me to an Orthro and I was able to get braces right away! Go #TeamCapstone!!!

text: Capstone Dental is an amazing establishment, Kassidy is phenomenal , Dr Dickson is equally impressive ,and the team members are super friendly and welcoming, I couldnt ask for a better experience. Thank you all for the professional and talented treatment !

text: The staff was very friendly, courteous, and professional. Even when my numbing started to wear off, they noticed and fixed it immedietly. Thank you for all your help.

name: Katie Reeves
text: Best experience I've ever had with a Dental Office. The front office was extremely accommodating for my schedule and quick to get me in and out. My Hygienist, Stephanie, was very friendly and efficient. After my cleaning, I was scheduled for a filling immediately after and the dentist was very through and quick. She made sure to let me know if I had any issues at all I needed to call her and they would take care of it immediately. I will be going back to them every time I need any dentist work.

name: courtnie young
text: Best place ever! I have never been a fan of the dentist and have always had a very big fear of getting any work done, but Dr. Dickson and her assistant Kassidy always make me feel right at home when I’m there and take the best care of me. I can now officially say that I have overcame my fear of the dentist and actually look forward to seeing them now! I couldn’t ask for a better office!

text: If you like being in a calm and welcoming atmosphere well Capstone Dental is the place to be. I had to cancel an appointment because of death in my family, out of the kindness of the staffs heart they sent me a sympathy card😍. I am forever grateful for them👌🏽. They get you in and out in no time. Thank you Capstone

name: Crystal Taylor
text: Waited for 2 hours in the car for my daughter to get a cleaning. Please don't waste your time or money at this place. Go to West Alabama Dental.

name: Jay Clemmons
text: John and his staff are the most professional group I have encountered in the medical professional. His work on my teeth has changed my life, my look and enhanced my self-esteem. I could not recommend him and his staff more strongly. If you are looking for anything in dental, I would only consider Dr. John Bennett and his group.

name: Bailey Connor
text: The second I walk through the door each time, I feel welcomed. My dental hygienist and dentist are always asking about my life and remember me each time I visit. Clean and comfortable environment!

text: Fast and thorough. Can get appointments before hours which is great. Always happy with Capstone Dental Care.

name: Carole Billingsley
text:
Needed dental care immediately, and wanted an "all service" practice.  This was GREAT!!!  After being treated, ask for my records from my regular dentist to be transferred so I could use Dr. Bennett all of the time.  Everyone was great in the office and I am ecstatic to find somewhere I feel comfortable and don't have to go all over town to get each step of care done.

If you are one of those people who "hate the dentist", I think you would change your mind after being seen here.

name: Tony Murphy
text: I had my very first crown done. The entire staff was very polite and professional, especially Dr. Dickson. I found it very convenient to have the entire crown procedure done in one visit. You guys rock!

text: I've been going here for 10 years and everyone has always been so genuinely caring. Dr. Dickson and her staff always make me feel so welcomed. Some hygienist even remember certain details about things we talked about in  previous cleanings. I had a dental emergency awhile back and they took me backrl right away and took care of my issue. Anytime I have an appointment I truly feel as though the Capstone Dental Staff are looking out for the best intrest of my teeth and health.

name: Danielle Johnson
text: The staff is very professional and the dentist is great!  The office is clean.  I'm very uncomfortable with going to the dentist and he made it so much easier.  Dr. Bennett, like I said, he's great and very good at what he does.  I'm sure his partner is as well.

name: Michelle Eggert
text: Dr Bennett went far above and beyond for my daughter.  She's an Alabama student and I'm 800 miles from home. He helped us out after she fell and cracked off 3 of her teeth.  He is a very caring person!  My daughter was impressed with him and his office. I will post again when we have the final result from the therapeutic and cosmetic work.

name: A Fondren
text: Love Dr. Dickson! She’s amazing! The whole staff is caring, friendly and very attentive. I would totally recommend Capstone Dental to anyone!

text: Capstone Dental is the best. The staff is so friendly and helpful. Dr. Bennett makes sure you get exactly what you need. Thanks for making my smile beautiful again!

name: Lisa Nelems
text: The front staff have always been great & quick to answer any questions I have! My hygienist Vickie always make coming to the dentist a pleasant experience as do both doctors! Keep up the great work!!!!

name: Elise Goubet
text:
Everything and everyone at Capstone Dental Care is phenomenal. Their service is fast and efficient and I have never had to wait more than 10 minutes to get called back. I am usually in and out in less than an hour, even the last time when I had to have a filling. For my 6-month check-ups they give reminder calls early enough in advance to re-schedule if I need to. The back office and front office staff are incredibly helpful and nice. When I locked my keys in my car and went back in to see if I could wait in their office until someone could bring my spare keys, the front office staff was so helpful. They asked if I needed to use their phone to call someone and offered me water and coffee, amazing service!
I just don't have enough great things to say about this office!

name: Ronald Hallmark
text: Friendly great staff and Dentists. Treat you like family.

text: The staff was very professional and the building was well kept and clean over all a good experience.

text: I apologize for my previous review and proud to see Capstone Dental take a positive stand against inappropriate behavior. Thank You.

name: Robin Graham
text: Dr Barrett is amazing! At 8 at night he drove back to his office to fix an emergency tooth breakage I had. He is so nice!

text: Never really liked the dentist... However, They made sure I was comfortable and cared for. Huge shoutout to Tara she performed my cleaning and she has the hands of an angel!

text: I have been a patient for several years now and definitely plan to continue. They have a great atmosphere from folks like Mandy Thomas up front to those taking great care of my teeth. Thank you fir all that you do!!!

name: Kailey Check
text: I really needed to dump my old dentist and was intrigued by the reviews for this one - after my visit today I can say they are 100% accurate. Everything was fast and efficient, the building and staff are plentiful to accommodate multiple patients at one time, so do not fret if you feel like you are in a sea of people in the waiting room. Dr. Bennett was thorough and informative - he showed me what he was talking about with a mirror as well as the x-ray, and took his time explaining areas of concern and why or how they occur. My dental hygienist (Stephanie!) was also fantastic. I did not feel rushed, shamed, or confused during this visit. I will definitely be back.

name: Barbara Moroz
text: Everyone is great! Dr. Bennett and Vickie always take care of me.

text: Extremely friendly front staff! The hygienist, Noelle, is extremely knowledgeable and does an excellent job!

name: kristi mullis
text: Changed dentist due to insurance and needed a filling, so I was told when I went for my appt. scheduled a time to come back for filing, only to come back a few days later with terrible tooth pain. Another X-ray and was told I needed a root canal. All that pain for the filing useless now having to go back in and get a root canal. Been back several times after my root canal and I'm still in pain. I'm not dentist but a root canal means there is no root, therefore I shouldn't still be in pain after almost 3 months later. Changing dentist and hope to get some answers. I didn't even get a chance to have my families appts because the trouble I've had, I don't want them to experience it.

name: JT Odom
text: Thank you to Dr John Bennett and his team. I can finally smile again.

name: Gary S
text: Great staff, always very friendly and professional!

name: Michael Burdick
text: Best dental care ever!

name: Cheryl Goree
text:
Long story, short...Had a few issues with them. #1 Lack of honesty
#2 Lack of knowledge
#3 Lack of care and concern
Whispering and gestures among a few of the associates, when they were confronted about dental work. A crown job that took three hours over the estimated time, and as it turned out, had to have the crown taken off and replaced by another dentist, so I went through five hours of hell, for nothing more than two more hours of hell.  Being charged more at check out, than what I was told it would cost. Filed a grievance with my insurance provider, and after their investigation, Capstone was advised to reimburse me. I haven't even gotten a response from them, and it has been seven months.

name: Lynn McColl
text: Love this dental office!  Especially Mandy and her help with my insurance, she made the difference!

name: Damon Holland
text:
My son, a freshman, 7 hours away from, chipped his front two teeth. He asked the dentist to just repair/bond them to hold him until he can get home. His aunt is his dentist and could take care of the rest. The dentist was insistent on wanting him to have over a thousand dollars worth of treatment. I spoke with(& showed x-rays)to other dentists & endodontist.  After seeing them they all agreed he did not need a double root canal, crown etc... he was not in any pain. He spoke down to my son for what he had requested to be preformed. The tooth chipped off 6 hours after he bonded the tooth.  My son had to go back two days later to have it repaired. The dentist was cocky and when finishing with the repair he didn't even shake my sons hand or have anything good to say when leaving the room.
I think he was mad that we stood our ground and didn't let him run a new college student over the coals with his thousands of dollars worth of charges. I am a physician. I couldn't imagine taking advantage of a young college student and their families that are many hours away and not every family can come up with over a thousand dollars in an instant for something that can wait. Thankfully we had other professionals to guide us.

text: The staff is always awesome!

I've been to several children's dentists--this one wins!

Keep up the excellent work and thank you!!

name: Sabreena Madison
text: Dr. Burgess and his team restored my sons trust in dentists. After a bad experience with a different dentist, my son, Joshua, felt instantly comforted when we arrived at the office, thanks to the gueniunly friendly, and caring atmosphere of the entire staff! Dr. Burgess also found cavities in Joshua's mouth that should have been found on his last Xray with the previous dentist, but were not...or were found and this person neglected to tell HIS MOTHER! I am relieved that my baby is in good hands now. ❤

name: AprilandTim Trussell-Smith
text: Excellent first trip to the dentist for both of our girls - 6 and 3. Dr. Simpson is very good at communicating with children and making sure they know everything that is about to happen. Our 6 year old has been back for two follow-up visits already (fillings, extractions, orthodontic appliance), and she still loves the dentist. Bubble gum flavored toothpaste and laughing gas help for sure. When he numbed her mouth for the extractions, Dr. Simpson was really careful to keep the giant needle out of her view. I got a little light headed, but she had no idea what was happening. Overall, for both our little ones, this was a great dental experience. I almost wish I were a kid so I could go to Dr. Simpson.

name: Ashley Head
text: I have been taking my three kids (ages 11,9 & 8) to the Gardendale location for 6 years now. All three of my kids always look forward to going to each visit and love not only the hygienists but also both Dr. Carol Ann and Dr. Kathy. They treat my kids like family! When we've had a few minor emergency scares with a chipped or cracked tooth, they've always gone above and beyond to help reassure me and help calm any fears I or my child had. My daughter's front permanent tooth was broken when she was 7. Not only did they see her quickly,  they did a fantastic job rebuilding her tooth. If you are looking for a pediatric dentist, I would highly recommend Dr. Carol Ann or Dr. Kathy! The ENTIRE staff is wonderful!

I'm so glad we found a place that will take such good care of them for years to come!
