name: KD Hyche
text: Today was our lil girl’s first time to the dentist. We wanted to get her gums checked since she is actively teething and get her in a routine of going to the dentist. The staff was amazing ! Her hygienist talked with me for a while and was very nice even after finding out she has two moms 🌈  ! Even though Olivia was unsure of what was going on,  her hygienist kept reassuring her and was trying to help calm her down. Keep in mind she is only a lil over a 1 1/2 - she will be 2 in November. For the love of me I can’t remember the woman’s name but to her thank you 🙏🏼 for everything. I’m not one to normally leave reviews but felt like I really needed to on this one. I would definitely recommend this place. They are informative, supportive, professional, and extremely nice. Thank y’all again for everything today and look forward to seeing you again in February.

resp.text:
Thank you so much for your kind words, Kd. We really appreciate you taking the time out to share your experience with us.

Cheers,

PDA Oxford

text: Today was my little girls first time going to the dentist and she was terrified and begging not to go an i didn't know where to take her...i remember when I was a kid i went to dr.norby....and i left everytime crying cause he hurt me...i didn't want that for my little girl so i decided i would try pediatric dental and im so glad i did when we got there she started crying.....the nurse explained everything she was going to do she showed her exactly how everything worked, she let her touch everything she was going to be using....and kayna was fine then...after she was done kayna got up and was all smiles and then they gave her money to get her a toy out of there machine... they assured me nothing they do will ever hurt her...she has to have a root canal and a cap on her tooth they said with laughing gas shell never know they are doing anything to her.....i have to say I loved this place!!!

text: Everytime we come they are all so sweet! We went yesterday because my daughters silver capped tooth was hurting her. The cap was coming lose... So they done the in office procedure while we was there! My daughter was in some pain afterwards and I called them to make sure it was normal for her to be crying as much as she was...They put the Dr. On the phone with me and she was so nice and assured me that she would be fine that it was probably BC of the numbing BC it felt strange to her and she got my number and she called me back at closing time just to make sure my baby was ok! So I give them 5 stars! They are amazing! They have a little play table out front for your little one... TVs out front.. They even have small TVs on the ceiling so your child can watch Netflix while they are getting work done!  At the end they get a coin and get to out it on a little toy machine and they get a cute toy! Its a fun and friendly place!  :)

Thanks so much Dr. Thomas and Staff,

Patrick Pride

text: Dr. Thomas as well as her staff is very professional. She had been my dentist for the last few years and I enjoy going to appointments. The receptionist knows me by name and I am always treated well. I would refer this office to anyone. They are absolutely amazing.

text: Horrible. Not so intelligent. This business has little knowledge about insurance. Please read your EOB’s. Dr Thomas will over charge. Still waiting  on my refund from May.

text: Dr. Thomas and her staff provide a friendly, caring and  professional family atmosphere. My sons and I switched over to Dr. Thomas because we trusted her years of professional judgement and experience.  She and her staff are concerned about patient dental care and take pride in the work that they do.

name: Brandon Faulkner
text: If your looking for a family dentist who is very professional, caring, and honest look no further, Dr.Thomas and her staff are second to none. I have been under the care of Dr.Thomas for the past 2 years. They are prompt, and just all around genuine.

name: BYRDIE Yeah
text: The lady I spoke with on the phone orginally told us the appointment would be on a certain day. She called back about 15 minutes later said they had a cancellation and would we like to come this day instead. We agreed sure. Told us to be there at 1. We shows up at 12:30 and the door locked before we could even get to the door. We rode around for about an hour and came back. And i have to tell u that I don't like how the receptionist kept rushing my mom and I to make a decission about when to get the work done. Rushing us to hurry up and apply for some type of credit card. Didnt give us much information about the card we are applying for. She swiped my moms debit card and told her if she's approved they would pay for her work to be done and charge a small fee. And its 12 months interest free. But that's it. No more info about this so call credit card. My mom was denied(on purpose) because I did not give all the information required on purpose because i didnt like how she was being treated by this receptionist.  I wasnt comfortable with the way the receptionist was handling my mom at all. It was obvious that my mom couldnt afford 1300plus bucks for a set of dentures and that's with insurance.(im like with insurance and that high? I wonder what its like without insurance then)but that receptionist just kept on trying. Saying pay 600 plus this time to get started and pay another 600 plus next time to cover it. I had just told her my mom gets ssi benefits which is no more than 700 bucks. If i give them 600 plus what the hell about about her bills at home? What bout her food? Etc That receptionist never considered. She never cared. She just kept pressing the issue. And no they never told us the price on the phone. If they had then i would never had wasted my time or my gas bringing my mother to this place. Other than that the place was clean. And quiet. Today is July 11, 2017

text: Dr. Mac is an excellent dentist. He has been my dentist for 34 years. He is great with  local anesthesia. I never dread going. Growing up I thought the dentist was supposed to hurt. I recommend him highly!

text: I had recently visited Mountain Brook Smiles to have my teeth cleaned and ended up walking out since they could not respect my time - I do not have hours on end to wait to have my teeth cleaned. I was in and out of there in no time, the dental hygienist was super knowledgeable and educated me on some things I did not know, and Dr. Nicole was incredibly nice & personable. Highly recommend!

name: Jessica Finch
text: The staff is always so nice and friendly! Love Dr. LaMaitre and her crew. They provide an excellent level of care, always making sure you are comfortable and satisfied.

name: Anne Westbrooke
text:
Dr. Carter Mitchell and his staff are wonderful. They are following all COVID-19 protocols to keep everyone safe.
Shannon handles all the appointments and insurance filings, which are a puzzle to me. Lindsay is incredibly knowledgeable and intuitive. One glance at my file, coupled with her personal memory, allows her to examine my mouth, and let Dr. Mitchell know what’s going on. Over the Mountain’s dentist has years of experience and a fresh perspective on family and cosmetic dentistry. He is professional and personable. Dr. Mitchell and his staff care about their patients.

resp.text: Thank you for the recommendation! Always a pleasure to care for you and we strive for a great experience every time! Insurance can be tricky but we have loads of experience and are here to help.

Everyone who works here gives great customer service! From Emily, who coordinates the appointments and is the first point of contact, to Lindsay, the dental assistant, who is absolutely fantastic, to Dr. LeMaitre, who has a great disposition, kind, and knowledgeable!!
I can’t say enough good things about this practice!! If your are searching for a caring, friendly, affordable dentist, this is definitely THE one!!

name: Shantel Ervin
text: As a cancer warrior, I have had my share of doctors appointments, treatments, surgical procedures and more. Because of this my pain threshold is high so if I say something hurts it really hurts. My previous dental office was aware of this yet the hygienist chose to ignore the pain I was experiencing. After speaking with the office manager I decided I would not complete my appointment and later called back and canceled any further treatment with that practice. I called my insurance company and located the office of a previous dentist that I loved and I am so glad I did. I called Bryant Dental on Bob Wallace and even the interaction over the phone was pleasant. Whitney was able to schedule me an appointment quickly and educated me on the processes and procedures and what to expect. I could hear her smile through the phone. The day of my appointment, the entire staff was absolutely wonderful! As a new patient for the practice I knew I would have paperwork and would probably be there for a while but as soon as I finished my paperwork my hygienist was waiting for me. Chelsey greeted me with smiling eyes (she had on her mask), explained the process in depth and after reviewing my x-rays she recommended the best next step to help with my issues. She listened and made sure to understand what I was experiencing and throughout my appointment she made sure the process was not causing too much pain. With tender swollen gums pain is to be expected however if the hygienist knows what they are doing the patient will experience minimal pain. Chelsey knows what she is doing! She took a potentially mouth throbbing, tears running uncomfortable situation and made it a pleasant and educational experience. I went in with my mouth feeling awful and because of what Chelsey did my teeth feel so much better. Because I am a cancer warrior my teeth and gums have gone through some major changes. Chemo, radiation and long term medication has caused damage that I thought was going to take radical treatment to repair but Chelsey explained how to minimize further damage and what to do to get me on a path of recovery. She was absolutely amazing! I highly recommend Bryant Dental on Bob Wallace, you will not be disappointed.

resp.text: Wow to that wonderful review!  We are so happy to hear about your great experience with us!  We will pass these sweet words you shared on to the staff and especially let Chelsey and Whitney know :)

text: Had my first checkup here today with Chelsey and really appreciated her advice and insight on how to adjust/improve my dental hygiene approach! Strongly recommend Bryant Dental for anyone new to Huntsville looking for a dentist.

name: Colleen Sauls
text: Let me save some of you the trouble. They use Transworld System collection agency when Tonya makes a mistake with your treatment plan and tells you your insurance will pay half and you pay the other half ($560) and then it turns out TONYA read it wrong but expects the patient to pay for her mistake you will get turned over to a collection agency! I liked Dr. Bentley and was very disappointed she let her office manager get away with dirty office practices, so I had no other choice but to find another dentist for my son and I. Tonya wouldn’t let me speak to Dr. Bentley she twisted what happened to fit her narrative and let Dr.Bentley think they were doing me a favor by cutting the bill in half when all along Tonya knows this is on her! And she sent a $240 bill to collections on a procedure that wasn’t even done correctly (we were told my son didn’t need a crown turns out he did but because of Tonyas error reading our policy which is her job by the way we never went back to Dr.Bentley after getting a $500 bill in the mail no phone call Tonya knew I would be upset and she knew exactly what she told me) and the tooth had to be extracted after all of that! So NO  I do not recommend you go there! Not because of Dr. Bentley but because you cannot trust Tonya to do your insurance and billing correctly! Do you have an extra $1000.00  laying around when you get a surprise bill from Tonya? When I asked Tonya why she didn’t catch that the insurance wouldn’t cover that procedure she said to me well neither did you! Wow!! Tonya claimed to have gotten an approval for the procedure when all along root canals weren’t covered within the first year of coverage (so that was a lie to cover her mistake) I would have thought an office manager and the person who is supposed to verify insurance would check that first thing! I have never had this happen before over 30 years of taking myself and 2 kids to the dentist! So there you have it! Chelsea & Jennifer are great though!

resp.text: So sorry Colleen that there was any issue with your time with us at Bryant dental.  Unfortunately with insurance they always have the disclaimer that it is an estimate and not a guarantee of payment.  As a courtesy we strive to help our patients by handling all the dental billing rather than collecting all payments up front for procedures creating the hassle for the patient to handle all billing to his or her own insurance.  It's a partnership where we rely on what the insurance provides us and what the insurance provides to the patient about their own coverage.  We definitely do our best on our end to try to gather all the information about waiting periods, missing tooth clauses and percentages covered.  We will look into your account and see what happened in your situation.  Once again we apologize you had anything but the best experience with us!

My husband said this is the only dentist office that made him feel confident in getting dental care.

name: Jeffrey Smith
text: Just returned from having a root canal at the Huntsville office..Terrible experience...assistant didn't introduce herself so I couldn't tell you her name or the dentist because he didn't either (when we were leaving my wife found out it was Dr. Willis)..no tell me what's going on or anything..I passed on info from previous dentist as was told to do but was quickly dismissed with we don't do that..just you need to see a specialist...how about what type of specialist? I informed them that cold water really hurts my teeth and dentist said, "Really nothing I can do about it unless I numb your mouth."  In addition, I told both that it does not feel numb where you put the shots..most dentists would probably give you another shot to help..not this one (wasn't even offered anesthesia)...of course they sprayed cold water in my mouth and I jumped you may need to know...dentist says I can't do anything if you jump to which I replied "That is why I told you prior to starting about what you may need to know!" Sprayed cold water in mouth and it sprayed all over my face no goggles and never wiped off my face.  Dentist went back and forth with me on why I was telling him anything about cold water or numbness..after getting through it there was no what to do if I experience pain afterwards, wife had to go back in and ask.  I found the dentist and assistant very rude and unprofessional.

resp.text: So sorry to hear you didn't have a great experience with us Jeffrey!  This definitely doesn't sound like the experience we want for any of our patients or that we typically have as our normal feedback.  I will reach out to the office manager and she will contact you.  We always want to create a wonderful experience for all our patients and will look into this complaint.

text: Found Bryant Dental on Cigna’s in network provider list. Called them to make sure they were a Cigna in network provider and they said they were. Stopped in the office and asked again if they were in network for Cigna and after they said they were, I made cleaning and exam appointments for my wife and I. During the appointment day, I presented my Cigna card. Cleaning and Exam were done appropriately. Now Bryant Dental is trying to bill me, because they are not in network for my Cigna plan. Cigna did pay them for the services, but Bryant wants even more than what a cleaning and exam are. Under Cigna in network plan the cleanings and exam are 100 percent covered. I’ve talked to them about this to no avail.

resp.text: I hate to hear that you had any issue Frank.  A management team member look into your account and reach out to you.

text: Terrible experience I had a splint ordered since last December and got the first one it was wrong. The second time another was ordered and it was wrong. I had already paid for the splint $335. The assistant waited to call the company in turn she was rude and I had to wait to find out when my splint that had been paid for was going to arrive. I explained that it was not right I had to keep waiting on the right splint. The assistant said it was not their fault the company got it wrong but I disagree!!  I asked if I could be reimbursed for the splint the assistant manager stated she couldn't reimburse me. I have been going to Bryant dental for over a year and never had any problems until this splint. I had impressions done on this splint in December before the holidays its going on February and they never got it right! Very unprofessional and doesn't value good patients with longevity. Staff is not professional at all!!!

text: I agree with jade... i am a severe Dentaphobe and called to change dentists after a bad experience with my other dentist.  My first visit was ok, but something seemed off.  I assumed it was my fear, and continued goung. I was told I would need a crown.  I show up terrified and they start working on me with nitrox. He says I don't  need it and after several minites, gives me the nitrox, but does not give it time to work. He then drills pokes and grinds, while I am crying. . They fit the temp crown and say I can pay when they put new crown on. I am then in  PAIN for 3 weeks. I go back in he says he wants to put me on steroids and pain meds, but he may have to do a root canal.  They will check to see how I am and setup another appointment.  NEVER HAPPENED.  got a bill in the mail for my crown that I never got... when I called them, their number listed on bill was disconnected. Can you say, "" you know a good attorney? "

name: Jeffery Wynn
text:
We initially had a good  experience with DMD Kym. The visit was to determine what we needed to do with me 71 year old Fabulous Mom. 😉 The office  was patient  and helped us get a bottom denture made and CREATED A PLAN  to work on the top after the bottom  was completed. Now Mom's on hospice care at home
along with the influx of Covid 19, we had to cancel many appointments.  Well  all the "planets were in alignment today" and I actually got her in to get  the denture. Mr. Kym spoke extremely curtly to her and quite frankly. Afterwards quickly , what I felt to dismiss us. Mr. Kym actually wait for it...........sent us home with this  denture only.
Nothing  else. So fast forward as Iam looking at it sitting on my table "on a napkin"  I called the office to inquire as to how to care for it. What to put it in (other than her mouth of course) And remembered her telling him that a tooth on top was sharp and causing pain to her tongue. To which he offered NO assistance. Pretty Inept  is the opinion I have of this guys practice.  He also made it quite clear he would offer no  further assistance with her remaining denture situation. You remember, the " plan" he had established prior. At any rate  I am simply at a loss.  Mr. Kym, Kim whatever at the very least owes her an apology for the lack of respect that he obviously felt was OK to show towardmy Mom. And at this point,  perhaps he could have one of his assistants  forward His  initial  " plan " if you will,  to a DMD whom can assist us in finishing her needs? I have reached out to Medicare and UHC for any assistance, thoughts or recommendations.

Everyone is so compassionate and caring. I am

name: Kat Calvert
text: From the front desk to the dentist, this is a wonderful office. The assistants are knowledge, kind & extremely professional. Dr. Tan showed such a degree of professionalism and compassion. I have never received such great dental care in my life. Will and have recommended to everyone. Such a blessing to me.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words.  We appreciate your positive review.

name: Aaron G
text:
I’ve been to this office twice . After my first visit I felt something was off about the way they handle things but I thought maybe I was overthinking it so I decided to go to my second appointment .

During my first appointment I just needed to get a diagnose to see what I needed to get done . I saw Dr. Tan.  When Dr. Tan came and check my teeth and X-ray said I probably just need a cleaning and I had 2 cavities that need filling. They offered to do the cleaning that day and  I was ok with it. I have insurance so I knew that was cover and didn’t have to pay anything. The hygienist also told me I needed a panoramic x ray and that my insurance doesn’t cover so it was going cost me $92 and handed me this paper to sign it . I get very high anxiety at dentist office so I sign it without thinking any of it . She didn’t explain why I needed she just said it was to check if everything was normal . I’ve never had this done so I went with it. Now after my second visit I realized that panoramic x ray  is just a way to get money out of you and just to makes you pay for something you don’t really need . After I got my teeth cleaning dentist never came to check on hygienist work and they never went over the panoramic X-ray . I went go head and got my second appointment to get my “2 fillings” done . The girl at the desk told me it was going to be $116.

I went to my second appointment and of course I was anxious. The dental assistant tells me I need 3 fillings and it was going to cost me $155 . I asked her why 3 since I was told it was only 2 . She said her chart shows 3 fillings. Being anxious and wanting to get this done I just said ok and sign . Got my fillings done and paid . I went home and checked my teeth I can barely see the “3rd” filling . It makes me wonder if I even had 3rd cavity or was this just made up to get more money out of me ? . I don’t know wether there was a miscommunication or if they’re really just dishonest and taking advantage of people who are anxious ? !!!

I know part of it is my fault for not speaking  up and just sign a paper . But I hope this helps other people in future . I will not be coming back , I will be looking for new dentist .

name: Vallie Lee
text: Amazing.... Good dentist... Made my visit fast friendly and was very gentle. Thankful to have visted this dentist.

name: Wayne Mckerley
text: Very friendly and caring

name: kim Glenn
text: When I first went there Dr Kim saw me .He pulled 3 bottom teeth and was pretty gentle with me .I don't like going to dentist so of coarse this made me alittle ok with the fact I new I would need some dentures soon .Well if you want to be sure your satisfied and your dentures are right and will fit,you'll need to go elsewhere  .They don't give a damn if they were made rite,if there lined up rite ,if they fit,or if they were even made right  .They simply don't care,how you feel about them,the fact that they don't fit,it dosent matter.they have there money,so u got to deal with wat you got.My sister just got screwed by Aspen ,now I get screwed by Today's family Dental .Nobody cares about the other anymore.Its dog eat dog.no feelings,no compassion.just live with it and die

name: Teacher Debbie
text:
I have been to this dentist's office before and seen Dr. Kim. He always did a good job. However, I had a painful, decayed, infected back tooth and needed to be seen by whoever was available. When I called the office, I was able to get an appointment for the next day.

When I got to the dentist's office, I was called back immediately, which I thought was good. I was to see a Dr. Tan. Dr. Tan was nice, and told me that the tooth needed to come out. She numbed the area and left me in the chair in a position with my head down and my feet elevated. No one came in to check on me and I was in the chair for three hours. Finally, when Dr. Tan came in the second time after she had numbed me, she started working on my tooth. I told her that it was still hurting. She then said that she was not bragging on her numbing technique, but that the area had to be numb. She said that since it was decayed that she might have to dig around down there and if I was feeling pain, she could not do that. She did not offer me nitrous oxide or more lidocane. She sent me home without extracting the tooth. She prescribed antibiotics for a week and then said we would try again.

While I was in the chair, I was so cold that my feet were actually shaking. I was never offered a blanket or asked if I was OK. This office is always so loud as they have music playing and everyone is always talking to each other about their weekends or what they did the night before. I need a peaceful area when I am in a lot of pain.

I went home and looked up dentists in Birmingham and found a great one that removed my tooth the next day. I will not be going back to this dentist's office.

name: Ryan Dingler
text:
Been here many times. Always easy in and out. Dr. Tan was nice, funny, and did a great job each time. The dentists and assistants are very friendly and informative. I never consider going anywhere else.

I would definitely recommend them.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review.  We appreciate your business!

name: Barbara Goodwin
text: My dentures still bother my My Gum..

name: Jo Barbee
text: They are so sweet had some great laughs love this place

name: SMOKRISE
text: Great experience

name: Donna Causey
text: They are very good with the kids would be great for them and adults

name: Lucas Elliott
text: Beware!!! Stay away from this dentist. They will get your child in the back and do extra procedures and not tell you until they are through. I told them I didn’t want my son receiving a filling that day. Everyone assured me that he wouldn’t be and once he was in the back they proceeded to do the filling without asking or telling me until they were finished. I will be filling a complaint with the state board of dentistry.

name: Sonja Renea
text:
My tooth extraction was terrifying since I was not completely numb yet. I have TMJ, which no one asked me about before it was done... in fact there was no consultation prior to extractions at all. I bought dentures from this office but I regret it. My TMJ is much worse now. They were not very informative or thorough. I felt like I was wasting their time with my concerns.

My dentures cause me pain because I have a small mouth, and these dentures have more teeth than my mouth was used to... I thought that was something they would have checked. But I was told that is the standard amount of teeth for a normal mouth (which I never had) that my bite looked fine and basically deal with it. I felt like once they had my money my comfort did not matter.

Even though I saved up for their "high end" dentures, they are very uncomfortable and I will be saving up to purchase another pair of dentures elsewhere as soon as I can afford it.

name: chloe !

name: Tim Baucom
text: This was mistake ive not saw the Dentist at this time..

name: J Owens

name: Amelia Jo Hanly
text: Made me smile

name: Albertina Page
text:
This visit was very good. Front desk staff not the best in personalities. Paperwork ask to consent to information you haven’t received. Like the wagon before the horse. Nothing is explained until after you’ve had your vitals taken.  Then you’re escorted to the Dental exam area.

This Dentist was a Dentist Doctor. Very caring and knows her profession. I really liked her consulting with another Dentist for confirmation on a life living outcome.

Previous visit was terrible. Front desk staff a little bit more informative but not friendly. Fake if you’re having a bad day but greet with courtesy.  Then my iPhone was stolen. They denied seeing me with the phone. But the find my phone app located the phone in their office Sarrell until 9pm that night.

The next day after they opened only one staff (Latino) member took me back and showed she was trying to help.The others shrugged their noses as I know you were here but it is if no relevance to me.

The dentist male had been rude and told me I could go to another Dental Office anytime . As if I didn’t have knowledge of that.  I’m a retired Nurse of 35 years . Not only Med Surg but Surgery also and Medical offices.

Not asking anything but children can be traumatized by Doctors of all specialty. I had 3 children there and when I told them we had to go back it was a nightmare.

Finally I promised if that same Doctor was there we would leave if no one else would see them.
Overall this Dentist was #5 the best.

resp.text: Albertina, Thank you for your feedback. f you'd like to talk more about this, please send an email with your contact information to feedback@greatdentalplans.com.

name: Holly Knighten
text: I absolutely love Sarrell Dental. My daughter has had quite a few teeth pulled, top and bottom spacers put in and eye testing done. Each time we've been they have been very respectful to us. They take the time to make sure my daughter is comfortable and isn't feeling any pain. Wait time in the lobby has never been longer than 10-15 minutes and time in the back has never been longer than about 25-30 minutes. They are very considerate of my daughter when she goes and have always talked her through any process of what they have to do. We will always be a loyal Sarrell customer.

name: Jorxxdrip
text: I've had 2 bad experiences with sarell dental but this last one was awful. My boys have been going for 6 years too. This dentist was a male and he at first was very friendly and encouraging. He numbed my babies gums and the gave him a shot to numb him. I  knew he would cry bc he did before. But the dentist said to him, why are you still crying, I'm not even touching it anymore. Are you gonna cry or man up. Then the dentist started trying to loosen my babies tooth bc it had to be pulled. This part was ok, he was calm and the assistant was encouraging. Then he changed tools and began to pry and my baby screamed from the top of his lungs because he felt the pain. The dentist fusses at him saying it's numb you don't feel anytginh!!😲 I am 40 and I recently had to have a 2 teeth pulled and I still felt it after my numb shot. I asked my baby afterwards did he feel the pain and be said yes. I feel so bad for not protecting him and telling the dentist to stop. My baby looked at me like he wanted to ask why I didn't help him. The staff is amazing but don't know about dentist.

resp.text: Nikki, we value your loyalty to our clinic and apologize for your recent disappointment. We are looking into this and would be happy to talk with you more. Please reach out to us at patientadvocate@greatdentalplans.com with the best way to contact you so we can be in touch. Thank you for your feedback.

text: They will not schedule appt on a timely manner they call and want you to come that day or wait another month or two and wait time is long when you can get appt

resp.text: Teresa, we would first like to apologize for this experience. While it is not our choice to make patients wait long periods of time for an appointment, that is often an issue beyond our control. It is our policy to alert patients of any last minute cancelations and/or openings in our schedule in effort to remedy this issue and provide timely appointments. We prioritize patients experiencing pain, and work them in for same day appointments when possible. We are looking into this situation and would like to know more. Please reach out to us by sending an email to patientadvocate@greatdentalplans.com, so we can discuss in more detail. We appreciate your feedback.

resp.text: We apologize for the wait - we know how valuable your time is and we never want anyone to have to wait, especially when they make a point to show up for their appointment at the right time! The week before school starts (this week) is our busiest week of the year and we sometimes get backed up with patients, but we understand that isn't a good excuse. We would love the opportunity to see your child in our office again and schedule the appointment at time that would not be as busy!

However, from the moment you walk through the doors the staff welcomes you with open arms. The receptionist is always uplifting and positive. Once the children go back they allow parents to join or stay in waiting room ( your choice). They are ALL so comforting.
Dr. McKelvey did such a great job plus she is absolutely hilarious!!!! When my child walked out she was grinning ear to ear. I would recommend to anyone and will continue coming here for generations to come.

text: Children's Dentistry for Life!!! Absolutely love them,  the awesome hospitality, patience, and reassurance. Oh & I can't forget the big,  welcoming SMILES!! Thank you for all you do for my kiddos, YOU GUYS ROCK!!

name: Matt R
text: had 6ish appointments in a two months span to fix all of my teeth before my insurance ran out. they did THREE root-canals in ONE evening, staying over time to make sure ever single root was out, then taking time (after they should've gone home) to make sure my impressions for my crowns were good! i have absolutely NOTHING bad to say about Children's Dentistry Of Decatur, they made the hour drive worth ever second; every appointment comforting and easy for me myself.

name: Tenique Milam
text: I absolutely love this place. I have never had any issues or problems with any of the staff. My kids has never had a problem with them

name: Gracie Mae
text: been going here for years, i am 18 now, they told me i was going to have to have a deep cleaning done, which is fine with me. they told me if i didn't get it done ASAP; my teeth were going to essentially fall out. i left crying and terrified. they told me they would call me within the week to confirm if my insurance covered it, and i didn't hear from them for over a month. eventually, they got back to me and made my appointment over a month away. if it was So urgent, i needed to go in immediately. so, me being in medical school, i went to get a second opinion, and i'm so glad i did! they told me my teeth were healthy, but i had some decay and a filling that needed to be done! they cleaned, with mr nose, and with a light sedation a few days ago, 0 pain! always seek a second opinion, because for years this dentist has made me terrified to go, and has continuously put me down for not taking care of my teeth, when in reality, i do take care of them! saved me a lot of money and pain by seeking another opinion. coming from the child who has gone here, don't take your children here!

text: My kids(all 3) had an appointment for 1:00 as new patients and we were out by 2. They were great will my kids. Very nice staff. Big waiting room. Loved it.

text: Very friendly. Put my 8 yr old at ease and my 15 yr old with anxiety issues at ease.  There is a younger new dentist there that has a great attitude.  The rapport between the dentist and the hygienist was wonderful. Not to mention,  it didn't take all day.  Very highly recommend:)

name: Anna Parker
text: We've been coming to Children's Dentistry off and on for years. We love it. We've had plenty of work done but all my boys go back by themselves with no anxieties. My youngest even argues with me that it's his turn to go back! We're so thankful for this group of dentists, hygienists and even the office ladies.

name: Kenzie Letson
text: Please do not take your kids here. As a former patient and now a parent to a 2 year old, this place is completely awful. I cannot tell you how many times the staff was mean to kids unnecessarily and told them to stop whining and "you're too big for that" . Not to mention my sisters and I always left with cuts in our mouth. The actual dentists are good but the assistants/hygienists are just inhumane and need to work with adults if they can't handle the fact that CHILDREN do get scared.

name: Angela Michael
text:
The receptionist was very awful, its 0 star from  me I usually dont do this  but everytime we go there I go home crying   the dentist who was a black lady seems she don't know what she was doing  I was scared for my child
I pray my  baby will be ok and when I ask if  I can bring him back incase of emergency  coz we've been there for an hour  the dentist not knowing  and to make the matter worse talking and not concentrating  on her work  it was a nerve wracking ,so receptionist said you have to call  to schedule  an appointment 😳😩 very sad am not going back there and incase anything  happens  to my child  am sueing point blank .

name: Mel Mrtz
text: Love how they can fit a schedule of 3 kids all at 1 time ! Really skeptical about people taking my kids without me watching but my kids enjoy going back and come out happy .they are really sweet !

name: shelby Osborn
text: They are very sweet to my boy and respectful. Thank you to them for making my boy feel better after his procedures and taking good care of him.

name: Patti Lewis
text: My 8 yr old grand daughter was told to stop whining - they were just trying to fix her tooth! Great PEDIATRIC care. NOT! Also, their website states they are open on Fridays which they are not. Every OTHER Friday. However, this will not be an issue for us. Moved on.

name: L Vick
text: I have a foster child I took here because this was their established dentist but if I knew what type of care they would receive I would have taken them somewhere else. This child had never had their teeth cleaned or probably ever brushed and had multiple rotten teeth. The total cleaning lasted less than 5 minutes. I think 90% of the kids I saw in the office had silver caps. If they have actually proper cleanings and good education, the kids would have better over all oral health and not need so many caps and fillings.  I will say the staff is nice and friendly but that doesn’t make up for the lack of proper oral care these patients are receiving.

name: amber demastus
text: I have 4 kids 3 out of the 4 are special needs ranging in severe to almost non existent in behavior. They were patient and very quick. Wish like hell my dentist was like that as a kid! My kids were thrilled after their visit (not so much at first) and asked to go back two of them threw a fit because they wanted to stay. The dentist and associates were so understanding and saw all 4 at once where do they do that at?? I'll tell you Children's Dentistry!! Highly recommend!!!

name: Lauren Livingston
text: Just had the WORST EXPERIENCE at this dentist!!! I asked them when I made the appointment I asked the front desk if they restrain kids or hold them down etc because my 3 year old is going to be very scared and they assured me nothing like that happens and that they don't hold kids down or restrain them for check ups or cleanings, when they took the girls back I started hearing Presley scream " mommy help! Mommy! Mommy!" So I told the receptionist either I needed to go back there or they needed to bring her back up front, she said okay let me go back real quick and I heard Presley continue to scream louder so my momma instincts kicked in and I opened the door and went back and there was a nurse on the table over Presley holding her arms down and keeping her from kicking!!!! I immediately yelled "hey! Get off her!" And ran to grab her! The nurse wouldn't get off her until the dr finally said to let her go, and I looked at the receptionist and said "you TOLD me y'all didn't hold kids down or restrain them! You straight lied to me!" The dentist said "you can go find yourself another dentist!" Damn straight I will.

name: Tonya Toots
text: It's been about 13 years, but my daughter had been set up with these people when she was only a little over a year old. They wouldn't allow me to go back with her during the work she needed done & they did a lot of stuff that wasn't necessarily needed at that time. On top of pulling & capping teeth. Do you know how bad it hurts to hear your baby SCREAMING bloody murder knowing there's really nothing you can do? These people traumatized her after all of what they did. And she came out with a busted top lip! It took her 3 years to be comfortable with a dentist again! And I still have a hard time forgiving myself for allowing these people to touch my child's teeth!

text: They strapped me down and then I had bruises on my shoulders from a doctor getting on me a

text: Had an emergency tooth extraction and called this dentist who took me the same day.  I was very impressed with their smiling staff, the cleanliness, speedy service, and price.  I will be returning for all my dental needs.

text: took insurance before-should have been informed that your biz no longer take dpo insurance-waste of my time-came for extraction

To the contrary of what I had read, I did not experience any of the treatment that was outlined. I was very informed as to the diagnosis and prognosis, and I was given every opportunity to decide what course of treatment to undertake. Kudos to the administrative and dentistry staff for a cordial and professional service.

text: Very friendly, very patient with my daughter who has bad anxiety.

resp.text: Thank you.

text: Birmingham Eastern Family Dental Care is my go-to spot for excellent dental care in a friendly environment.  Dr. Wright and his staff are very knowledgeable, and they explain every step of the process.  The location is convenient, and everyone was very mindful of my time.  I was able to get a check-up and cleaning during my lunch break!  Thank you, Birmingham Eastern Family Dental Care!

resp.text: Thank you so much Summer! We definitely strive to give our patients/family the utmost in quality and convenience.

name: Malika
text: This will be my dentist for life. My daughter is just two and she'll be a patient for life as well. Very attentive and professional with a dose of family thrown in. Exceptional service!!

name: Alvin Currington
text: I been going here for the last year in November I had some work done which was poorly done which caused me to have to have two Root canals at 600.00 at a Specialist I asked the question why should I be responsible for having to pay for something that they messed up in my mouth but I’m stuck with the bill I wish she was a way I can sue because I will never be coming back there black Business is this what you get poor Job now my teeth is Ruin for the rest of my life.

resp.text: We would be more than happy to further explain to your the process of your treatment if you are open to learning more about it. Please feel free to call us to schedule an in-person appointment to speak to Dr. Wright, Dr. Clyde or any of the assistants or hygienists.

name: Raheim Thomas
text:
Waste of time, waste of energy. Had an appointment scheduled to have wisdom teeth removed. Sat in the lobby for 20 mins, then was called to the back room to sit for another 10 mins. Had ZERO contact with the dentist. The dentist came up behind me while I’m sitting in the chair , asked me what was hurting then walked away. No introduction or anything. 5 mins later had one of the assistance come in and say “Dr Wright is sending you to an oral surgeon “.

If he couldn’t have performed the work that should’ve communicated before appointment, before wasting my time, before calling off work. I will never return here.

resp.text: Mr. Thomas, We apologize for the inconvenience and lack of full introduction to Dr. Wright. Once he was able to see your film and immediately saw based on that film that he could not extract your teeth he felt you would be better served with a specialist.  We did it like this so that we wouldn't waste anymore of your time because we did realize that you had been waiting for a while. We hope that you have had the service you desired and have found an acceptable dental home. If you have any questions or concerns or even suggestions for us, please do not hesitate to call us.

name: Karla Wright
text: Love to work here, love to be treated here.

name: Chris Walker
text: Great staff

name: Michelle Butler
text: Bay Pediatric Dentistry was excellent and very welcoming! My daughter was very nervous moving dentists following our move and they made us feel at home. “Doc” was very knowledgeable and accommodating when our 22 month old chipped a tooth. He saw us right away and was very kind!

resp.text: We are so glad that you enjoyed your experience.  Thank you for taking the time to tell us so.  It means a lot!

name: Amber Brown
text: They explain in detail what they will be doing, how she will feel afterwards, and the care that your child will need. They are friendly and make you feel like family. My 4 year old daughter loves going to dentist. I highly recommend this dentist office. Dr. Wells is absolutely amazing!!!

resp.text: Thrilled that you and your daughter had such a great experience.  Thank you for entrusting her dental care to us as well as the kind words. We look forward to seeing you at her next appt!

name: Bob Roz
text:
I cannot say enough good about Bay Pediatric. The staff there is always so pleasant and cheerful. The atmosphere when you enter the office is always very professional, and your time is always highly valued. The office itself is incredibly clean and everyone takes Covid precautions very seriously, which makes us always feel very safe upon entering the building.
Every appointment that we have ever had with a dental hygienist has been top notch and you are always handled very professionally and efficiently.
You always feel great upon leaving after an appointment.
But, with all of that said, the best part of the Bay Pediatric experience is Dr. Wells! We have never experienced a more knowledgeable, professional, or
kinder dentist in all of our dental experiences. He communicates so well to all his patients. His manner of dealing with us is so comforting. And you always leave knowing that you and your family received the absolute best possible care.
Without a doubt, Bay Pediatric, in our opinion, is the finest pediatric dental office in Lower Alabama!
You will not be disappointed.

name: Stephen Searcy
text: Me and my kids have always had a positive experience when visiting Bay Pediatric. All of their dentist and hygienist have gone above and beyond to provide quality care and make sure my two sons are at ease. I would highly recommend them to anyone. They are great with communicating any dental issues and procedures. They are punctual with getting us in as close to the scheduled appointment time as possible. We have made every attempt to ensure our kids proper dental hygiene at home (proper brushing, flossing, limited sugar foods and drinks) to help establish good habits. This has greatly helped reduce their needs for having cavities or tooth decay. Taking an active role as a parent in addition to the excellent care given by Bay Pediatric Dentistry at check ups have made sure my kids are on the right path for their dental care.

name: Megan Smith
text: We love Bay Pediatric Dentistry! My three children have been their patients for the last 15 years.  We've always had a wonderful experience.  Dr. Wells and his staff are friendly and welcoming.  Most importantly,  I know my children have developed good dental hygiene and habits thanks to them!

name: Michael Chambless
text: My sons have seen Bay Pediatrics Dentistry from the start.  Dr. Wells and the rest of the staff are great.  We always have a great experience, from an accommodating appointment schedule, punctual service, and very friendly staff to encourage the kids.  Dr. Wells is especially good at encouraging the kids in taking responsibility for improving their dental health habits.  Bay Pediatric has created an environment where the kids never have any anxiety about a visit.

name: Judd Gillespie
text: My two youngest children have been seeing Dr. Welles for the last 6+ years. Every visit has been a fantastic visit. My kids are very comfortable with Dr. Welles (Hammock - but my kids know him as Dr. Welles). We had an emergency recently after hours and within 5 minutes of getting off the phone with the answering service Dr. Welles called us and handled the issue right then. We are grateful for the service and attention my kids receive when they are in Dr. Welles office. Cannot imagine how they could get anything less than a 5 Star Review.

name: Jennifer laubenthal
text: My children have been going here for years. They are great with my children and they love to go to the dentist.  I highly recommend this place you won't be disappointed. Thank you guys for always    Calming my kids fears and loving them while there in your care.

name: Karen Brock
text: Both of my children have been going to Bay Pediatrics since it originally opened. Every experience has been 100%. They are always treated with care and gentleness and have been put at ease. I am always informed after their cleaning on how everything went. It’s a wonderful place to go!!

name: Mary Catherine Crocker
text: BIG SMILES! Our children have been patients at Bay Pediatric Dentistry for 9 years! All of the staff and dentists at Bay Pediatrics are very professional and great with kids! We are very pleased with our children’s dental cleanings and the professional advice that we are given! Highly recommend!

name: David Roberts
text: Dr. Hammock and his staff are some of the most caring and talented people you will meet. They have treated my 2 daughters with fantastic care for the last 2+ years. I would highly recommend Bay Pediatric Dentistry!

name: Colby Cooper
text: Dental hygiene is critical for children.  There is no better place to help your children understand the importance of taking care of their teeth and receive quality cleanings (and treatment, if necessary) than Bay Pediatric.  Dr. Wells and staff are warm and hospitable and treat my children with exceptional care.  If only they accepted adults!  5-stars *****+

name: Hayley Young
text: We have been going to Bay Pediatric Dentistry since it began years ago and have always received excellent care.  Dr. Wells and staff are professional and take great care of our family.  I highly recommend.

name: Meredith Roach
text: I have 3 boys and they love going to Bay Pediatrics as much as they love going to Disney World. We have been extremely pleased with the care of Dr Wells and his staff. I really appreciate them going the extra mile to make our dentist experience pleasant.

name: taylor parks
text: My children have been going to Bay Pediatric  Dentists for 10 years and every experience has been better than the last.  We are so thankful for Dr. Wells and the staff at Bay Pediatrics that have given both of my children excellent dental care for all these years. I would highly recommend them to anyone looking for a great pediatric dentist with a top notch staff.

name: Christa Myrick
text: Dr. Wells and the team at Bay Pediatric dentistry have taken care of my children for 11 years, and we have always had positive experiences. The kids love the video games, bouncy ball prizes and positive environment- they actually look forward to going to the dentist!

name: Kelli Mayer
text: Dr. Wells and his staff are amazing! My little guy started going at 1yr and is almost 4. He gets so excited when it’s dentist time! I cannot sing their praises enough!! Highly recommend these guys!

name: Lauren Chang
text: We have been bringing our 4 children to this dentist office for years now. The staff is friendly and my children don't complain about having their teeth cleaned. We are very happy there.

name: Rexene Wood
text: From day one, my children have walked in with confidence and no worries as Dr. Hammock and staff care for them.  Love the comfort, care, safety and professionalism.

name: Rebecca Massie
text: My daughter has gone there for 4 years. We wouldn’t think of taking her elsewhere. Top notch care from the entire staff!

name: Anderson McKean
text: All of my children see Dr. Hammock and we have been 100 percent satisfied with their care and professionalism. We couldn’t be happier with Bay Pediatric Dentistry and highly recommend all of the dentists and hygienists who work there.

name: Joni Cheney
text: When your kids get excited to go to the dentist then you know you are at the right place!  We are so thankful for the dentists and staff at Bay Pediatrics that have given both my children excellent dental care for 10 years and counting! From my son being born with 3 front teeth, knocking one out and already having 1 filling to my daughter who has yet to have a cavity in 10 years, we have been most pleased with every aspect of their dental care with Bay Pediatrics!

name: Waverley Fulford
text: Our kids have grown up going to Bay Pediatric Dentistry and I would never take them anywhere else. They make a trip to the dentist fun, without stress, and easier on the parents. They know exactly what to do when a child is a little fearful and always come out to chat.

name: Adele Hapworth
text: My kids have been going to Bay Pediatric for 10+ years and our experience has been excellent. The staff has a great bedside manner which makes ours kids feel so comfortable.

name: Cindy Scott
text: Great folks at Bay Pediatric - we've been seeing them since my daughter was in 6th grade and they have been so kind to her. We've been very pleased with the care she's gotten there.

name: Michael Bosarge
text: We have been going to Bay Pediatric for 12 years and the experience has always been warm, inviting, and professional.  I wouldn’t send my child anywhere else.

name: Jaime Cooper
text: The staff is always friendly and my children look forward to having their teeth cleaned! Highly recommend!!!

name: S Rogers
text: My children have been going here for almost 4 years. They are comfortable here and so far we have had good experiences 🤞🏾. The front desk staff members and hygienists are welcoming and Dr. Hammock always comes out to speak with me if the kids have to have any procedures besides cleaning.

name: Big Muffin
text: I see that my previous review was removed but I will keep posting reviews to assure that no one else falls victim to this horrible place!!!!

name: Sheila Rozumek
text: All staff were professional & friendly. Would return to their practice in a heartbeat. 5 stars!!

name: Alicia Searcy
text: We have been clients for 8 years and have always had a positive experience with Bay Pediatric & Adolescent Dentistry and Dr Wells. I can’t recommend them enough.

name: Kelly Scott
text: Do NOT go here. There is ZERO compassion for your child. They do not take into consideration their fears and anxieties. I asked for sedation, for my child, and was told no, its minimal work, if needed we'll swaddle him to the chair so he can't move. Yeah, because that will work, let's traumatize the child more. And because I posted the same review to their Facebook page, they got butt hurt, and called to tell me not to come back.

name: John Richardson
text: We’ve taken both of our kids to Dr Wells for years now and they’ve always taken good care of us.  Definitely recommended!

text: We have been coming here for 15 years! Awesome staff and awesome doctors!

text: This place traumatized my grandson!

text: My son has gone to Bay pediatrics dentistry fro the past 7 years. We have had nothing but positive experiences with Dr. Hammock and his staff.

text: Rude, lazy people. Will NEVER recommend this place to anyone. Failed fillings, shady policies about not being able to accompany your children. Act of Congress to have a conversation with the dentist about your child...  Smart alec office staff... the list goes on.

name: Kita Henderson
text: Worest place to deal with

name: Jim Foley
text: My six year old looks forward to going to the dentist, and has since his first visit when he was three years old.

name: Serbrena Anderson
text: The staff here are very friendly and great with the kids. They also keep it very sanitized and clean all the time. The children get to play games while they wait to be seen and the dentist also let's them play games for a few minutes after they get done. Or they can color and draw. It's their choice. Also Medicaid is accepted here. Me and my kids love it.

name: The Sturgis Family
text: Worst experience I have ever had. Not one area of this  office that is competent.

name: marisa nguyen
text: the person was way to aggressive and was breathing heavy like they were frustrated while working.

name: Mady Melendez
text: Love working here!

name: Tausha Brazile
text: I drove almost two hours for a horrible experience. Not family friendly at all. All about calling your children back and getting them out. I'm very big on being a part of my kids dentist appointments, but I was sadly told to wait in the lobby, remind you my daughter is only 4. This was their first appointment and I didn't get to meet the dentist. They say my children need fillings, make their next appointment without even asking when would be a good day/time for me. Very rude and seems like they are ONLY in it for the money which is sad. Only reason we switched dentists is because their old dentist no longer accepts their insurance. He always invited me in personally with a handshake, smile, and explained everything that was done and needed to be done.

name: Katie Bailey
text: Both of my kids get crazy excited about going to the dentist. They have a lot of entertainment for the kids in the waiting area, which is good because the wait can be a bit long. They always schedule the kids together so it makes my day easier and they play good movies in the waiting area. Both children have had fillings and cleanings and it was a positive experience both times. They don't usually let the parents come to the back with the children, but it's understandable. Both have a great time anyways and everything is thoroughly explained at the end of each visit.

name: Hannah Rearden
text: My son goes here and i love it!!!!

name: Mary Davis
text: Awesome people , and games to entertain the kids

name: Tabitha M.
text: My nieces had cavities filled here. The fill ins "leaked" and now have caused decay in their other bottom teeth! All of their dental work is having to be repaired by another dentist, & one of them is having surgery to abstract 3 of her teeth! They also kicked the mother out of the room and would not let her go back to accompany her scared girls & pressured her into getting amnesia & temporary paralysis. When I heard this I was so mad! I normally don't write reviews, but I had to share this story. I would not have any work done here.. don't have anything to say about the teeth cleaning.

name: keishakelis
text: Horrible experience, was in total shocked of the unprofessionalism I/my children experienced there.

name: jon dowendophenheimer
text: The  staff is wonderful.  BUT. I was given the wrong estimate for my son's visit.  Now I'm stuck with a bill because I was quoted the wrong price,  and he will not be seen by this office until the wrongly quoted balance is paid.  The office manager was very helpful and is willing to work with you. However.   make sure that you are quoted the RIGHT price before you even think about sending your child to this place.

name: Michallie Harrison
text: The atmosphere is great for children, especially small children. Dr. Baldy is very nice and explains in full detail a treatment plan. They let you know an estimate and will work with you. Highly recommend 10/10! And you get to support a veteran owned business! Also a plus! Will recommend to others for sure. Thank you!

name: Jenny Mooney
text:
This was a first time visit and the LAST time!! My son is absolutely terrified of the dentist we had a really bad experience and then someone referred us to another dentist and then told us that we needed to be sedated so they referred us to here. Before coming to the office I had told them everything that has happened to my son .They reassured me that everything was going to be okay. That you're in good hands now. There was some paperwork that I had to fill out while my son went to head back to take X-rays. One of the paperwork was a behavior problem sheet .I'm not sure what that meant so I asked the nurse what is this paperwork she told me that it was nothing to worry about that before they would sedate him or do anything they would come and get me and talk to me first. The nurse came back out and said that he was doing great everything was going well. So I sat back down after I hand her my paperwork five minutes later my son comes around the corner and he's in tears. This is to be expected because he's so scared. Finished at the paperwork talked about what we needed to do for him forgetting the tooth out and we're walking outside my son looks up to me and says mom please don't bring me back here!! I asked him why what happened he told me that one of the nurses held his hand down and told him if he doesn't calm down there taking him to the back room!! What the hell is the back room?????
I pulled back the front and I asked the nurse to come outside to talk to me the nurse told me that she was going to have someone call me and talk to me. I called back 30 minutes later after I calm down and ask them what was going on and WHAT is the back room?!? She told me that it was nothing to be afraid of it's just a room that they take children that do not cooperate. So the other kids would not be afraid.
First off you do not threaten kids that are already petrified this is definitely an unappropriate dentist office and we will never be back. I hope this help somebody.

resp.text: I am truly disappointed with your review. We treated your son, like we do with every child, with kindness and patience. Unfortunately, there was a miscommunication between you and your 8 year old son. We held his hands in comfort, we did not hold them down. When he kicked the chair and put his hands over his mouth to stop the treatment we did just that. We stopped what we were doing. We are an excellent pediatric dental office and we love our patients!  We hope that you will eventually find what you are looking for. Dr. Maureen Baldy

name: Renee Wiley Linn
text: We are so thankful for Dr Bowman, Dr Nimer and their staff! They helped calm a child who was scared of everything in the office, even to sit in the chair!  Dr Nimer was so patient with him, she even did his exam with him standing up just to calm his nerves!  Later on, Dr Bowman helped us through an emergency dental situation on her day off, going above and beyond to ensure my child was taken care of.  She even referred us for additional services the same day.  We are blessed to have found these sweet ladies!  Their patience, kindness, and concern for their patients tells you this is more than a job for them....it’s a calling!  I would give them 10 stars if I could and would definitely recommend them to anyone!

text: Such a great environment with amazing staff. They are always so kind and so sweet to my little guy and always to their very best to make him feel safe and calm. Highly recommend them to anyone 💙

name: The Lucy Family
text:
I had a work appointment that I needed to get to by 2:30pm and let the hygienist know. She finished the kids by 2:05pm and just needed the kids checked by the dentist. Dr. Bowman finished with a young patient and then saw a friend and had lengthy personal conversation of 5 minutes with a patient/ friend. I tried to be patient but really became frustrated when the conversation was regarding their vacation to the beach. Finally I asked if the hygienist could intervene & let her know I needed her to go ahead and look at them.  She attempted but Dr. Bowman passed us to go to the patients on the opposite side  of us. I was told by the hygienist we were next to be seen beforehand and this was upsetting to me.  I told her we would just go on because I had an appointment. The hygienist went to let her know we needed to leave again and she refused to come over and directed to get Dr. Bishop to come over to look at the kids. Dr. Bishop  was quick and addressed that one of my kids needed treatment. She was kind and accommodating. Later I called back to set the follow up to have my daughters cavities filled with them and requested Dr. Bishop  and was told they couldn’t accommodate that because of how they saw patients. I voiced that made me consider changing dentists altogether because I did not have a good experience with Dr. Bowman and detailed briefly what happened. The receptionist said in a ugly, smarty tone, “She would be happy to send her xrays elsewhere.” I said, “I am sure you would, you clearly don’t care how she treated us.”  She said in a hateful tone, “You don’t know what I am thinking.”  So I just rescheduled the appointment and hung up. Kelly called back to inform me that Dr. Bowman was unaware that we needed to leave for another appointment and that she would never treat someone like I described above.  Then she said this was Dr. Bowman’s practice and that I needed to find someone else to provide dental care.  I politely agreed.

I have never been asked to leave a practice, I never yelled or cussed I just stated I had a poor experience and preferred one of the other dentists going forward when scheduling my appointment.  There had been no issues prior to this day. The receptionist Kelly was rude and basically told me the things I said were not true and that it didn’t happen.  I think if I had been the dentist and learned there was a patient issue I might would have called the patient family to seek to understand what happened and try to make it right. But instead no apology and was asked to leave because I wanted one of the other dentists to take care of our children.  I didn’t want to change dental facilities at that point because she needed immediate care.  Initially they scheduled her 5 weeks out to fill 3 cavities. I thought that seemed a little long for dental care and kind of felt Kelly did that to get me to go elsewhere. I didn’t say anything about it so she called back within an hour to request for us to find a different dentist office.  I have a new dentist 5 star rated who scheduled us for a dental care appointment next .

If I could communicate one thing in all of this an apology would have gone a long way from the Dentist and the receptionist could have worked to orchestrate been an advocate for this but instead was rude and a catalyst to her losing a client.  I guess they do not value my business maybe because they have too many clients.

text: My son was referred here for sedation. After paying 150$ and being on a wait list for 8 months the 2 teeth turned abcess be ended up in the er having the abcese drained. Not to mention our prior visits the dr comes in with a toddler in underware on her hip as shes looking into my sons mouth that be can hardly open. This was a disater and he will probably never let a dentist around him again. We will not be back here. And im still shocked at the fact tht we waited soooo long for a sedation and drove 2 hours away plus all the pain and suffering from the abcese tht wldnt have even ben abcess if he wldnt have ben on this waiting list all for them to give him a valum?!?!? And since when did one 5 mg valum cost $150!!!! Awful awful. The facility was nice and the assistants were sweet but i would not recommend this place . especially for a sedation or a child with anxiety

name: Cassie Rhodes
text: This pediatric dentist office is the best! My daughter was really nervous but the staff was VERY welcoming and friendly. The dentist comforted her. I was blown away by how patient and gentle she was. I was highly impressed. The atmosphere is one that kids will love. The employee in my photo was the dental hygienist. She was cleaning my daughter's teeth. She was super friendly, as well. From the receptionists, to the dental hygienist, to the dentist, I couldn't speak more highly of them. I was mistaken about my daughter's appointment but the receptionist kindly worked her in. I'm sure they couldn't do that every time but, she checked to see if it would work out that day and thankfully, it did! They gave her a fun bag with a little Disney toothbrush, kid's toothpaste and dental floss. The first visit, on the way out, they gifted her a slap bracelet and she received a scrunchie on the second visit. She had to have sealants and a cavity filled so they gave her a sugar free ice pop, that we have since started buying! I HIGHLY recommend this pediatric dentist office to any kid around! I intend to take my daughter her for years to come!

name: Bryan Kilgore
text: This office is awesome! We have been using them for all 4 of our daughters since they were old enough to see a dentist. The entire office staff treats you like family. They have always been available anytime any dental issues came up- they even spoke to me after hours and called in medicine when my daughter had an issue over the weekend. Today my 2 oldest daughters had to have 2 teeth removed each. They were so nervous when they arrived, but the procedure was quick and they left smiling. We were told the teeth they needed removed were attached to the bone and a little more difficult to remove prior to our visit- but Dr.Vann removed them without any issue and the girls were not, and still are not in any pain. I would highly recommend this office for any dental issues big or small! They take time to explain procedures and the necessary step needed to fix any problems. They are THE BEST!

name: Haylee Watson
text: I took my kids here for the first time this past month. The dental assistant (Kathy?) was so patient with my 2 year old. Dr. Vann was very nice & the whole staff was great. The front office staff were friendly. The wait wasn’t too long. Overall, we had a great experience & my kids are already ready to come back in November!

text: Today was my daughters very first dental visit. She was nervous, but the staff absolutely exceeded my expectations and made her feel so comfortable. Highly recommend!

text: My son had a dental emergency while we were traveling through heading to Tennessee from Texas. They saw him immediately, fitting him in between other appointments. The staff went out of their way to make him comfortable and to get us back on the road.

name: Pete Pappelis
text:
The dentist that I had been seeing for almost fourteen years unfortunately retired so I have been trying to find a replacement. I recently cracked a tooth, and I was referred to a local dentist, so I decided to give them a try. Folks, just because someone has a fancy office does not mean that they are a reputable business, at least in my experience. It is not typical of me bad mouthing a local business and I will keep their name out of this review, but they are an embarrassment to the noble profession of dentistry. When I was seen by the hygienist, she responded, "Oh wow that is bad, you will need to have that tooth extracted immediately". My initial thought was "I didn't realize that a hygienist was also a doctor of dentistry". Then when the dental assistant took the x-rays, her response was identical! What made matters worse the doctor backed up what they said and wanted to extract the tooth right there and then!!! I was concerned and confused so I asked what the cost would be. They brought in the "closer" with the three options. Just yank it, yank it and create a cap with a bridge like a denture or the option that I would probably have chosen, yank it and have an implant which would have cost over three thousand dollars, oh, by the way they have a company that will finance.
Thanks, but no thanks!
So, I walked out and I waited, maybe too long because I got a bad abscess. Now what do I do?
I researched and talked to many folks. I decided to give Southern dentistry a try and thank God I did. They got me in the next morning. Everyone that I came in contact with was very professional and friendly. From the receptionist to the dentist. The dental assistant took the x-ray and told me that the doctor will be with me shortly. Most of my experiences with doctors or dentists are that if you have an appointment be prepared to wait an hour or two before someone sees you. I was seen within a few minutes. Dr. Jessica Robinson was great, very professional and to the point and explained everything in detail. She recommended against extracting the tooth. She believed that the tooth can be saved. Her recommendation was to perform a root canal with a crown at a cost of less than a third of what the other dentist recommended! Very short and to the point treatment plan. NO FINANCING NEEDED!
How refreshing and what a great place. For once a dentist that understands CUSTOMER SERVICE! I highly recommend Southern dentistry. You will not be disappointed.
RAVING FAN

name: Alyssa Stellmaker
text:
This review is in response to a request sent to me after a dental procedure and included a side note that a review of less than 5-stars should be called into the office rather than placed online.  Dealing directly with the office was unresponsive. I’ve been a patient at Southern Dentistry, with Dr. Nebrig, for 3+ years, with numerous procedures performed. I don’t expect perfection; but, when a business won’t/can’t get you in to see the dentist for pain related to work that he performed and waiting too long could cause further or more serious damage, those little, previously forgiven imperfections compound.

Cons:  scheduling and communication.  Can’t get in to see a dentist; even as an established patient, for a dental emergency, or to get a newly placed crown adjusted. If there is a problem with dental work that was completed there-such as a crown that’s too high, pain/possible tooth infection/root canal needed after dental repair 3 weeks prior but persistent pain when chewing, the office will, literally, tell you that they are “too busy” to see you. You have to schedule a regular appt, which is many months out.  Neither pain, facial bruising, nor new pain at the contact tooth will matter. One of the assistants who places crowns will ignore a patient’s cry of pain in hopes of rapidly finishing the crown fitting on a raw tooth. When the crown felt a little high during it’s placement, the assistant didn’t dry the tooth before using the chalk paper and told me to wait until I wasn’t numb and to give the teeth time to adjust; they’d move around a bit and I could easily come back in to get it adjusted. The amalgam fillings have a rough/sandy texture that leaves the tooth constantly feeling dirty.   The wait time before work/cleaning begins is often 45-60 min.  If insurance covers at 50%, you overpay before the work is done at a 40% coverage. This policy is left to the patient to discover. When questioning the math for the estimates and lack of refunds or j completed work, they say they will reimburse the difference after all the insurance claims have paid.  After all of the work that’s been done, I’m aware of only one reimbursement.  Perhaps, the overpayments were applied to other procedures and they forgot to tell me. My insurance claims for one procedure showed that I had overpaid Southern Dentistry by something like $86 and the front office confirmed the same amount a couple months after the claim. When I was at my next procedure and asked to have that $86 reimbursement applied to the current procedure, the office said I had $8 owed to me and my “insurance must not have paid fully for an X-ray or something.”  (They didn’t apply the $8 toward the current procedure or give me the money back.) Providing patients with a break down receipt that shows the portions the patient and insurance paid, and the refund owed to the patient would enhance trust and clarity.  At one appt, the office was in such a hurry to get patients out the door that they skipped my annual X-rays and said they would do them at the next cleaning, in 6 months.

Pros:  Dr. Nebrig has a charismatic and laid back, jubilant personality. He does a great job numbing the area that will receive work and calming an anxious patient.  He takes pride in and enjoys his work, and completes the procedures quickly.  Same day crowns drastically improve an unpleasant and time consuming dental procedure.  The office location is convenient. Silver fillings aren’t used.  The hygienists, assistants, and dentist are friendly and gentle.  The sport-top water bottles provided  after a procedure exemplifies attention to detail and patient needs. The facility is clean. The office accepts a lot of different insurances. The business wants patient feedback.

resp.text: Thank you
