text: Sent me to collection for $76.00. During a PANDEMIC! DONT GO THERE. Wouldn't even accept a payment from from me, she said I had to pay collection  3rd party

resp.text: I'm so sorry for the incovenience.  We make every effort to handle accounts within our dental family, however our universal policy is that after 3 months of sending statements with no response, our balances are handled by a different company.  Once it is in there hands, we can no longer handle the payments.  Our desire is to be a comforting, quality dental home for our community, and having to chase debts takes away from our focus on the people that we need to care for.   We have carefully selected a debt collection agency who has a history of pursuing accounts in an accurate honest way in order to make the process as simple for those involved as possible.

name: Phillip Cotton
text: Amazing job for all staff at this office. Started with a quick  phone call to setup our 1st appointment with a quick turnaround on availability. Once at the office check in was easy and before we had time to complete electronic check in they were ready. The staff went to work right away. Once done they completed my checkout, scheduled my next cleaning appointment, gave me a goody bag and a flower⚘. That is amazing customer service. Very pleased!!!

resp.text: Thank you Phillip! We really try :)

name: Mari J
text:
-->UPDATE<-- Today, 5/27/20, I went in to get 2 cavaties filled. I was a little upset that I had to call to reschedule my appointment, originally for 4/6, (due to COVID)... I guess I just thought that the patients in pain, would at least get a call FIRST to reschedule any important procedures - that didn't happen. Thankfully, I called in late April & was able to get an appt for today, 5/27. I get there at 10:20, my appointment time, let them know I'm there, only to be told, "You're appointment is scheduled for 11:10". This was due some type of system issue they were having (understandable, not their fault). BEFORE they take payment, she goes over what they are doing today + how much it would cost. I immediately asked if that price included the nitrous oxide gas (my cost $50). She said no and amended my new payment to include the gas. After waiting for way longer than usual, I was called in and told, "I'm sorry, the truck hasn't delivered the oxygen".
Yes, I had about 2-3 panick/anxiety attacks in the chair but after 2 hours of crying, it isfis .... for now.
Now, I'm in lots of pain and I can't even begin to describe it ... I can't open my mouth + chewing is OUT of the Question!!!!
I really hope Dr. Nebrig and his staff makes this right bc I thought I FINALLY found a dentist that I can trust + does good work at good prices.
***********************************************
(August 2019) Dr. Nebrig and his staff are MARVELOUS. The environment is very relaxing. I was called back as soon as I arrived (literally no wait time in the lobby - not used to such a quick call back once I check in at other facilities I've visited in the past 🙃). I was greeted with smiling faces and just felt "Welcomed". The girls were the most amazing assistants with my VERY FIRST root canal! They went over + above to ensure I was in as little discomfort as possible. Sidney even brought me a blanket while I waited on my crown to be delivered. Dr. Nebrig has an amazing bedside manner and is very kind and considerate. The staff called me the next morning to check and see how I was doing. I would recommend Southern Dentistry to ANYONE - matter of fact, I've been raving about them since my visit! Keep up the great work!!!

resp.text: Thank you Mari, We really try!

text: Called today as a new patient without insurance, bad tooth ache, Friday after lunch and leaving for a 7 day cruise on Sunday. After calling around I was losing hope of getting seen. However, when I called southern dentistry Taylor said she may have a cancellation late in the day and took my name and number. Not expecting a return call, I kept calling around with no luck. At 3:41 Taylor called me and said they could get me in today! I was super impressed that she was that concerned about me especially late on a Friday. They quickly got me back and I was seen by Dr. Robinson. They diagnosed my problem and we agreed on a treatment plan within 15 minutes. Dr Robinson was so pleasant and made it clear that she was confident and knowledgeable. I have my follow up appointment for after my vacay but am so thankful to know I won’t need emergency dental work in the middle of the Caribbean!

I was at the mercy of trying to get another dentist who wasn’t ours to come in after hrs to fix him up.
To top matters off, they didn’t return my multiple calls until the following Tuesday. They may do good dental work, but they weren’t there for us when we needed care the most! Chose wisely!

resp.text: I am so sorry that you had such a hard time getting in touch with us.  Our Robertsdale office is open on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday.  We have the Daphne location open 5 days a week and my cell phone number is on the voicemail there, so I am accessible on weekends too.  I will make sure this information is on the voicemail so that it doesn't happen again.  Thank you for letting me know, and again, I'm sorry that you couldn't get in touch with us.  Dr. Michael Nebrig, DMD

name: Sharon McMahon
text:
I had a large cavity in my back tooth where my nerve was exposed.  I had put off making an appointment until I couldn't wait any longer.  I was referred to Dr. Nebrig by my parents' dentist in Birmingham, and I didn't hesitate to make an appointment after reading so many great reviews.
I called the office on a Friday to see how soon they would be able to see me.  They found a cancellation on the following Monday and fit me in.  After a thorough examination, it was determined that I needed a root canal, and they were able to do it the following day!  Not only were they able to do the root canal, but they also made and fit my crown within an hour after the root canal was completed!
With all of that said, the staff was absolutely amazing throughout the entire process.  They were so genuinely caring and helpful, taking time to get to know me personally and put me at ease... and I can't say enough about Dr. Nebrig.  He is kind, competant,  caring, and funny... I feel completely safe in his care, and I know my family and I have found a home at Southern Dentistry!

text: Very personable. Took time to explain everything. Nice, clean office. I will recommend them to my family and friends!

name: Jody Hirst
text:
Today was the first day in my 16 year old daughters life that she went to the dentist by herself.
When I asked her how it went, she said “horrible”.
She said she waited for 30 minutes to be taken back.  And when she finally got in the chair, she had to listen to your employees argue about who would clean her teeth.  Neither one felt like working today I suppose.
As I’ve never had a bad experience in your office, I’m appalled at how badly you screwed this up.  This is how you lose an entire family as patients.

R/
Jody Hirst

resp.text: Hi Jody.  I'm so sorry to hear about her bad experience.  As you have experienced in the past, that is very unusual.  I was in our other office when this occurred and as soon as I read your note I inquired about the event.  It seems that it was miscommunication between the hygienists and your daughter.  Rhonda was scheduled to see her, but was spending a lot of time reviewing a complicated treatment plan with her patient.  Faye had a cancelation at that time, and volunteered to see your daughter instead (to try to avoid any longer delays).  The "argument" was regarding whether Rhonda needed Faye to help her out or if Rhonda could see her just a little later.  The effort was to get to your daughter as soon as possible, not trying to avoid her.  I'm sorry that it did not come across that way.  Thank you for bringing this to my attention. name: Brenda Weaver
text: This was my second visit to the office in the last 6 months and I am so impressed with the Dentist, dental assistants and office staff.  I was visiting my inlaws in Sept. when I broke a tooth, the dentist they use in town was too busy to fit me in so we called here and they got me right in and pulled my tooth for a fraction of the cost and with great skill. This time I had a sore tooth and just called to see if I could get in sometime in the next week or two and I got in the very next day, he was able to explain the problem and line up a solution so quickly.We have had the same dentist back home for 24 years, I have been to him repeatedly for problems in that part of my mouth and in one session with this dentist he showed me the problem...Wow! I would recommend this office to anyone who needs a dentist.

resp.text: I'm so glad we could help find the problem. We look forward to seeing you again soon.

name: Karen Golson
text: Nothing but great things to say about this group of people. Dr Scott is so kind and never pressure to do work you aren’t ready for. They have helped me twice when I had a dental “emergency” each time getting me an appointment right away.

name: Andrea Forman
text: Very Disappointed!!!  Dr. Scott seemed very helpful the first visit and told me I had a wisdom tooth that had a cavity, the root was short and he could pop it out.  I agreed that when I came back for my cleaning, he could extract it. (Mind you, I had no pain from that tooth nor was it bothering me at all.) I went back for the cleaning/extraction and after a couple of tries, he couldn't pull it.  So he offered to fill it.  I asked if that would fix it and he said yes.  I agreed and paid for the filling.  That afternoon when the lidocaine wore off, I was crying in pain.  I couldn't sleep and could only get a small amount of relief for about an hour by taking ibuprofen and pain medication.  That was on Thursday and they were closed Friday. I called back on Monday and asked if Dr. Scott could see me because I was in terrible pain from the failed extraction.  I was offered an appointment the next day.  Later that morning, I was called and told there was an appointment available that day, when I agreed to take it, the lady asked if it was for a toothache only.  I told her no, explained the situation and she put me on hold.  A couple minutes later she came back and said Dr. Scott said there's nothing else he can do for you, you need to go to an oral surgeon.  She gave me the number to the surgeon, needless to say I have to have it surgically removed and a bone graft done as well.  I don't see why Dr. Scott couldn't have at least seen me to see if there was another issue that was caused by the failed extraction or to see why I am in so much pain.   I wish he hadn't tried to extract the tooth, especially when the root was curved and not able to be pulled.  I was so disappointed.  I won't be returning as a patient at Southern Smiles.

resp.text: Andrea, I'm sorry you had a bad experience with us. We always try to offer the best possible treatment for each of our patients. I won't go into the actual details of your case on a public forum, but as you can see by our other reviews, you are very much the exception to most of the patients that we see.

text: It's hard to be better than the folks at Southern Smiles.  Their equipment is top of the line, everyone is well-taught in how to use it, and care is the best I've had anywhere. Who'd ever have thought that a visit to the dentist could be a good thing and a high point in someone's day?  Only here, at Southern Smiles is that true.

name: Felipe Vargas
text: I took my 3 year old and they were dead set on me leaving her alone while they closed the door. I understand that most children cry more when their parent is in sight, but my child was not crying or scared at all. I was willing to wait in the hall with the door open so that I would not disrupt the procedure but they wouldnt allow it. They also wanted me to sign a form allowing them to strap her to a papoose board and I refused. I have worked in a dentist office and witnessed first hand the methods they use to restrain children and I wont allow it. There are other ways. I had changed to this office because it was more convenient and close to my home, but I will be taking my children back to Smiles in Oneonta where the dentist allows parents to watch children from a distance. Things are different today than they were before and you have to watch your children more closely. Please do not leave your child alone with anyone that you dont know, even if its a dentist or doctor! To add to this, this dentist said 3 of my children had cavities and that 1 even needed root canals. I could not see the cavities so I took my children to Dr. Hypes and NONE of my 4 children need fillings ESPECIALLY not my 3 year old! Some dentists will take advantage of Medicaid patients and perform unnecessary work just to get easy money from Medicaid. Its sickening!

name: Jeffrey Rush
text: We're on day two of trying to get the mouthwash called into the pharmacy, and they just closed. Over a dozen phone calls and multiple excuses, and we are no better off than before we went there and paid $47. If you go,get the prescription on paper,no matter how long it takes. Waste of time and money.

text: No STARS!!! This place is understaffed. No customer service etiquette. I have been rescheduled twice already and I called back today 6/28/21 and now I have to be rescheduled for January 2022. I need to get my grandson in for his annual check-up. I had to switch schedules with my oldest grandson for the youngest to get his checkup before school. I am frustrated about it all. I am a grandma raising two boys and I need help with keeping them healthy. I hope I can find another dentist soon. I'm done😡

resp.text: Hello Shannon. We understand your frustration and apologize for this experience. Please send an email with your contact information to feedback@advantagedental.com if you'd like to talk with a member of our team.

I mean just because you didn't answer doesn't mean you aren't going to show up for that appointment. I missed work for nothing!!! I wish we had more options to take our children who have medicade for dental insurance.

name: Chandra Hatton
text: This place doesn't even deserve 1 star! My 3 kids had an appointment for 7:30, 8:00 and 9:00 on May 25th 2021. I was told to arrive on time or they won't be seen. I arrived at 7:15 and  when I arrived I realized they don't even open until 8:00. After they opened, I was attempting to sign in and I was told my kids aren't scheduled to come in today because a (dishonest) staff member decided to reschedule their appointment (without my knowledge) to August for whatever reason, then pretended they tried to call me and left so called messages. No phone calls or messages was ever received. The receptionist gave me paperwork to fill out since she claimed people supposedly cancelled while I was there and that my kids will be able to fill the cancelled spots. Well I filled out paperwork and still sat their 3 hours. They only saw one of my kids. After sitting for 3 hours I decided to leave but they kept the paperwork that I filled out for all 3 kids so I guess they will pretend they saw all of my kids but I plan to notify medicaid just in case fraud is attempted by this dishonest office. I even tried to reschedule my other 2 kids and I was told they won't be able to see them until December!!! I would not recommend this Dentist office at all. The staff (everyone that works in the front office) is rude, dishonest and have no care for your needs or frustration that THEY cause. The supervisor is the worst! Don't waste your time going to her with a problem. She doesn't care or try to resolve any issues. I believe she is just as fake and dishonest as the people she supposedly supervises.

resp.text: We are sorry to hear this, Chandra. We are looking into this situation, and would like to know more about what happened. Please send an email with your contact information to feedback@advantagedental.com, and a member of our team will be in touch. We appreciate your feedback.

name: Sarrah Elizabeth
text: Called to check on my sons appt to find that the appt was scheduled in Enterprise. The women who answered the phone was very rude and said we don’t make appts for enterprise, when I never said they did. I had called through another number for the dr directly because I went through my insurance company. I never said it was this locations fault, I was just upset because Enterprise is over 30mls away from us. So, when I asked her if they could still see my son, she went on to say we have two drs and the location your appt is at only has one, so no we can’t see him, our next appt is in June. It’s the beginning of March, how can a location with 2 drs not have an appt or opening for 3months? That’s ridiculous, I called Enterprise and the appt was supposed to be for today and they had us down for the 22nd of March, but the girl apologized even though wasn’t her fault and she said you can go ahead and come on in we can still see you. Wow, the place that only has one dr. Can still see us even though they didn’t have an appt for us today it wasn’t for several weeks. Maybe driving the extra distance to go out to enterprise is worth it if I’m going to be treated with respect and courtesy and they clearly can handle their patient work load with even one dr. So, I’ll be going to Enterprise location, Dothan needs to get their front staff girls in check on how they are speaking to their patients and potential patients.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. We understand your frustration, and apologize for this experience. We will take your comments into consideration. Please send an email with your contact information to feedback@advantagedental.com, if you'd like to talk with a member of our team.

name: Starla Slay
text: This place is awful! First, they cancelled both my children's appointments for today. Due to they said they called Friday and I didn't answer.  I asked if that was a policy and could I see that I signed such form. So they decided to "work in" both children. Two hours later they call me back to day they can't see one child because she has a scratch on her cheek. Then ask what I think, and do I think she should see my child. So she gave me the choice and I chose for her to continue and clean my child's teeth. Then she says that she refuses to because she's afraid it's something contagious from the playground. I say well what could it be? It's a scratch! She says well I don't know the name of it but it's passed around at school from touching. I asked was it impetigo she was referring to (me being a nurse) and she says no I'm unsure. So child one is refused. Child two is back another hour and comes out to tell me they didn't even clean his teeth. They fixed a tooth, that I was unaware needed fixing. And that she "accidentally" stuck him twice in the wrong spot. The check out lady was very nice and kept apologizing for all that happened. If I could rate a negative star I would. This place is very unprofessional and they really need to improve on there people skills.

name: Shawn Hamel
text: My wife and son drove an hour each way to see this office as my insurance has limited options for a pediatric dentist.  According to my insurance company they are a pediatric dentist.  After about an hour of waiting, getting forms/insurance taken care of and being seen the dentist informed by wife that they are not a pediatric dentist and would not be comfortable treating my son as he may need to be sedated to get his cavities fixed.  So my wife was provided a list of pediatric dentists.  I am confused...why does my insurance company think and their website say they are a pediatric dentist then tell my wife and son they are not?!?!  I will be letting my insurance company know this information.

resp.text: Shawn, we sincerely apologize for your disappointment. We would like to talk with you in more detail about your experience. Please reach out to our patient advocate, PatientAdvocate@ GreatDentalPlans.com. Thank you for your feedback.

name: Michael Wiggins
text:
My daughter's had a great first visit here. The front desk lady was very kind, the lady that took their vitals and x-ray was nice, & the hygienist was THE best! We didn't get a long visit with the dentist, but she seemed nice. We were able to go to the back with them and be apart of the whole experience. The children were explained everything in advance and treated kindly.

The waiting area is huge, has some activities for the kids, and a tv mounted on the wall was playing a children's movie. There was a large and well taken care of fish tank as well. There seemed to be only one restroom and it's located in the waiting area. So, once we were in the room we had to walk back to the front to use the restroom. That's the only downside I could think of.

This was our experience for the first visit, we'll see how all the rest go.
-Ashley Wiggins

name: Danique Rouse
text: Katherine and Tracey were the first friendly faces that I met when I came in! Katherine made sure the check-in process was speedy and she was very informative, and she explained the day's process with me, which I greatly appreciated. Tracey was and is incredibly kind! She made me feel so comfortable from the start, especially when she reassured me about my facial piercings as I was afraid that I would have to remove them while they are still healing. She was also very knowledgeable and explained everything to me simply and clearly. I felt that I could relate to her and talk to her comfortably. Dr. Ferreira was so nice and had such a warm energy! She made me feel comfortable, and she also listened and aided me in my concerns about wanting braces, which no other dentist had done for me before. Summer, my hygienist, soothed my worries when she told me my treatment moving forward would be fairly easy. I was afraid that I hadn't been doing my part completely and that she would find something disastrous, but she said my teeth were great and gave me a few tips moving forward! Everyone in the office was extremely courteous, kind, and made the process painless. I was probably out of there within an hour or so and left more comfortable than when I came in. Thank you to everyone!

name: Brandon Rowand
text: I’ve had a lot of dentistry work done, and Aspen has definitely been one of the most welcoming and efficient dental offices I’ve been in!  The intake and wait was less than 10 minutes overall and everyone was incredibly knowledgeable and kind!  Tracey H, the dental assistant who helped me get started, was amazing and really helped the entire x-ray and exam process go by painlessly and easily. Will definitely be coming back in the future.

resp.text: I'm happy to hear you had a seamless visit, Brandon. Thank you for sharing your experience! - Mitch, ADMI

name: Abb Preston
text: The office staff is amazing, they got me in on short notice, during my Emergency. I am very thankful for them.  With over 25 years as a Paramedic, I felt the treating staff could have a lot more empathy toward the patients, but that may come with time. This was a very painful experience, but I do thank them for seeing me on short notice. Apparently my ANTHEM Insurance does not pay for much at Aspin, so this would definitely not be a regular dentist for me, it should pay 80/20 but the quotes for me did not reflect anything even close to that.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback, Abb. If you would like to discuss this in more detail, please reach out to the Patient Satisfaction Team: 1-866-767-0890. - Mitch, ADMI

name: Suzan Graham
text:
First time with Aspen and we were a bit hesitant initially. I didn't like the idea of a chain dentist office, but having recently joined the military, I wanted to set my wife up with a place that would seem more consistent through multiple moves. I've seen the buildings around multiple places, so it seemed like a good idea to try it.
So far, we're very happy with the experience. My wife was happy with the people who worked with her, and the initial processing was pretty easy and very well explained. My favorite part was with Ms. Mayfield at the financial desk. She was very friendly, but also competent and efficient; put us immediately at ease.
I walked away feeling very confident that we understood her dental care plan and the expected costs associated with it. Financially, they were very transparent, and I definitely appreciated that after some previous experiences at other places.

resp.text: Susan, I'm so happy to hear your visit was successful and that you felt comfortable with the team. I hope you continue ot have 5-star experiences in the future! Keep on smiling. - Mitch, ADMI

name: TERRY Glisson
text: This place is a total scam and a ripoff do yourself a favor and don't go. I made an appointment for today to get a cleaning and I even made an extra trip before my appointment time for them to verify my insurance and I was told yes they take it. My insurance pays up to $1500.00 per year for dental. I get to my appointment and after waiting 35 minutes past my appointment time they take me back and do the x-ray then put in another room where a woman comes in and does a very brief look around my mouth and I am told I have no cavities but I do have a very bad build up on my teeth which is true. They also say I have mild periodontal disease which is probably true also but here is were it gets crazy. The tell I am going to see another woman to tell me what it will cost me. I said it shouldn't cost me anything my insurance pays up to $1500.00 to which they reply that the insurance will only cover a normal cleaning and since I need a deep cleaning I have to pay. Then they proceed to tell me that even with my insurance my cost for a deep cleaning will be anywhere from $2000.00 to $3500.00 I told them no way and that I thought they were crooks and walked out. After I left I did a Google search for what it should cost to have a deep cleaning done and it comes back the it should cost between $750.00 and $1200.00 meaning my insurance should have covered it. Now I have no idea how much they are gonna bill my insurance for what they did but I would bet it will take a huge chunk out of my $1500.00 of coverage so when I find a reputable dentist I now won't have the full amount available for that dentist. Do yourself a favor and don't ever go there the will rip you off.

resp.text: I am so sorry Terry, this was not the experience we want for our patients. If you haven't called the Patient Satisfaction team yet, my team would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Cindy, ADMI

name: Pelles Asher
text:
I had a consultation for a simple cleaning and chipped tooth. I left feeling like I was put through a machine! The appointment took twice the time I was quoted and I tried to wait for the person to make a follow up appointment but I ended up just wandering the halls until I found my way out. Im 40 years old and have been going to the dentist every 6 months of my entire life and I have never had such an "unfeeling" dental experience.

I have no dentures, partials, cavities and still felt like I was put through the ringer. I was not hurt, prodded, ridiculed or demeaned in anyway but I did not feel safe, comfortable or appreciated. I will not come back and I would never recommend Aspen. That being said I did get xrays and the dentist came in for a few moments to look in my mouth to verify I didnt have anything wrong. I am going back tomorrow to sign a HIPPA release to have the records and the xrays (I paid for!) released in 7-10 business day to the new dentist I chose over Aspen. Sigh.

I also was recommended a procedure that is not and was not necessary, i refused the chemical prescription strength mouthwash and denied the procedure but was told because I did not accept the (unnecessary debridement) gingivitis procedure that they would not clean (polish) my teeth. Appauled! I wish I could upload pictures of my teeth right now, they are perfect, gums and all. Im sorry but if I dont want to give $100 dollars out of pocket for an optional treatment I shouldn't have too.

Me, myself, and my cavity-less mouth won't ever be back and it would take hell or highwater to ever recommend them for anything other then ripping someones teeth out...which I heard one of their dentist talking about while I was there, I shuttered. Ever see the little shop of horrors dentist?!

Aspen, I get it youre a chain but going to the dentist sucks for everyone...find your roots, try not to be the Walmart of dentistry and Aspen if you do choose to become a WallyWorld, lower your prices for sh*t we dont need.

resp.text: I'm really sorry to hear that, Pelles. If you haven't called the Patient Satisfaction team yet, my team would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Cindy, ADMI

name: keith cavender
text: I had a great experience with this aspen dental office. I had been in agony for 4 days. They were very accommodating and got me the first emergency appt they had. When I arrived at the office they checked me in on the phone in the parking lot in adherence to social distancing during this pandemic. They got me in after an extended wait. But bear in mind this was an emergency appt. Once inside they took a full set of xrays. The dentist came in and discussed the options with me all of which included the extraction of the tooth that had cause so much pain over the last few days. I met with the office manager, paid for the extraction, and went back to wait on the dentist to perform the extraction . I was moved to a procedure suite and the extraction was preformed under local anesthesia. I was released about 20 mins later. I was at the office almost 4 hours but again this was an emergency appt. I returned home and continue antibiotics prescribed by the emergency room 48 hours earlier. The swelling in my jaw and face is slowly going down. The pain is being controlled well with tylenol and advil. Give the fact that they made the emergency appt on Saturday for the first thing available and that I had to drive 40 miles to the office, I was grateful to get the appt as even emergency appointments during the pandemic are hard to get. The experience overall was positive and the staff was very friendly and professional. Thank you a gain for your help with this very painful and unexpected event. I will use aspen dental locally as a dental provider and recommend then to anyone whether having a dental crisis or for routine dental care. The treatment plan and cost are explained up front. They offer third party financing should you need it which could have been a viable option had it been necessary. Thanks again Aspen Dental. Great customer service and great dental service. The cost to get the tooth removed that had caused me such agony for days was $134. Fortunately I had the money to pay for the services. I highly recommend their services.

resp.text: I'm so glad that the team was able to accommodate you, Keith. Thanks for sharing that it was a positive experience! - Dawn, ADMI

name: Eric Chamberlin
text:
I made an appointment with Aspen Dental back in January because they could get me in on short notice. Most of the other dentists I contacted had about a 3 to 4 week wait. The day I arrived they provided me with x-rays and a quick inspection which included reading a bunch of numbers that were above 5 when they measured my teeth. Shortly thereafter they informed me I needed a deep cleaning procedure and a bunch of other treatments. Of course this procedure was going to be over $1,000 out of my own pocket. It was not covered by my insurance. They also informed me of a cavity that would need a root canal and it would be a separate procedure at an endodontist they recommended that of course would be more. They then tried to get me to go into a small room and sign paperwork to pay for the procedure. I left and figured I would get a second opinion.

I decided to wait and made an appointment with Complete Family Dental also in Phenix City. They were able to do a cleaning for me and also fix my cavity tooth with a filling rather than a root canal and Crown. My insurance also covered almost all of the procedures and total cost out of pocket was only $150.

Also there was no deep cleaning procedure necessary and the numbers they read when measuring my teeth were all three or less.

It should be noted that I did not inform Complete Family Dental that I had visited Aspen. I wanted to see what they would say to make sure I wasn't being ripped off and if I indeed needed a deep cleaning procedure or a root canal.  Furthermore the dentist at Complete Family Dentistry fixed another filling free of charge because he noticed some decay building up behind that filling on the same tooth he was fixing already. I had my tooth fixed just this week. Definitely worth the wait.

I recommend getting a second opinion if Aspen tries to get you for their 'deep cleaning' procedures.

text:
They're borderline predatory. If you need a lot of dental work and/or have not been to the dentist in quite awhile, they will overwhelm you with worst case scenarios and a sales pitch that will involve thousands of dollars worth of care that may or may not be necessary. The staff is friendly enough, but you can tell that they've all been brainwashed with corporate training sessions to push the vulnerable into unnecessary treatments. Victoria is particularly cutthroat and snarky.

I'm glad that they didn't get any money from me. The initial exam was enough to see that this is the used car sales of dentistry. Save your time, money and sanity. Steer clear of this dental practice.

name: Andrea Rochester
text: Even during this pandemic, the staff here was very friendly and quick to handle the problem I was having. The imaging was very uncomfortable but over all they were very professional and patient with my anxiety issues.

resp.text: That's so nice to hear, Andrea. It’s great that you felt at ease with the team. Thank you for sharing. - Emily, ADMI

name: Phillip Riley
text: Was met with a warm sense of purpose and felt like I was the only patient in the building! The staff was very friendly and very attentive to my needs. I have been to several medical facilities in my time but, I have never felt more at ease and met with such professionalism and compassion for their patients. Have already began sharing my feelings for this facility and would recommend it to others with a BiG Smile on my face! Thanks to all the employees of Aspen Dental-Phenix City Alabama!!

resp.text: It's so nice to hear that, Phillip. I'm glad the team helped you have a 5-star experience, and I hope you enjoy your future visits just as much. — Kelly, ADMI

name: M E
text:
They gave me such an amazing experience. When I first called, I got the call center and they were not very knowledgeable nor helpful. However the actual physical office is great. I do not have insurance so I was able to get my initial exam and conaultation free, no hidden fees. They were very thorough and had 4 different types of professionals exam me so I got a great idea of how my oral health is and what my next steps are. I only waited about 8 minutes after arrival before I was called back. The whole first appointment was only about 45 minutes.
I went back 2 weeks later for a tooth extraction. Doctor Sara was absolutely amazing. She is so friendly helps keep you calm and very understanding. I was in and out in about 25 mins. It was completely pain free. I appreciate that they charge way way less than others around. I paid less than $150 here when other dentists quoted me $300+ for a simple extraction. I did have complications a few days later but Doctor Sara saw me right away as a walkin and she solved my problem. I will be going back here for all my needs for now on. If you do not have insurance and you are on a tight budget, this is the place for you. No doubt.

resp.text: I'm happy to hear this. It’s so great to hear this about the team, and I hope that you continue to have 5-star experiences. — Dawn, ADMI

name: Dave Wetherington
text:
This was by far the best experience I’ve ever had.
Dr. Sara Yee is very efficient and  caring.

resp.text: That's wonderful to hear, Dave. I'm so glad that the team has made it a positive experience for you! - Traci ADMI

name: Maryann Brown
text: Love this office!!! So sweet and compassionate.  Not judgemental at all!! I have had bad experiences before at other dentists and will never go back. I recommend this office to everyone!!!

name: Southern Style Introvert
text:
God bless every single person that works at Aspen Dental in Phenix City Alabama! I have only seen a dentist twice in my life & was dreading going to get a tooth extracted.

Everyone was so nice and understanding. I have never seen a group of people that all genuinely care about their patients more than Aspen Dental Phenix City does. There was no judgement or pushing of treatments that I couldn't afford. The price was great. I will definitely be back to have work done. Thank you from the bottom of my heart! You have changed my outlook on going to the dentist.

💞💞💞💞 Written by Christine Copes.

text: Worst ever.   They’re nice,  yeah but my boyfriend and I scheduled an appointment for a CLEANING.  We got there,  signed paperwork,  took us back and just told us everything that was wrong and gave us prices and sent us out.   Didn’t even get our cleaning.   Ridiculous.

resp.text: I’m sorry that the team wasn’t able to help. Aspen Dental practices do try to ensure their prices meet or beat market prices, and they also offer flexible financing options to help patients cover the cost of care. If you need any additional care in the future or would like to discuss the care plan you had received during your visit, we’d still be happy to help. name: Dee Turner
text: Be prepared to have an expensive deep cleaning that is not necessary and won't be covered by 99% if insurances. They charge way more than what is Reasonable & Customary for their services. Make sure your insurance actually covers the specific Dentist who works on your teeth!!! They immediately say they take all major insurances but then your insurance doesn't pay because the provider who saw you hadn't completed an application or re-certification to be a participating network provider. When you call and question this, they throw it back at you that it was your responsibility to make sure that specific provider is in the network. How are you supposed to know exactly who will be working on your teeth and that they aren't covered when you are already said you take the insurance?!?!? Basically, they don't take all major insurance and you will be stuck to pay for the entire work that is done. No wonder they sucker you into signing up for financing to pay for the work. They are great at a bait and hook tactic. What a nightmare and all this because of a stupid tooth ache!!!

name: Amanda Pendergrass
text: They gave me my life back. They gave me my smile back. I love everyone at this office. They even cried with me when i finally got the end results and got my dentures. They truly care about there patients

name: Kim Watkins
text: I want to first start out by saying everyone in the Phenix City office is very kind and sweet and really eager to take care of you. I had to get a tooth pulled today and they took care of me like I was their child. Making sure I was ok throughout the whole process.  I was in extreme pain and they made sure to get me squared away.  Secondly the dentist Mrs Sarah she was amazing during the process of pulling my tooth making sure I was ok and if anything was wrong all I had to do was say something.  Which nothing was wrong she did great. I will recommend this office to anyone who needs there teeth pulled or worked on .I want to thank everyone in that office for this wonderful experience I had and I'm so happy I got my pain relief.  Thank you so much and I will make sure to tell everyone about y'all.

text: Dr. Sarah Uehara and her staff are very professional.  Me not being a great fan of the dentist, I was very impressed with how they treated me with respect, and answered all my question and concerns.  This was the first time in my life I was so relaxed at a dentist office.  I highly recommend Dr. Uehara and her staff.  S bunch of caring people, my best dentist experience ever

name: Bria Cox
text: First time patient. Was in there quick. Dentist was a beautiful lady who sincerly cared about me. Every one was very nice. Clean place.

name: Robert Mcintire
text:
Just wasnt happy when i left. Came in with a tooth ache and left with motrin and a 2 week wait. All they seem concerned with is very expensive treatments. I have insurance but it still doesnt cover the level of services they wanted to do. And when i asked about staggering and doing what is affordable they then told me that unless i went with this super expensive plan they would not be willing to do any other work. Even filling a cavity.   They kept pushing their dental credit card on me and when i expressed concern about a dental credit card they assumed i had poor credit and told me they accept co-signers.   I have decent insurance why should i need a credit card for some deep cleaning...  when has deep cleaning ever cost 4k?    Once i went to the dentist for the Root canal he also told me that Aspen is known for pushing expensive procedures and their credit card on people. He reccomended what he called a “normal” dentist and thats where i will be getting my crown done.

One good thing about aspen is everything is state of the art and it feels like a expensive clinic for the 1%. So if u can afford it i bet they are great. Just not budget friendly like they proclaim.

name: Alisa Johns
text: Everyone was very polite and friendly but that's where it stops it goes no further. Was in severe pain with infection all they did is make my tooth hurt more referred me to another dentist which can't send me for a few days and I am currently sitting in the ER with a huge abscess and they're asking why I didn't get any pain medicine or antibiotics I said good question. An abscess and infection in your mouth I'm sure you know this is real serious could enter the bloodstream I'm sorry they didn't find it to be of emergency. My family has tried to Aspen Clinic in Columbus Georgia now the one in Phenix City Alabama I would never return to another one again nor will anyone in my family.

name: Savannah Sasser
text: I went their they we very nice but i got the feel they were all about making money. They told me i needed a lot for cavities filled and other things so i went and got a second opinion i only needed 1 cavity filled and a cleaning! They wanted me to pay and have dental work done i did not even need ! To me that is messed up after my exam they rushed me into a financial office which made me want to get the second opinion.

name: Elizabeth Gibson
text: I had 3 teeth pulled Monday (3 days ago) and my doctor and her assistant were very comforting. The staff are extremely supportive and friendly. My doctor made sure I was very comfortable and wasnt in any pain as she was removing my teeth, and she talked to me the whole time making sure I was ok. Her assistant held my hand and made me feel comfortable as I was getting my gums numb. I really felt safe and comfortable here and I appreciate my doctor, her assistant and the staff for making this visit pleasant.

resp.text: I’m so glad to hear the team could make the experience easier for you, Elizabeth! Thank you for sharing. — Tammy, ADMI

text: Can we put a negative 5 star.  I am in so much pain, called the office because they want to clean my teeth first.  I can not even drink anything how an I going to handle them spraying water in my mouth!. They insisted that I need the cleaning first due to a bacterial infection, so give me an antibiotic. name: Jennifer Pickett
text: Please do not go here especially if you are on a budget. You may go in to have a simple toothache addressed because they are convenient and can get you right in. However, your roped into having a deep cleaning (while your already in pain) and then finally the toothache addressed. But it doesn't stop there. By the time you walk out, they have taken advantage of your state of pain and know you aren't thinking clearly due to the toothache and then before you know it you have this dental plan of action that will cost thousands of dollars. They know you don't have that kind of money available, so they have you sign up for their credit and have changes even before the work has been done. I wish we had read social media reviews before we went there because we are now in the same situation with the horrible experience.

text: They provide excellent care, when they are actually working on you but besides that I've never waited so long for anything in my life, not only did I wait 2 hours to be seen, I also was in the back and felt like forgotten about since I sat there an hour or so waiting on them.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing, we appreciate the kind words and value your feedback. — Julie, ADMI

name: Jeremy Kline
text: Worst possible experience for a routine check up ever in my life. I'm 38 and retiring out the army. So I've had plenty of dentist experiences over the years. First off it's a brand new facility. Yet some how when you walk in you get hit with a horrible smell. Once you get past the smell it wssnt to bad until they wanted 18 xrays of my teeth. Okay not to bad of a idea so they can see everything. Except you will have to listen to the ridiculous joke that the xray tech has patients drool over her all the time. Ok it's a joke I'm ok with that except I had to hear it multiple times. Along with other jokes and comebacks that you may be thinking in your head right now. Then I have to question  how sterile the equipment is. Like I said I had to get 18 xrays. So I had to bit the tools to do so while sitting in a computer chair. There is a plastic sleeve to cover the exposed parts except the metal they want you to bit down on. Then I move to a room and the actual dental experience not so bad and quick. 10 mins to check for cavities. 10 minutes to check my gums. That might be kinda long it was actually very quick. Then I had to sit there and wait for some new employment paper work as I realize I watched 2 episode of daytime TV. I havent seen anyone in a long time. I start to ask my wife via text I wonder if they forgot about me. I go look for someone and finally ask of I'm waiting on something still. I'm told I'm waiting on the facility manager. Who is with a patient hmm. 20 minutes later I get called to their office asked if I had any questions. Then was like no but this was ridiculous and I'll never come back I've been here 2 hours for a check up that i had a appointment for. They said ok thank you. So not even a apology that their service took so long. So I would not recommend this facility to anyone unless you feel like wasting your entire day. Now it's not like it was a ton of paper work it was all filled out it just needed a signature. Which was signed by the dentist when they completed the exam. So I'm not even sure what the facility manager had to do. But if that is the level of management at a new facility they need a new manager immediately. I also wish I could give negative stars.

resp.text: I am sorry you did not have a positive experience Jeremy; If would like to discuss the care plan you received during your visit or you need any additional care in the future, we’d still be happy to help or address any questions. — Kelly, ADMI

Hey, that's fine with me. I want to be as safe as possible.
I wholeheartedly recommend Aspen Dental in Madison Alabama.
Smile and the World smiles with you, frown and you frown alone.
Come by and get your smile on!

name: Cynthia Bates
text:
Tthe absolute worse dental experience of my life! I waited over an hour for what I thought was going to be my teeth being cleaned. No one bothered to explain that is not part of a new patient appointment. The X-ray process was very painful. My mouth felt like it went through a meat grinder. The tech repeatedly said how sorry she was, this is a common problem, etc. THEN WHY ISN'T THE PROCESS CHANGED? I had plenty of apologies, but that did not change the fact that I spent 2.5 hours there and my teeth were not even cleaned! At the end of the appointment, my insurance information was not even entered in the computer and I had to be called the next day with an estimate of how much it would cost to get my teeth cleaned. ($223 after my insurance and a discount!) There were no options......I did what they recommended or I would not be treated. PERIOD.
The staff was curteous and appologized profusely, but that does not make up for poor customer service and a horrible experience.

resp.text: I'm sorry that your experience didn't live up to expectations, Cynthia. If you would like to share more detail about your visit, the team and I would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Cindy, ADMI

They set realistic expectations, provided excellent instructions through the process down to the additional take home whitening kit that can be purchased.

The whitening procedure does work. It is a little painful, but once getting it done you have the take home retainers, so it really is a great investment if you not ready for veneers.

name: Benjamin Ward
text:
I'm no dentist and certainly not an expert on these kinds of things. I'm not one to write bad reviews on businesses but, I think someone needs to say something about this place.

I went to Aspen Dental in Madison with a brown spot on my tooth thinking it was a cavity. I went through their free exam and X-rays. They found that I had periodontal disease as well, which did turn out to be true.

The dentist, either inexperienced or dishonest, told me that my "cavity" was too close to the gum line to drill and that I would need to have a crown put on (roughly $1,200). She also recommended about $6,000 worth of other work.

I have no insurance and the financing person couldn't work with me due to my low income. I left depressed thinking that my mouth was really messed up and that I needed more work than I could ever afford. Thankfully, I got a second opinion.

The second dentist I went to took an X-ray, and looked at my tooth. He informed me that I did have periodontal disease and needed a deep cleaning but, that the brown spot that "Doctor A" wanted to put a $1,200 crown on was not a cavity or even decay. I had my first deep cleaning session and the spot ("cavity") came right off. Again, I'm not dentist but, I'm pretty sure cavities don't just come off.

I thought about just letting this go and not saying anything about it but, I wonder how many people have been screwed over by this business.

My thoughts are that Madison is a fairly wealthy city and most people have insurance or the money for dental work so, they take the recomendations of an "expert" without a second thought. It makes me wonder how many people's mouths and wallets have been ruined by this office. This Madison office has good reviews but, if you look around online, the chain is poorly rated all over the country.

I do not recommend Aspen Dental in Madison. It's strictly for profit, not for people.

name: Zidane
text:
The entire process was a sales pitch.  From the moment your name is called until you exit the front door someone in that building is trying to sell you something. I had 4 different people try to sell me a $200 toothbrush with a $30 mail in rebate. Both the hygenist and dentist were talking and selling other dental procedures but did not discuss what I came in for.

I went to Aspen Dental for tooth pain and wanted the tooth extracted. I asked before making the appointment if this was a type of procedure they'd do. They said yes. So I made an appointment. I showed up and everyone had a fake plastic smile as if we were playing We Happy Few (Google it). I felt so out of place. When I was finally seen the dental hygenist looked at my teeth for about 10 to 15 minutes then spent 30 to 45 minutes talking about how deep of a cleaning I needed, how much everything was going to cost, how important doing that there was, then pushed how they could do it now and it was only $93 (which I found out later was NOT true. It was in total $186). I declined and mentioned my pain and tooth extraction. She brought up that tooth brush and rebate and I had to listen to another 10 minute talk. Then the dentist came in. Another 10 minutes of poking and proding my teeth with a huge fake We Happy Few smile followed by a 45 minute conversation about MORE treatments I needed and AGAIN WITH THE DANG TOOTHBRUSH! I mentioned my tooth and pain again and she replied with "Oh no I have to refer you to an oral surgeon. Sorry." Why couldn't you just say that!? Why did you have to talk for over 30 minutes about all this other junk while Im sitting there nearly in tears from pain as you sell?

Now, let's talk billing. After all those sales pitches you're sent to billing where someone talks forever about payment plans and the debt you have in dental work. Mind you, NONE OF THIS COVERED WHY I WAS THERE! They hardly wanted to talk about my pain or the extraction I asked for. Just how they wanna fill and clean and polish all my other teeth. I felt trapped. Not to mention they "referred me" to someone in Birmingham with the billing guy "texting him and taking pics of my xrays". Felt VERY under the table black market because I asked twice for his information and both times I was told "Oh if you want an appointment we can do it for you and text you the way to get there and stuff." Wouldnt even tell me his name or phone number. VERY sketchy.

Later on, I felt uncomfortable about this "Birmingham guy" and the $350 extraction he wanted to do and how he wanted to use gas, which I did not want because Ive heard bad horror stories about it, so I asked for them to send me my xrays because I wanted to show them to my local dentist. That's when the real moods kicked in. The friendly atmosphere was gone. They wanted no part in sharing my medical records with myself. Before they were "willing to send them anywhere" and were texting them to strangers I didnt even know! Now they decline. I was told if I wanted them I had to go get them or I could just go get new xrays. I told them I did not want to be exposed to radiation again for no logical reason so I would go get them. So I did. Drove 40 min back and was given ONE of my twelve or so xrays. ONE! No fake smiles or sales pitches this time though! Just a lot of eye rolling and weird stares.

In conclusion, they are so happy to get you in there and they flood you with information and dental work with very little processing time. Now, Im not afraid of dentists but this place got me nervous and scared. It wasnt the physical look of the place. It wasn't rude treatment. It was the huge fake smiles and how the whole time you felt like a cash cow they just wanted to milk for money.

TL;DR: All fake smiles and the entire process was a sales pitch, didn't care for my actual problem. Just wanted to sell me $1800 in dental work that had nothing to do with my original issue and a $200 tooth brush. Very reluctant to give me my own records and made the process a hassle. Overall, do NOT recommend this place.

text: I’m so happy to have found Shades Creek Dental and Dr. MacBeth! I was greeted by my new best friend, Kathy and the office is beautiful. Special shout-out to Aileen and Shana! Their service is second to none!

resp.text: Thank you Ponya!  It is always a pleasure when you come to see us!!

name: Brian Bell
text:
Dr. Macbeth and the entire staff are beyond wonderful. I was a new patient in June and then last week I started having a problem with one of my teeth. The office was closed Friday and Dr. Macbeth called me and phoned in an antibiotic. He asked me to call back Monday morning and Kathy would fit me in. I called and Kathy said to come on in. I had a great experience having a root canal and a crown done at the same visit! (I know root canals don't sound fun, but when you have someone knowledgeable and caring, they are not so bad) Also, leaving his office with a completed root canal and crown, was great for my schedule.
I highly recommend Dr. Macbeth's offce!!!

resp.text: Thanks Brian!  We are happy that you enjoyed your experience with us!

name: Cindy Ponder
text:
Dr. MacBeth is efficient and has a great manner about him.  He explains the processes involved in a  procedure—I had a crown done.
His staff is so nice and easy to work with-friendly and helpful.

resp.text: Thank you Cindy!  It is always a pleasure seeing you!

name: Morgan Speir
text: Dr. Macbeth and his team are the friendliest, most knowledgeable group I’ve ever come across. I’ve been coming regularly for the past 6 months and my experiences are always comfortable, educational, and just overall pleasant. I initially came in overwhelmed knowing how much work I needed done, but after the consultation with Dr. Macbeth, I had a clear understanding of what was to come, including my options and financial costs, and I left feeling confident and ready! I’m over halfway done with my treatment plan and I’m so, so glad I went with Shades Creek Dental.

resp.text: Thank you Morgan!  We appreciate your confidence in us!!

resp.text: It was a pleasure to take care of you today, Robbie!  We do our best to make everyone feel at home, and I'm glad we made you comfortable.  Looking forward to seeing you soon!  Thank you!  (Rhonda)

text: I was very happy with my appointment. All the staff was knowledgeable, professional, and polite. I would highly recommend them. They offered a whitening device very affordable to me.

text: Dr. Macbeth is a wonderful family dentist. He is efficient, friendly, and very professional. The office is brand new, it's very warm and welcoming. text: I made an appointment here after seeing good reviews, and looking through their website. From the very first call I made to book an appointment I was amazed. His office is new and has amazing technology. The chairs are very comfortable with temperpedic padding and he has monitors mounted on the ceiling so you can interact during checkups. The hygienist was gentle and efficient. During the entire encounter everything was explained very well and they made sure I understood the plan. You will not be disappointed if you choose Shades Creek.

name: Spandu Induru
text: This is an excellent dental practice. They use their website practically to allow patients to request appointments and enter their dental needs and history before arriving to clinic. Everyone I encountered was thoroughly pleasant from my phone calls with the receptionist, the hygienist for my visit, and of course Dr. Macbeth.

resp.text: Thanks so much! It was a pleasure helping out :)

name: Samantha Palmer
text: Recently had my teeth cleaned and then a few weeks afterwards had a couple of fillings and a crown put on a molar. I loved the fact that it's a pretty small office so they don't schedule a bunch of people at once, and everyone is warm and friendly.  I've been to places that felt like an assembly line, and this didn't feel that way at all - everyone had plenty of time to chat, answer my questions, and make me feel comfortable. Fillings and crowns are never pleasant, but Dr. Macbeth and his staff did a great job making it as positive experience as possible.  The equipment/technology they use is really amazing and made my dental work a lot easier.  Instead of having a dental mold made and the crown taking two weeks, they scanned my mouth and made the crown in office the same day.  That alone saved me so much time and energy.  I'll definitely be back! N

resp.text: Thank you so much Samantha!  We enjoyed meeting you and look forward to seeing you again!

name: Meaghen Sparks
text: I went in to get my teeth cleaned and it turned into a root canal. The team made it as pleasurable as a root canal can be and Dr MacBeth is amazing. He called a few hours after my appointment to check on me and make sure I was doing okay. I cannot say enough about how awesome the team at Shades Creek Dental is!

resp.text: Thanks Meaghen! Glad you are feeling great!

name: Keith Page
text: Another great visit to the dentist!  Beautiful office and phenomenal staff!

name: Rob Dawson
text: I went in to have a sensitive tooth looked at. After Rhonda thoroughly cleaned my chops and x-rayed, Dr. Macbeth came in and explained all of my options. The whole experience was a positive one and I'll not hesitate to return.

name: Charmella A. Williams
text: I had such an amazing experience here! They knew who I was as soon as I walked through the door because my mom had had an appointment about a week prior, and I was impressed by how genuine and kind everyone was. My cleaning was very thorough and my hygienist, Aileen, made sure I knew exactly what was going on every step of the way. I’ve never learned so much about my teeth haha. She did her best to make sure I was as comfortable as possible, including playing the radio station of my choosing. I’ve now recommended my brother and sister in law pay them a visit. I am originally from out of town and I’m pleased to say I think I’ve found my new dentist in Birmingham.

resp.text: Thank you Charmella!  We enjoyed meeting you and your Mom!

Dr. MacBeth and his team are wonderful! Dr. MacBeth was very nice, helpful, and knowledgeable. He was efficient during the visit and so pleasant to talk to! He offered great tips and treatments available for some of my concerns. Loved the experience and this is my new dentist.

His team was just as awesome. Diane was very helpful at the front, and Rhonda did a great job. The office is extremely clean and welcoming. The visit was painless and I will definitely be back!

name: Mike Jorgenson
text:
Shades Creek Dental has been the most pleasant dental experience I have ever had. Even as early as my initial contact (phone call) I felt at ease. From the hygienist all the way to Dr. MacBeth, they listened to my concerns, and went out of their way to make sure I was heard. Even after my procedure, the staff follow-up was incredible. I asked them to follow up one month later to talk about the outstanding treatment plan, and they called exactly 30 days later. When I asked them for an additional 30 days, they didn’t question a thing. I am the type of person who needs persistence, but hates pestering. Shades Creek Dental provided the perfect balance for me.

I would recommend Dr. MacBeth and his staff to anyone as far as 1 hour from Birmingham. This office is worth the drive!

resp.text: Glad you are happy Mike! Great working with you!

name: Paul Lawrence
text:
If you need a dentist, no matter where you live, this is the place to be.
The fact that as soon as I walked through the door, Kathy knew who I was and greated me by name despite never actually meeting me before tells you the level of care and detail in your experience.

They were very concise and prompt about everything they did. You are kept fully aware through every single step of the procedures so much that they are actually teaching you about your teeth. You are encouraged to ask questions along the way so you can fully understand and deepen your learning for proactive care in the future. Rhonda was fantastic at facilitating this. A valuable asset for sure.

The facility itself is nothing less than cutting edge. So cutting edge that in every attempt they will reduce the total amount of visits and time spent in the chair in total (as they understand going to the dentist is not typically the top of the list for most people). There’s even a screen on the ceiling so, if you wish to, you can watch and see everything that is happening while they explain it.

It is like being at a 5* hotel- but at a dentist. Not sure I could ever imagine an oxymoron such as this, but Dr. MacBeth and his team have accomplished this. Thank you, congrats, and keep up the great work!

- update 10/4/19

These guys are not only the best, but consistent! Kathy was always smiling and positive at the at the front desk and made sure everything was totally understood so far as billing and working with the insurance.
It was great to catch up with Rhonda again who is so personable and professional in what she does. Thank you!

I had multiple treatments that day - and I was DONE IN 3 hours - including a bunch of fillings and 2 crowns (which they made there and then!) and Shana and Dr MacBeth worked like clockwork to get it done, while having fun at the same time!
The next day I often didnt realise I had it all done as my teeth just felt normal - totally not what I expected. The work is phenomenal!

Totally blown away by this team - sounds strange, but I cant wait to go back!!!

Thank you once again!

resp.text: Thank you so much and we are happy that you enjoyed your visit with us!  We try to make every patient feel as special as you did today and we hope that you continue to share your great experience with everyone!

name: Robin Clayton
text: Everyone in the office was very friendly, and not at all judgmental when I admitted to the number of sun-rotations since my last check-up. Most impressive however, was the amount of care Dr. Parks took in not only talking to me like a friend instead of a clueless patient. He listened to my concerns, looked into some information for me, and even helped me find some other care providers for some of my issues. I really felt like he cared to inform me about everything that was going on, what I would need to have done, and why certain options were better than others. In short, I feel like he went above and beyond what I generally expect from most health care providers. Dr. Parks was nothing short of amazing with his injection of anesthetic. I actually wondered if anything was happening while I was being injected with the stuff. It didn't hurt one bit. I don't know very much about anesthetic injections, so I can't guarantee all injections were made the same, but Dr. Parks is really good at making it not hurt. My filling went smoothly, and they even got me out 30 minutes earlier than what I expected.  If you're looking for a compassionate, patient-centered dentist,  look no further than Grant Dental. Dr. Parks and his staff are wonderful!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the wonderful review. We really appreciate your kind words.

name: Preston Sherrill
text:
Rude people at the desk! Completely RUDE
Refused to see my brother even though he has insurance.

resp.text:
Hi Preston,
We understand your frustration and are sorry to hear this. We are looking into this situation, and would like to know more about what happened. Please reach out to us with your contact information to feedback@advantagedental.com, and a member of our team will be in touch. We appreciate your feedback.

name: Janelle Payne
text:
I am new to the area and had no luck finding a pediatric dentist for my youngest that was accepting new patients & accepted my insurance. I was leary because they let me know that, due to covid, I could not go in with myself then 4 year old. I prepared him and he understood why mom couldn't come in with him. I became more leary when we arrived. The office is dilapidated from the outside. I called to let them know I had arrived and a "nurse" comes out and instructs me to move closer to the front of the building although I could see the front door and probably would only save her 6 steps. The "nurse" goes inside and I have to call again and wait for her to come back outside. I'm given paperwork and have to call again. Once they come to get my son, the "nurse" couldn't understand that she'd have to open the door for a 4 year old (normally he'd hop out but he doesn't know this lady or this building). My son was in there 20 minutes and I was given no explanation as to what was done or the condition of his teeth. I tried to get him to tell me but it's hard to get detail from a 4 year old.

Weeks later I get an invoice for a routine cleaning (keep in mind my husband, oldest son and I have already gotten routine cleanings completely covered & I've checked my benefits). I have had to call twice and haven't gotten a response yet because billing is handled out of my TN. I believe this office accepts Medicaid and with that you oftentimes get staff that could care less because they assume patients don't have the means to go elsewhere. That's not the case for us so that is my first/last time coming.

resp.text: We are sorry to hear this. We are looking into this situation, and would like to know more about what happened. Please reach out to us with your contact information to feedbackadvantagedentals.com, and a member of our team will be in touch. We appreciate your feedback.

name: Kimberly Childress
text: The entire staff was AMAZING!!!! During a time like this (Covid pandemic) they could have easily been standoffish, but they weren’t! They made sure they protected themselves and me. They were masked and gloved and made sure I was as well. They also checked my temperature at the door! Thanks you guys for making my experience one to remember! Special thanks to Nicole! You guys rock!

I highly recommend Dr. Bradee, I had to just give her a hug after because of how wonderful she was. It’s obvious she loves her job and cares about her patients.

text: My daughter seen her favorite hygienist today, Emily. She takes her time and teaches her how to floss correctly and the importance of keeping her tongue and teeth clean. text: My daughter has been going here since she was 2. I believe she's had 12 appointments. 2 a year. We've had 10 great experiences, and 2 bad experiences. I'd say this place is pretty great. She absolutely adores Emily, and I think she is awesome as well.

resp.text: Regina, thank you for the feedback! We are sorry to hear that you had any negative experiences with us. If you'd like to discuss those, please reach out to our Patient Advocate, patientadvocate@sarrelldental.org, and we will be happy to talk in more detail. We will be sure to let Emily know how much you both enjoyed your visit with her!

So now I'm out 70$ and my child has to go somewhere else. No effort was made. She didn't even offer to give us a minute and come back

text: Dr. Bradee Aiyer and Hygienist Rita took really great care of my daughter today. They were the absolute best!!!! Dr. Bradee and Ms. Rita talked her through it and made her feel so comfortable. She actually looks forward to going back to the dentist, and that's a first for her. THAT'S how you take care of your patients. Very impressed.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing!

text: Absolutely love this office and staff. Both of my kids are patients and they like it as well. They do their best to work with busy schedules and put the kids at ease about any procedures. name: Charles Story
text: First time visit. Typical Exam, X-Rays. We checkout and ask, how much do we owe? We’re told from an Aspen employee that the first visit is free. So I get a bill in the mail, $198. Insurance paid $120, Aspen discounted $61, I owe $17. How is this free? I saw the ad was free for the uninsured but how in the World is that even fair for those who pay monthly for dental insurance? Regardless, we told the employee we had insurance and they stated, didn’t matter, first visit is free. We went in confident that this dental would be the best choice for our disabled son but when you’re issued out a lie on the first visit, it’s a game changer. We want the x-rays, they’re paid for. We must move on.

resp.text: I'm so sorry to hear about the trouble you're having. The team and I would be happy to help with billing concerns. Please reach out to us directly at 1-866-767-0890. - Dawn, ADMI

name: Tammy Landreth
text: Just another number and deposit into their bank account! Everyone was very polite and courteous. Spent 2.5 hours between x-rays, waiting for the Hygienist,  being examined,  waiting,  waiting,  waiting for the Dentist. Dentist comes in, he was very polite,  professional, very knowledgeable. Really liked the staff and what he was teaching,  then had to wait again for someone else to come get me,  waited and waited,  for the Financial advisor to come.  Then had to wait again! Total time was 2 hours 47 minutes,  but only spent 33 minutes TOTAL with ANYONE! The computer magically crashed,  so they couldn't tell me what the work would actually cost me after insurance! The grand total...$11,000.... basically a cleaning, 3 crowns, and an upper denture! But, they said that they would call me in a few days after they contacted insurance!

resp.text: I'm sorry to hear this and can understand your frustration, Tammy. If you haven't called the Patient Satisfaction team yet, they would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you about your experience: 1-866-767-0890. - Krista, ADMI

name: Steven Tonn
text:
I went to Aspen Dental in Athens Alabama.
The Dr. there then - Dr. Walker is a wonderful Dr. & Person. I hate he's moved to Baldwin County. He is traveling back to Athens to take care of his previous patients like me. I saw him Sat 05/22/21 & picked up my teeth that he RE-MADE for me that the Aspen Dental on Bob Wallace in Huntsville made for me Feb 2020 that did not fit my mouth or fit together at all - I have not been able to eat w/those at all. Dr.Walker did not have to do that!
It took awhile bc he had to use The Aspen Dental labs that never followed his instructions. Dr.Walker upgraded my dentures!
The Manager - Greg @ Aspen in Athens is also a good man. They now have there in house lab tech back. My Dentures are a perfect fit & the bite fits together perfect. 15.5 months later I can now eat with teeth & I am Extremely
HAPPY!!! THANK YOU DR.WALKER!!! THANK YOU GREG THE MNGR!!! & THANK YOU JEFF THE IN HOUSE LAB TECH!!!

resp.text: I'm so glad you're finally enjoying your new smile, Steven. Thanks for taking a moment to share you appreciation! - Krista, ADMI

name: Ronda Myers
text: They were very nice, they examined my mouth really good. The doctor was great in explaining that it was a process and it would take some time. The call center had said i could possibly get them that day. I was devastated but they were really sweet about it. Understanding compassionate and was really thoughtful. I realized once there it would not be possible in one evening but they did put me on the cancelation, moved my next appt up 4 days. They really were very good to me. They understood I was a shut in until we could get the dentures made. I really would recommend the Huntsville store on Bob Wallace. The financial gentleman was wonderful, kind, understanding, didn't push no more on me that I didn't want at the moment. I thought that was really great. No pressure. The tech that did my x-rays was gentle and the girl that did my impressions was thoughtful and did a really good job to get me squeezed in and my appt moved up 4 days. The girl that greeted me at the service desk was very helpful and professional. I was greeted upon arrival and ackowledged by all as I left. Even put up with my crying. Very kind and considerate. Even without dentures and crying I felt better leaving then I did arriving. Thank you

name: Michael Smith
text: I have a HUGE fear of the dentist. I’ve had multiple fillings, etc done elsewhere with full feeling and no trust in other dentists. I could tell they didn’t care about myself, only the check I cut them. Although I’ve had a single encounter here, it was such an experience I felt I had too share with all of you. Jessica at the main desk went over and beyond too take care of me and get me in ASAP for extreme some extreme pain. Every employee here treats you like family. They truly care about the mental and physical well being of their patients. These guys have taken my business for good. Dr. Abtin was incredibly soft spoken and made me feel like everything was going too be okay despite feeling like I was shot in the face. This dentist is the perfect fit for anyone with a phobia of teeth. If you’re reading this, and are in similar shoes as I was, this is your sign too check them out!! You won’t find better service in the TVA!  Thank you guys for everything you’ve done so I can come home and eat whatever I want without fear! I can’t wait for my future visits to change my 1/10 smile to a 10/10!

resp.text: It's so nice to hear that, Michael. I'm glad the team helped you have a 5-star experience, and I hope you enjoy your future visits just as much. - Dawn, ADMI

name: Jackilyn Boyd M
text: I have never been treated with such kindness and empathy from any dental staff as i have with Aspen Dental! I had a terrible experience with another dental staff which made me super self conscious to the point i never wanted to go to the dentist again! I finally worked up the courage to make an appointment after 10 years. I was so nervous I ended up calling the day prior to my appointment and explained how terrified i was to the house manager (I believe that’s what he was called). He assured me they would respect my feelings and no one would make me feel bad for my teeth... I can honestly say he is a man of his word! The dentist & the lady that did my ex rays were so kind to me. I couldn’t have asked for better people to be in my corner! You all have no idea how much of a positive impact you had on me and i will forever be grateful for that!

resp.text: It makes me so happy to hear that, Jackilyn. I'm glad you feel at ease with the team, and I hope that you continue to have positive experiences. - Dawn, ADMI

name: Kim Lang
text: I went cause I have 4 teeth that need to be fixed. 1 is broken and the other 3 are cracked. I have been hurting. They did the xrays and exam. We went over the cost of my options. One over 8,000 and one to get them pulled over 1,000. They wanted me to get a deep clean before any work was done too that's 265 I think. So this was on Thursday and around Tuesday one of the teeth started hurting so bad ...I can't eat...hard to drink anything. The pain is very bad. I called on Thursday I told them what was going on ...ask if they could at least for now pull it. I could pay for it. I would worry about the others later when my insurance will pay. I was told they couldn't work me in until the 24th now this is the 6...so I said I can't wait that long I am in serve pain. She told me that's best they could do.I said what am I suppose to do? They told me to go to the ER or call around. NOW IS THE WAY THEY SHOULD HAVE DONE ME? NO THIS IS SO WRONG. I GUESS MY CASH ISNT GOOD ENOUGH FOR THEM. I HAD 3 PEOPLE THAT WANTED TO GO THERE AND ASK ME ABOUT THEM I TOLD THEM DONT GO THERE....GO SOMEWHERE ELSE. I HAVE WRITTEN A LETTER TO MAIN OFFICE. THIS IS DISCRIMINATION IN MY EYES. CAUSE THEY CLAIM TO TAKE WALK IN EMERGENCY PEOPLE BUT CANT WORK ME IN. 😤😤😤😤

resp.text: I'm really sorry to hear that, Kim. If you haven't called the Patient Satisfaction team yet, my team would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Dawn, ADMI

text: I HATE JESSICA’S ATTITUDE.
