name: Angela Lawler
text: I am a little late in posting this review. But, felt it was important because people so easily post negative vs positive. Dr. Walker and his staff went above and beyond to meet my dental needs. I previously worked as a dental assistant while I was paying my way through college. So, I know a bit more than the average patient. I have to say that Dr Walker is far above average in his skill and chair-side manner. I had to have an extraction of #18. I never felt the injections.  And the actual extraction was done with speed and ease.  I hardly had any bleeding. I have assisted on many ,so I was prepared for the stress and pressure that one typically feels. Experience none of that with Dr. Walker.  A couple weeks later, I lost a significant portion of an old amalgam filling on#32. Yet, another difficult tooth position. Dr Walker was aware that I did not want to extract the tooth.  But, could not afford a crown at that particular time. Therefore, Dr. Walker spent extra time diligently repairing the tooth so that I wouldn't lose it. As previously  stated, it's  been about a year and 3 month and the tooth is still holding steady. Dr Walker is a brilliant Dentist with a kind heart. A combination not often found. Not to mention he makes you feel comfortable. As if you've been friends for years. In sum, He's as good as it gets. Aspen Dental and the Florence/Athens AL area are fortunate to have Dr Walker.  If he moves, I will travel to receive his care.  He took the time to earn my trust and respect.

resp.text: It's so nice to hear that, Angela. I'm glad the team helped you have a 5-star experience, and I hope you enjoy your future visits just as much. - Michelle, ADMI

text: First time there. Everyone very nice. Only problem I had was with receptionist. text: We were not pleased at all with our experience at Aspen Dental. Xrays seemed excessive and were painful from the apparatus we had to hold in mouth repeatedly. Cleaning procedure was fine. text: People were very nice. But this place is very expensive.  But i would have been willing to pay it to get my mouth fixed. They claimed to have several financing options to chose from. However if you dont have really good credit you can't get the help promised. I would have been more than willing to pay the payments for help. Becsuse Chemo and radiation ruined my teeth and they are to the point of  me being hospitalized 3 times this year already dye to severe infection in my blood from them. And the so called caring and compassionate people do not care if you can't get the money up front. They could care less about you as a person. I am 54 and my got ruined in a divorce. What credit I had left git ruined when I had to quit work to take care of my husband who had stage 4 lung cancer and passed away 7 months later. I have devoted most of my life taking care of others. I raised my brother and sister, cared for my mother who had ovarian cancer, and my husband with lung cancer. I survived cancer after a long hard fight . And when I need help no one will help. Aspen dental gave me the name if a insurance company to buy dental insurance.  Then I still have to come up with thousands. They only want the money. They will not work with you and will not help you. And I desperately needed the help. No money  no help! And I would gave gladly paid the outrageous amount in payments and been very grateful to them.

resp.text: I'm sorry that you didn't have a positive experience. Thank you for sharing your feedback with us so that we can continue to improve patient experiences. - Dawn, ADMI

name: Rand Jan
text:
Was a horrible scam!! I moved to a new town and picked these guys. Folks were nice till i hit the hygienist. She did not even use a probe to record picket depths, she eye balled it, consequently coming up with ridiculous numbers. I see a dentist every 6 months, i know the health of my gums and teeth.
She told me a need a deep clean, and prescription mouth wash etc.
I had a filling going bad and i wanted that fixed.
They first send me to pay, fair enough,  oh and that cleaning and 1 filling would be 550 bucks, and " you are too far gone for a normal cleaning, and we will not fix that filling unless you pay for the deep cleaning".
At that time i requested my xrays and left, i recognize a hustle when i see one, STAY AWAY

resp.text: I'm really sorry to hear that.  If you would like to share more detail about your visit, I would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you about your experience. You can reach me directly at  844-296-0187 EXT 201152. - Julie, ADMI

name: Mary Bullard
text: Aspen Dental in Florence,AL has been a Godsend! I experienced horrendous wisdom teeth pain and had put off having them removed because I  have no dental insurance and an extreme anxiety toward needles going into my mouth. The pain got so bad that I ended up in the ER, which resulted in my having no choice but to get them out. I called Aspen Dental and they were so kind and helpful! They allowed me to set up an easy finance plan. They got me an appointment quickly. I had the x rays to be examined and the technician was so helpful by talking to me to make the long process of taking so many pictures go by super fast. I had an initial cleaning with a Mrs. Norma, whose vibrant smile and personality made me feel welcome and calmed my nerves tremendously.  During the cleaning they discovered I had gingivitis and they gave me a full treatment. They helped me get an Oral B toothbrush with Bluetooth capabilities and different modes for brushing and cleaning my teeth on my own. Mrs. Norma took time to give me tips on how to floss better so that I can prevent getting gingivitis again. When it came time to have my surgery, Dr. Perry helped my nerves by telling me what he was doing, when he was doing and why. Dr. Perry took time and didn't rush the process. The dental assistant that day was Mrs. Kourtney. I'll never forget how she kept me calm by reassuring me that I would be fine. She said being nervous was ok and normal. She kept telling me I was doing great. I don't think she knows how much I needed that. She kept my mouth suctioned, which I really liked because I have a tendency to have a gag reflex and that prevented it. Dr. Perry earned my trust and respect especially when he made the decision to divide my surgery in half. He did the left side, then had me wait two weeks for the other because he was concerned about my being able to eat comfortably. When he did the right side, he was assisted by a trainee who was kind also and attentive to my needs. If she continues to do as she did, she will be great! Overall, they really are a great place to go for dental needs. Even though I didn't need to use him, it also felt good knowing they have an oral surgeon with their office too. They will now be my go to for dental work! Thank you Aspen Dental!

resp.text: I'm happy to hear that you felt comfortable with the team, Mary! I hope that you find it easier to continue making your oral health a priority. - Emily, ADMI

name: Dedrick Casey
text: Great service fast and friendly.  They worked me in a slot to get my dental work done. I was in and out in no time.

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing, Dedrick! I am happy to hear about your outstanding visit. We really appreciate the recommendation! — Dawn, ADMI

name: Deborah Bartlett
text: My mom has had the same cap put on 6!! Times in less than three months. She eats nothing but liquid room temperature for two days, then soft foods for two days. It still comes off while eating mashed potatoes, bread, and other soft foods. They are very nice in the office but don’t get caps put on there. It is either not molded right, or they are not doing it right.

name: Michael Lowery
text: Called to reschedule my appointment for Saturday and then they have nothing available for a while. Will not use them ever and suggest that you don't either.

resp.text: I'm sorry that your experience didn't live up to expectations. We value your feedback, and I will pass your message along to the team so they can address concerns. - Michelle, ADMI

name: Whit Shoemaker
text: Usually we see another dentist, but Aspen is the only place around here open past 5. To start, the staff are not friendly. We came to have my husband's tooth pulled, but Dr. Walker had him come back another day (next available appointment was a week later, so he had to suffer for.a week) because he didn't want to stay a little late. As if it were our fault they fell behind and we didnt get called back until well after his scheduled appointment. Our appointment was at 5:45, and we didn't get called back until almost 7. l So we had to make two trips, and they were supposedly short staffed both times. If you are looking for a friendly, time conscious dentist, try Dr. Chastain in Killen.

resp.text: Hi, thank you for your feedback.  I will certainly pass this information along to the staff, so they can address your concerns. — Dawn, ADMI

name: Made By Tae
text: All the workers were very nice and professional and I felt very comfortable being there and the service was exquisite 💙

resp.text: Shantae - I'm glad you enjoyed your visit with the team. Thanks so much for taking the time to share! - Stephanie, ADMI

name: Bobby Frye
text: I was very nervous going in for my appointment but as soon as I walked in the building that all melted away. The staff was amazing. They were very welcoming and inviting. X-ray tech was very kind and made me feel very comfortable even though I was in pain. No long waits or beating around the bush. Dr was straight forward as well as the hygienist. Treatment plan was explained to me in terms everyone can understand and there was no extra added to create more revenue. Aspen dental has won my business and I urge everyone that is having trouble or doesn't at least walk in and meet the staff. It's free for your first consultation and x-rays. You have nothing to lose but a wonderful smile to gain. Aspen dental is where it is at.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, Bobby! The office will be thrilled to hear this! -- Kelsey, ADMI

name: Lisa Simpson
text: Very friendly and took a lot of time helping my 85 year old mother who had no insurance.

resp.text: That's wonderful to hear, Lisa. I'm so glad that the team has made it a positive experience for you and your mother! - Emily, ADMI

name: Brittany Hurt
text: I had a great experience the receptionist was nice. The took a lot of x-rays with a very uncomfortable tool I could not even began to tell you what they call it, but the young lady did very well with taking the x-rays and making me feel welcomed. The dentist was amazing and she had a really great sense of humor!! Everything seem to go very timely and maybe it is something I am not aware of but I waited 30 minutes after the dentist left for the office manager to go over finances. No offense she really had no emotion or sympathy. I would not refer her to anyone, but maybe she was going through something so I do not know.

resp.text: Thanks for sharing Brittany, we appreciate the kind words and value your feedback. — Kelly, ADMI

name: Dustin Haraway
text: Best dentist office ever.  Great folks.  Great atmosphere.

name: Mathew Hensley
text: They are great people very friendly and good times on getting things taken care of.

resp.text: I'm so glad the team helped you have a positive experience, Mathew I hope you enjoy future visits just as much. - Julie, ADMI

name: Bradley Okelley
text: As a new patient I went in with all my info and insurance info. I explained I'm on my wife's insurance and I'm covered there. Rude lady at the front desk on 03/04/20 said that she could not do anything for my without my wife's full social security number. I explained that I only knew the last 4 and that my wife is a nurse on 12hr shifts so there's no easily contacting her. After a shrug and rude glare I decided to take my business elsewhere.

resp.text: Hi, thank you for your feedback.  I will certainly pass this information along to the staff, so they can address your concerns. — Dawn, ADMI

name: Autumn
text: The staff here made this experience a great one. I went to an Aspen Dental in another state and it went horribly. Regina and Norma were so nice and kind I’m so glad I decided to give it another shot. I think I spoke with the dentist for maybe 10 seconds and he went on about his business. Regina and Norma didn’t make me feel rushed even though it was already passed closing time. I wish I remembered the woman’s name at the front desk because she was amazing as well. Very great experience.

name: Juliette Winston
text:
My experience at Aspen has always been wonderful. The teams that worked with me were professional in every aspect of the requirements of the business, and in showing courtesy to those who need the service.
In my experience meeting people from the community in the waiting room is special. We communicate with each other as if we were family/friend no matter the color of skin, culture, or background.

name: Kristin Taylor
text: They stopped taking my insurance about 2 weeks ago and never let anyone know there was a cap and I used 20 dollars in gas and missed work to drive up there only to find out they wouldn't help me and it was even an emergency. Then while I was waiting on the financial woman the nurse I had was very rude to me and said are we doing anything or not and I was waiting to be told what to do. I am very upset and will be filing a claim against them for all of the rudeness and nonsense that could have been avoided if they would have let all insurance know that there was a cap. My insurance even filed a emergency out of network form and they still would not help me I am beyond upset.

resp.text:
Kristin,
Thank you for providing this information.  I would really like to speak with you.  Will you please call me at (844) 296-0187 ext. 201152 — Julie, ADMI

name: Matthew Waddell
text: Scheduled an appt showed up just to be told they couldntcsee me for 4 to 6 weeks after the fact I was told to be the r at 8 clock took  off work etc

resp.text: I'm really sorry to hear that, Matthew. If you haven't called the Patient Satisfaction team yet, my team would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Dawn, ADMI

name: Debi Nehls
text: This was the best service I have ever had in going to the dentist.  Very informative about my care and teeth health. Each person was friendly and caring.  I am definitely going to recommend Aspin Dental!!! 🤗😊😉

resp.text: I'm happy to hear that, Debi. It’s great that you felt at ease with the team, and I hope that you continue to have 5-star experiences. - Emily, ADMI

name: Melissa M
text: I have absolutely horrible anxiety so the minute I was taken to the room I freaked out. The whole entire staff couldn’t have been more helpful and calming. I was very impressed by how much they cared for me as a person and wasn’t just looking for a payday for the work I needed done.

name: Dale Morgan
text: Never been but had an emergency while my dentist was out of town so no choice...pleasantly surprised.....nice office....minimal wait time....extremely personable and friendly staff...enjoyable experience considering...would definitely recommend

name: Holt Hargett
text: One word... I can describe my whole visit in one word!!! AMAZING!!!

resp.text: We’re happy to know you had a great experience, Holt.  Thank you for sharing! – Courtney, ADMI

name: Josh Cody
text: Friendly staff and clean establishment as well. Had an issue on the day of my 1st visit due to a gas leak the building was evacuated. However they asked if I could come back at my earliest convenience and I could be worked in. I did just that and was worked right in as soon as possible as well as my daughter for a hygiene exam and cleaning. The reason I only have the 3 stars is the prices for service is higher than expected. I was under the impression it was a more affordable dental office by advertisement but it was not. Was actually a little higher than other places in the same area.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback and kind words Josh. I will pass this information along to the staff to address. Annette, ADMI

name: Emily
text: I was hopeful that Aspen Dental would workout for me judging by the fact that I travel for work often and it would be convenient with the various locations. I am sad to say that my experience with Aspen has been extremely unsatisfactory. Not only has it been very pricey, I have been given multiple excuses as to why they cannot give me the filling I need. I have been to Aspen a total of five times and have been schedule for yet ANOTHER cleaning rather than the filling they have promised to give me "at my next appointment." I understand the process of dental procedures, but I have never been to a dentist that has promised me to get my issues fixed during my next appointment only to keep pushing it back further and further with every visit. I have requested a refund for the payment I have already given for the filling I have not received. I was told I would have the money put back on my card over a week ago and it still has not happened. I have tried to call multiple times. I am either put on hold or hung up on before ever speaking to anyone. This is by far the worst experience I have had with any professional practice. I will be finding a local dentist without a doubt.

resp.text: I'm so sorry you didn’t have a positive experience Emily. Patient satisfaction is very important to Aspen Dental practices. If you would like to discuss further, please call me at (315)454-6000, extension 201806. I would be happy to speak with you. Annette, ADMI

name: Amy Hunt
text: Wasnt happy with the prices way to expensive and the  receptionist that went over everything with me and the cost wasnt friendly at all she was very rude so i will not be back. Other staff was very friendly !

resp.text: I am sorry you had such a poor experience, Amy. I will certainly pass this information along to management to review, and help make improvements to future patient experiences. Thank you — Kelly, ADMI

name: Irene Viescas
text: The office atmosphere, Dentist, and assistants were all very good - 5 star; but the wait time was a bit long - over an hour due to absent personnel, I was told. I must say in all fairness, though, this was a make up appointment due to my own tardiness earlier in the day. I would recommend their services though stipulate - arrive on time.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback and kind words Irene.  I will pass this information along to the staff to address. Annette, ADMI

name: Tina Peden
text: They were all so nice and work with me on a plan to smile again 😊

resp.text:
Tina,
Thank you for sharing, we appreciate the kind words and value your feedback. —Julie, ADMI

name: Tonya Hinton
text: It was a nice experience. The staff was up beat and very friendly. I basically didn't feel a thing when I got a wisdom tooth pulled not even that dreadful first little pinch to numb my gums.

resp.text: I'm glad that you felt at ease with the team, Tonya. Thanks so much for sharing that you had a 5-star experience. - Emily, ADMI

name: Tesha Cherry
text: The dentist was beyond rude, disregarding, disconnected, and disrespectful. Not only did I spend less than a minute with him and got none of my questions or concerns answered but he also rudely tossed the piece of floss on my chest as if I were black trash, stated “you have no cavities”, and walked out. He didn’t even give me 5 minutes of his time. I’ve never been to a visit where the professional was so out of touch with his patients - not sure if it is just with brown skin or everyone. Surely it can’t be everyone based on these other reviews, right? That’s what I thought. You’d think he’d be smart enough to at least pretend to care. First and last time at Aspen for sure.

name: Jeremy Ladd
text: They was really nice. The nurses that they have on staff is the best nurses I have ever dealt with. They are very friendly and they do everything they can to help you out. The main nurses I had was by far the best nurse I have had ever. I recommend that you go to Aspen dental to if you need a dentist.

name: Zollie Church
text: Everyone was nice I would recommend them to everyone clean place

name: Kathy Hallman
text: The staff was helpful, and just the sweetest people! Enjoyed my visit!

name: Cindy Blalock
text: I was fixing to lose my insurance and the staff and Dr went above and beyond to help me attain healthy teeth and gums before this happened. They were absolutely wonderful! Thank you Florence, Alabama Aspen Dental.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, Cindy! The office will be thrilled to hear this! -- Kelsey, ADMI

name: Tom Davis
text: New patient .. Quick log in and excellent service

resp.text: I'm glad you had a positive experience, Tom. I hope you enjoy future visits just as much. - Emily, ADMI

name: Robbin Willingham
text: I am usually really anxious about going to the dentist BUT Dr. Perry and his staff made me at ease. I want to thank ya'll for making me actually not dreading going back to the dentist. Ya'll are awesome! I found my dentist for now on.

name: Megan Powell
text: The staff was very nice and helpful. I went here because my regular dentist didn't have an opening, and I was having an emergency. After extensive ex ray's and an evaluation from the hygienist and the doctor, I was then taken to where we could talk over my care plan. They discussed many things I needed done. I told them I had really needed work on my tooth immediately. They checked to see if he had an opening, and he did, an hour later thank goodness. It's a different experience than your "traditional" dentist, however, I have no complaints on the work they did with my filling.

name: Tom Davis
text: New patient .. Quick log in and excellent service

resp.text: I'm glad you had a positive experience, Tom. I hope you enjoy future visits just as much. - Emily, ADMI

name: VJ
text: This place says that they help the uninsured...I say ha...no they don't nor do they offer any kind of payment plans but oh they do want you to apply for a care credit card which has an interest rate of over 26%. This place left me with a bad taste in my mouth.

resp.text: I'm sorry that your experience didn't live up to expectations. If you would like to share more detail about your visit, the team and I would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Dawn, ADMI

name: Mary Ann Wakefield
text:
The staff and dentist ( Dr. Jerry ) we're great. I am scared to death of dentist. I had one in jasper,al at 1 day dental that pulled all my top teeth without them being completely numb. Dr
Jerry explained what he was doing before he done it. Most of all he made sure I was completely numb before proceeding to extract my teeth. Took extra shot but I didn't feel anything when he pulled them. I'd highly recommend Aspen Dental in Florence, Al. Thanks Dr. Jerry and all your Staff

name: Kathy Hallman
text: The staff was helpful, and just the sweetest people! Enjoyed my visit!

name: Norma Gibbs
text: They made me feel so comfortable. I didn't get embarrested at all. The staff was very friendly.

name: Rodney Ledlow
text: The tech was very friendly and knew what each was suppose to b taking care,the only problem was the scanning machine,it's a bit to thick around part that goes around gum line and teeth ,but other than that experience I had a really good visit.and will be using them again.

resp.text: I'm so glad the team helped you have a positive experience, Rodney.  I hope you enjoy future visits just as much. - Julie, ADMI

name: Benamen Jones
text: Wait time wasn't good was told that I would be seen at 9:45 it was almost 10:30 when I finally got back there other than that it was a good experience well as good as it can get seeing a dentist and all lol

resp.text: Thanks for taking the time to let us know, Ben! We’ll be sure to pass this along. — Dawn, ADMI

name: Nain Alejandro
text: Really bad experience. They were definitely only after the money.

resp.text: I am sorry you did not have a positive experience; If would like to discuss the care plan you received during your visit or you need any additional care in the future, we’d still be happy to help. You can reach me directly at (844) 296-0187 ext. 201706. — Dawn, ADMI

name: angie roberts
text: It was very pleasant. Everyone is so nice. Kelsey and Dr. Morris were very patient with me. They made me feel very comfortable and explained what they were going to be doing with me.

resp.text: It's great to hear that the team has helped you have a positive experience. Thanks for sharing, Angie. - Emily, ADMI

name: Lesia Jerrolds
text: It was a terrible experience. Then I had to go back five times before I finally found another Aspen dental clinic in tupelo and they were great.  Got it fixed first time.  And then I found out that they charged me $500 more than I agreed to.  I will never go back to that place again.

name: Gary Rose
text: My experience was fantastic. Dr. Morris and his staff have the 2 P's going for them PROFESSIONAL AND POLITE making you fill that you are there to put a smile on your face as they did with me. I have been in other Dr. Offices and the staff are ot polite and wanting to get the day over with. Not at Florence Aspen Dental Clinic. Every one in the office treats you as a human being with a problem that they can suave, highly trained and knowledgeable what it takes in the dental field to make the patients happy. I would and do recommend Aspen Dental for the ones that need a professional dental service.  :)  :) :) :) :) smiles from me.

name: Robert Robinson
text:
NOT GOOD.  I called for a cleaning for my teeth and a general checkup.  After 3 hours I was told that they would not be able to clean my teeth (the main reason that I had scheduled the appointment) and that my teeth needed approximately $5000 of work.  When I asked how much the cleaning would cost they said $350 plus--way more than I have paid for cleanings in the past.  Consider this:  If I took my vehicle to a mechanics shop to get an oil change (teeth cleaning) but they spent 3 hours evaluating everything else wrong with my car telling me that it would cost $7000 to fix the other items in my car and that they could not do the oil change during this visit--the main reason that I had come to their shop--unless I scheduled another appointment and that it would cost $600 to do the oil change--WAY MORE THAN THE GOING RATE-----------WOULD YOU USE THEM AGAIN?  I think not.

This was absolutely the worse dental experience I have ever had in 60+ years.  WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS CLINIC TO ANYONE!

name: Deidre Thomas
text: The front office is not knowledgeable. She overpriced me on procedures that are covered by my dental plan. Please do not take any children here. The Dentist is very nice but he will only take and examine the X-ray. Any dental work will be referred out! Also, they have the craziest policy......a customer has to get X-rays and then come back another day for a cleaning! Who has time for this??!? Any hoot, I played along since they already filed my insurance and I made another appointment.(months later) I was scheduled at 1030am, I showed up ap 10:10....I sat there until11:25 until I finally left. Total waste of time. I would give them a negative 4 if I could. I will say this, the dentist is nice and very professional but he needs to drop the Aspen brand and go into business for himself.

resp.text: Hi Deidre, I’m sorry that you didn’t have a positive experience. I have passed your feedback along to the Patient Satisfaction team, but I also know they would like to discuss this with you. Please call them at 1-866-273-8606 so they can help address your concerns. - Emily, ADMI

name: Rachel Bean
text: Quick and friendly service...the staff is courteous, thoughtful and make you feel incredibly comfortable.!!

name: Amanda Bevis
text: Excellent staff. The Office manager was very helpful and answered any questions we had. Very clean environment!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words and positive feedback Amanda! The office will be so happy to read this. — Kelly, ADMI

name: Michael Dixon
text: COULDNT ASK FOR A BETTER EXPERIENCE . I was fixed up sent out and pain free befor I knew it

resp.text: Thank you for sharing, we appreciate the kind words and value your feedback. — Julie, ADMI

name: Nikki Hill
text: Awesome!!!they actually want u to go to the dentist

resp.text: I'm glad you enjoyed your visit, Nikki. Keep smiling! - Emily, ADMI

name: Barbara webber
text: everyone was very nice treaded me like a person felt like I was welcome

name: Raymond Nichols
text: U all r very nice people Thanks to you all very much.

resp.text: I'm glad you enjoyed your visit, Raymond. Thanks for sharing! - Emily, ADMI

name: Kelvin Ransey
text: They were really nice and professional. I understood everything they told me and I was very impressed with their knowledge and kindness.

name: Crystal Cartwright no d no BJ d LP sno
text: Amazing staff very friendly and sweet. They got me in quick and even worked me in for a double extraction the next morning . I'm very pleased with my dental care.

resp.text: I'm happy to hear this, Crystal. Thanks for sharing! — Kelly, ADMI

name: Veola Baker
text: I absolutely loved my visit with you all. Everyone showed great interest in helping me with my need and I'm looking forward to have Aspen Dental take care of my needs.

name: james mcgee
text: great people very friendly an respectful

resp.text: That's wonderful to hear. I'm so glad that the team has made it a positive experience for you! - Traci ADMI

name: Michael Thomas
text: I was not a happy camper when I left.  I had a appointment to  get  1  tooth pulled out  . After 1 1/2 hrs . Waiting  I went back and the doctor looked and checked  and sent a  lady in to check my gums and other stuff.  Gave me  3 pages  of work they want to do for  12,000   dollars  and never  pulled my broken tooth.  I won't go back

name: Sherry Crosslin
text: Office staff is great! Friendly and professional, they put me at ease right away. If it were only the staff being rated, this would be a five star review. The dentist however is only mediocre. I was in for two extractions and while he did pull the teeth, he did not loosen with a scalpel before the extraction. This will prolong healing and would only have taken an extra minute. He is a bit overbearing and in too much of a hurry. He did not council me about follow up care for my extraction and seemed to be in a bit of a huff about me not scheduling appointments with the hygienist. This was a good emergency visit, and in a similar situation I would go back.

name: Iris Barillas
text: Poor service , I expend two and half hour and did't even have the chance to see the doctor,  I couldn't wait for longer, I don't recommend these place , people please don't go!!! Bad bad !!

resp.text: I certainly understand your frustration, Iris. I will certainly pass this information along to management. Please call me at (315) 454-6000 ext. 201526, at your convenience if you wish to discuss further. — Kelly, ADMI

name: Eric Dossey
text:
I had an excellent experience at the clinic in Florence, AL..

Dr Morris and his staff were very professional in their work and explaining all the dental care that I was getting performed.  The Dr and staff were very easy to talk with and we had a few laughs in our conversations.  I would recommend them to anyone that was in need of dental care.

Eric J Dossey

name: Abby Forrester
text: Incredibly displeased.  The one thing I was impressed by was the fact that I could schedule an appointment online - I chose Apen initially because they seemed to run excellent specials for patients with no dental insurance. After arriving I was taken back for a full set of x-rays, was never asked if I wanted them done, and spent about 20 minutes having them completed. I was then taken back and told the hygenist wasn't in office today so the dentist would be coming by soon. The dentist then came in and performed a gingivitis probe without my consent. She ordered another test and then I was sent to billing - all without my teeth being cleaned which was the sole purpose of my visit. In billing I was told that the new patient process is a two appointment process and I would have to come back later in the week to have my teeth cleaned. I was then given a $306 bill for the services provided without my knowledge or consent. Very displeased with Aspen Dental and will not be returning.

resp.text: I am sorry to hear about your experience. If you would like to discuss further, please call me at (315) 454-6000 ext. 201526 I will be happy to speak with you. — Kelly, ADMI

name: Janice Dodd
text: The staff and dentist was very helpful and nice. I did not have to wait very long either. They informed me of any problems I might have. I would recommend them to anyone

name: Alicia Weber
text: Terrible! Steer clear! No sense of urgency. Dr. calls in sick! The wait was absolutely unacceptable. Waited over an hour the first visit and told we would need to come back because their sterilizer wasn't working. Second visit cancelled 15 min. before the appointment because the Dr. called in sick.... It was a Friday.... I hope he enjoyed his long weekend as my mother spent it in pain. Third and final visit. Waited over an hour and still didn't get a resolution. Made an Appointment with another dentist in Florence (Cypress Creek Dental), Dr. Kennedy was amazing. Got my mom in right away, assessed her, and got her in for a root canal with Smith & Smith, we headed over and her problem was fixed by noon.... The same day!

resp.text: I'm so sorry you did not have a positive experience, Alicia. I will certainly pass this information along to management. — Tammy, ADMI

name: Crystal Staples
text: Love the staff very friendly,, great dentist

resp.text:
Crystal,
Thank you, We appreciate and value your feedback. — Julie, ADMI

name: Tamara Kelli
text: I would rate a zero, if it gave me that option. Made my first appt. They took xrays, and came up with a treatment plan that was well over 10,000.00 to fix my teeth which aren't in terrible shape. I made the comment that they should just pull them all and give me dentures to which the dentist and hygienist said "no no no"! That I had plenty of great teeth. Well if that's the case why 10,000.00??? Then the dentist had the nerve to tell me that dentures would cost more. Are you kidding me??? Dentures are over 10,000.00?! This place is filled with hustlers and is shady. Very sad they treat people this way. Even their financial planner treated me unkindly when I told her I couldn't pay 10,000.00 that I am a single. Mom.

resp.text: Thank you for providing this information, Tamara.  I would really like to speak with you.  Feel free to call me at 315-454-6000 x201802. - Kelsey, ADMI

name: Akari simpson
text: I like the way they do a full evaluation of your mouth. My wait wasn't that long. Everyone was nice. My only major complaint is that I feel like they should tell you that the $150.00 oral b toothbrush is optional and not just include it in the total when your paying for a procedure. Courtney failed to mention that i was paying an additional $150.00 for a toothbrush. Him nor Audry made that clear. Courtney made it seem like i could not recieve my treatment w.o paying the total amount he gave me. They are very unprofessional and just want your money. They should be more thorough in explaining expenses and not make it seem like everything is included. If you choose to go here, be sure to double check everything and not just go by what the employee tells you.

resp.text: Hi Akari, I'm so sorry that you didn't have a completely positive experience. I have passed your feedback along to our Patient Satisfaction team, but I also know they would like to discuss this with you. Please call them at 1-866-273-8606. - Emily, ADMI

name: shree white Davis (ReeRee)
text: They are great,And Super Nice Staff, They Do there best to Take Care of You And Your Dental Problems , If your a new patient then your consultation, and xrays and visit with the doc to tell you what they can do and what your options are. And that is all free of charge ,thats for new patients ,and they also do the best they can to try to find a way to help you finance dentures and dental work if needed through a couple of different places . They are Awesome Folks :)

name: Emily Williams
text: Wonderful, friendly staff! I had a great first time experience.

resp.text: So happy to hear about your great experience, Emily! The office will love reading this. — Kelly, ADMI

name: Melanie Schardt
text: It was a great first time experience. Everyone is really nice. Would recommend.

name: Kim Clayton
text:
Horrible place for dentures!!!  My mom had some dentures made here and they have never fit her mouth!!!  When she eats they literally fall out of her month.  Dentures will not stay in place even with denture grip.  She has been to Aspen on numerous occasions to get them adjusted but the dentures still do not fit.  Aspen Dental boast "money back guarantee" so mom finally gave up and returned them.....only to get a letter in the mail two weeks later....telling her to return the dentures or they were going to bill her.  On her last trip there...she had returned them.

During several visits, other patients complaining about the work on their dentures as well.  This is fair warning to avoid this place!

name: Theresa Boger
text: Very perfessional and friendly.

resp.text: I'm happy to hear that, Theresa. Thanks for sharing! - Dawn, ADMI

name: Stacy Thomas
text: would not recommend letting them work on my dogs teeth. Went with a toothache was told needed to be pulled but roots were long so I would need to see their oral surgeon, then a dental hygienist came in started scraping on my gums, told her she was hurting me, she said well if I canr get this bacterial out can't do anything for u when the oral surgeon comes and won't be able to do anything til u let us do this. Told her it hurt too bad and I had to be able to talk because the last time someone done a deep cleaning I couldn't talk for 2 days, she said well if u would clean your teeth properly then we wouldnt have to do this. then wanted to put me on a gingivitis regimen. I would have to come back every month to let her do this then every 6 months if I can do it correctly. went to finance dept. wanted to charge me $2000 to pull a tooth that wasn't even a wisdom tooth. Told them I couldnt pay that and she proceeded to tell me get someone to co sign for me. Had them write me a referral for another dentist. The doctor was alright but the other staff terrible and VERY OVERPRICED. they lure u in for the free consult and xrays then try to screw u over with their pricing. Will never go back.

resp.text: I am sorry you had such a poor experience, Stacy. I will certainly pass this information along to management. Thank you — Kelly, ADMI

name: mimi Gloria lewey Rhodes
text: Would not recommend to any one.

resp.text: I am sorry you did not have a positive experience, Mimi. If you would like to discuss further, please call me at (315) 454-6000 extension 201791. I will be happy to speak with you. — Tammy, ADMI

name: Mary Smith
text: Woyld highly recommend them the staff was awesome the dentist was perfect

name: Lulu Cochran
text: Let me start by saying I was up all night with a horrible toothache, my dentist was closed I wanted to find one but they had to be a BC/BS provider and do root canals as I was almost sure I would need one and only could take so much time off work so I talk to the 1-800 line at Aspen dental they inform me they do root canals on all the ones that they can at this location,,,they are a BC/BS provider as per ads so I believe they will take care of me so i’am not in this pain all weekend as my dentist wouldn’t be open til Monday ,,,,well I get there they take an x-Ray of one tooth,the doctor taps on two teeth then tells me I will have to go to the root canal doctor that has done my other root canals and for me to call them Monday ,,I said but the lady on phone said y’all do them ,,they said not anymore at that location that doc was gone 🤷‍♀️🤦‍♀️ So I got nothing done that I needed after taking off work I was in the same position I was before I came here ,,then I get to the billing lady and she informs me that my BC/BS will not cover my exam , but it’s the same insurance I have had for years ,,they have always paid everything but a 30 co-pay on my exams ,,,so I call the same insurance lady from their lobby because they are trying to make me pay all of the fee,,,my insurance lady said you are covered and she wanted to talk to the billing lady ,,,my insurance lady tells me it is all fixed now and they had been just billing it wrong,,ok all taken care of so I get off the phone and wait for billing lady she then comes back and tells me she put it in the computer again and her corporate office sent it back again and I have to pay 100% ✋️😡 this is in front of everyone in lobby I have hated making a scene but I have two blue cross dental policies I pay for never had any problem,,my insurance people tell me and them it’s covered and they still will not take it ,,,,I am forced to pay all of it right there ,,after arguing with her over and over ,, so embarrassing,,,,when I get back to my car I call BC/bs again and they are surprised,,they said but we told them you are covered and how to bill it ,,,,so now my insurance company is going to call me every Friday with an update on getting my money back from this company,,,I would never ever go here again,,,,,Aspen dental did nothing but steal from me and leave me with my same toothache

text: Very  nice and helpful staff . resp.text: Happy to hear you had a good experience, Linzi! We appreciate your kind words! -- Kelsey, ADMI

name: Isaac Graves
text:
This visit to Aspen Dental was extremely important to me, and I really couldn't be more satisfied. I, personally, have suffered from depression and anxiety for a large part of my life, as well as adolescent gran-mal seizures since I was fifteen years old. The seizures prevent me from being able to drive a car, which prevents me from from being able to get to and from a workplace easily.
Lacking regular funds/insurance coverage, and being anxious and depressed did lead to my neglecting my dental health, which simply exacerbated my anxiety. I suffered a huge panic attack after encountering some (actually relatively minor) dental pain a few days ago. I made an appointment at Aspen Dental for the next morning, which was impressively easy to do online and your staff here at Cox Creek Pkwy did not disappoint me whatsoever; service was extremely professional. Dr. Konradi and the dental hygienist couldn't have done a better job at reassuring me that my shortcomings can be overcome.
My blood pressure at the time was apparently extremely high, most likely a result of the panic attack I suffered the night before, compounded by a minor fever and a lack of sleep. I took my blood pressure this morning and it has thankfully returned to a normal level (111 over 76). I have already purchased the recommended electric toothbrush and a new pro-gum-health toothpaste. I have been instilled with a strong sense of hope already and I have no doubt anymore that I am capable of restoring my dental health. As much as I can, I thank you, and I am looking forward to my next visit whole-heartedly.
Sincerely,
Isaac E. Graves

text: Nice facility. Kind staff. The branding for the clinic is off... they use 2 dogs and a toothbrush as their graphics. For parents it makes you think twice as if you possibly showed up to a vet. Nice gesture, but maybe reserve that for the clinic that has the animals. For other locations it’s inappropriate.

Thank you for providing your feedback and letting us know about this issue, Two Melanin. We set a high standard for ourselves and are truly sorry to hear that standard was not met in your interaction with us. Please get in touch with us on (205) 251-1010 and we'd be happy to help you out.

Cheers,

Pediatric Dental Associates Birmingham

text: The best pediatric dentist office! I will never take my daughter anywhere else!

name: Taylor Felkins
text:
**Update: I am bumping up my review from 3 to 4 stars because the lovely hygienist called me to check on my daughter the next day and I also received a voicemail today from the office manager apologizing for my wait times. It is a very kind gesture to reach back out to me.

I loved the hygienist 100%. She was very good with my 1 year old and I will go anywhere to be seen by doctors, nurses, etc. that are sweet to my baby but other than that I have mixed emotions. I arrived for my appointment 8 minutes early and walked up to the door to see a paper posted about staying in your vehicle and calling about your arrival. I understand that is typical COVID protocol but I had to wake up my sick daughter to get her out so it was a pain. Not a big deal but they weren’t ready for me. About 20 minutes later they called me to see if the paperwork was complete but they still wasn’t ready for us. I called after 40 minutes to see if they had forgotten about me and they had. Had I known I would wait so long, I could’ve let my daughter sleep. The exam part was overall good (the doctor wasn’t there so there was a stand in). I went to pay and because I don’t have dental insurance they weren’t sure what to charge me, which I found odd. I ended up paying $81 dollars just for them to look inside her mouth. No X-rays no fluoride and no cleaning. Just a five minute look. I don’t know if that is normally what an exam would cost but it seems high. Honestly, after sitting in my car for 40 minutes and then 5 in the chair I am surprised to pay that. The hygienist waited for me and helped me with the doors which I appreciated because I had to hold my little one and carry stuff too. I am willing to go back one more time because of the hygienist but I’m not sure if this will be the place for us long run.

Everyone there treated her so wonderfully! She was upset that she had missed hat day at school and one of the surgical nurses gave Lilly one of her caps and they had her waving to everyone on her way to the OR. Best dentist ever!!!! I just wish they took adults!!!!! We love you guys. Wish I could give you 100 stars!!!!!

text: Dr. Rutledge is the BEST dentist I've had in my 55 years of life!!!...Knowledgeable, easy-to-understand and a great chair-side manner...All the staff, from front-desk, to technicians to insurance/checkout clerks a friendly, caring down-home folks... Had cleanings to removals and never have I felt more at ease than with Dr. Rutledge and this staff!!!...

name: Jamie Jenkins
text: I'm new to the area as of June 2020. I've had lots of Dental work in the past and so I'm the nervous type. The hygienist Kelsey was so super sweet and talked me through everything. Dr. Rutledge was even better! He talked me through our game plan and made me feel so reassured that I'd be greatly taken care of. At the end of my appointment I had to schedule my next one and Kelsey asked the receptionist to put me on her schedule. That made me feel awesome!!! I'm so glad I've chosen this clinic to be my forever dentist!!

name: Tina Schutz
text:
I had my very first toothache at 45 years-old and I was given Dr. Rutledge’s name by a friend but warned that he was difficult to get into see. I called on a Monday and received an appointment just two days later on Wednesday, February 11, 2021 at 2:00pm. I was there 30 minutes before my appointment and sent a text (as requested by the office) to let them know I was there.

Jada brought out the paperwork I needed to fill out as a new patient and requested I text the office phone number when finished. She took my insurance card and driver’s license to make copies while I filled out the very simple paperwork. The paperwork was basic and took no time at all. I sent a message when I was ready.

Shannon was Dr. Rutledge’s assistant. She did my X-ray where the toothache was and talked with me and about my dental history. I was comfortable with her immediately. She explained everything she was going to do before she did it.

Dr. Rutledge came in and was INCREDIBLE! He diagnosed what was wrong quickly. I was super surprised to find out I had a cracked tooth! He went over all options with me and we chose the best plan for me. My appointment with him was set up as a consultation only and I was afraid it would be a while before I could get in to have the work done he suggested but boy was I wrong!

Casey is the wonderful lady who is in charge of checking out Dr Rutledge’s patients and she set up my appointment for m, MONDAY, February 15, 2021! I only had to wait four days to have the work done! Casey is a ROCKSTAR!

I will return on Monday, February 15, 2021 to have a crown and possible root canal. I’m not nervous at all. I know that I am in great hands with the ladies of the office and Dr. Rutledge is just a bonus!! Stay tuned for the review post procedure!!!!

name: Brian Steiner
text: This place is absolutely awesome! Dr Rutledge was really cool and explained to me in detail any questions I had. Also, the hygienist I had was the best! Actually looking forward to coming back for my next appointment!

resp.text: We're looking forward to your next appointment, too!

name: Penelope Taylor
text: I messaged Dr Martin after hours for a bad toothache. He called me right back and had me in first thing the next morning. I’m a baby when it comes to teeth and he is always so caring and mindful. His staff are also genuinely nice and helpful.

resp.text: We're so glad that we were able to help!

name: Nancy Litch
text: My appointment was on time. The practice uses careful COVID-19 precautions. The hygienist did an excellent job cleaning my teeth. Dr. Rutledge was timely and thorough in his examination. Everyone was very friendly and professional. I highly recommend this dental practice.

Once I heard this I knew I had to see him. It was the best decision I ever made. The staff accommodates you when you're nervous and especially for ones like me who have very sensitive teeth. name: Angel Tillman
text: I really wanted to like this dentist's office.  It's very efficient and clean.  The work is done promptly.  I did not care for the first hygienist I had, so I asked to have her replaced.  The second was much better and the third hygienist was the best I've ever had.  However, when I first switched to Northcutt, it was because my previous dentist retired.  I was told that a filling I had received needed to be replaced.  I was reluctant, because it wasn't giving me any pain or problems, but I had it replaced.  After the replacement, the dentist said he needed to replace his own work (no charge)  so he did.  Then I started having a lot of pain from the 2nd replacement.  He worked on it a 3rd time.  The last time I went in, he expressed that the whole tooth needed to be crowned - lest I eventually need a full root canal.  (this time charged of course)  Needless to say, I will have to be getting a second opinion.  I cannot have the same tooth worked on 5 times unless it truly is necessary.

text: Today was my first time to go to Northcutt Dental office. From the moment I walked in the door I felt welcomed the staff were so nice. My Family and I won't be going anywhere else but there. Thank you for all the information and wonderful experience.

text: Everyone was nice and they were all very professional and the work I had to have done was excellent!

name: William Shannan Seelmann
text: The admin staff is friendly and the office is nice and clean. The porcelain crown I had done less than a year ago not only came off tonight but it also has a hole all the way through it. The assistant who adjusted it before it was cemented did not listen to anything I said when she was fitting and drilling on it. I told her the contacts were too tight, but she insisted on adjusting the occlusal (biting surface) until here we are less than a year later with a useless crown. Since we've already moved from Helena, I can't even get Northcutt Dental to make this right. Insurance only pays for 1 crown per tooth every 5 years... I would not recommend this place!

resp.text: I want to thank you for talking with us to discuss your issue. It is our goal to make sure our patients are raving fans of NDP and we want to do all that we can to address your needs upfront. We are sorry that you had this experience and hope you were pleased with our quick response & solution to your concern.

text: They are the best   informative, high tech, fun and knowledgable.  The staff rocks from front to back.

name: Zahir Merchant
text:
Stay away if you value your money.

They quoted me $17k for my dental work, went somewhere else (which had to redo my x-rays for free because the Northcutt ones were so poor in quality) and they quoted me for around $4k without my insurance, just around $1.5k with it.

The red flag for me to get a second opinion was when they kept pushing a $15 enamel toothpaste. If you look it up on Amazon, you can get the exact same toothpaste in a two pack for the same price.

If a dental office is willing to sell you toothpaste with a 100% markup, you have to imagine what else they're taking advantage of you on.

To be fair, the staff is friendly, and the office is very very nice with games for kids.

But this price gouging is ridiculous, and I think someone has to acknowledge it.

text: Deerfoot dental come highly recommended by several people. The staff was kind and charismatic enough to put me at ease while still being professional. My only complaints were they only offered the white fillings when several insurance companies will only pay for silver, while I personally prefer the while on visible teeth I know some people can not afford to pay the difference. My second complaint which is really minuscule was I had a little trouble finding the building with it being behind the pediatrician's office and in the same parking lot without a sign at each parking  lot entrance. The problem was solved with a quick call to clarify their location when I got close.

name: Celena Hathaway
text: My husband, B, had the most amazing experience here! I know...I know...you’re thinking, “How can anyone have an amazing experience at the dentist?” Well, let me tell you. He had a pretty rough time, my husband. He was in a real bad way when he arrived there, and Dr. G did not mince his words. He (probably) said, “Yeah, my man...you’re gunna lose that tooth.” Now, my B was in immense pain and seriously considering pulling his own tooth with a pair of dirty garage pliers. Dr. G (probably) said, “Nay, sir. There’s no need for that. Take these antibiotics, and I’ll see you on Monday to exorcise that evil spiritual entity from your mandible.” Brian was henceforth treated with the absolute best dental care that he’s ever received, and we, as a family, will (not probably—definitely) be forever clients at Deerfoot Dental!

text:
I felt very comfortable immediately.  I found the Staff to be very friendly and helpful in answering my questions?
The Dental Assistant was extremely efficient and explained to me the duties she was performing. This was important to me who wants to know what is being done in my mouth!
I immediately felt confident that Dr. Grovenstein would be candid in diagnosing the problem to keep my teeth healthy.
I have an appointment June 4th for a huge cavity under a crown that he said could possibly call for a root canal.  My initial appointment was yesterday (May 23) and ironically the crown came out today.

name: Angela Cross
text:
I'll leave my original review below because it still stands however I’d like to update to say while everyone is very nice there you should stay on top of your own benefits and find out ahead of time how much every single thing they do will cost you and then call your insurance yourself and verify that it will be covered (probably a good practice anyway obviously but I just assumed they were on top of it since I was only initially charged a copay only to find out a month later that so much work was done (in a couple of appointments) in an overlapping way that my benefits we're maxed out and they still continued to do more work after that that I wasn't aware wouldn't be covered so I now have a massive bill from them that I definitely didn't see coming. Like I said probably my own fault for trusting someone else to have my best interest in mind and to be on top of something like that but lesson very painfully learned.)

Original review

I have terrible dental anxiety but everyone at Deerfoot Dental has gone above and beyond to help ease that. I highly recommend Deerfoot Dental especially to those who are generally nervous about visiting the dentist. The team here from the girl doing your billing and appointments to the nurses and doctor are all genuinely warm and kind. No long waits and they get you scheduled quickly and efficiently for any follow-up care. Overall great place.

name: Dennis Olinger
text:
So my two year old son fell and busted his mouth on our driveway one evening. His front tooth got knocked in and was terribly crooked. Blood was everywhere...
My wife was at work..and needless to say..I was a little panicked. My wife came home and we started calling dentists. We came to find out that most dentists are closed on Friday..and it was Thursday evening when this occurred. My son has been a patient at Deerfoot Dental since his teeth really started coming through. We left a message after hours and Dr. Grovestein called us back! He asked us to text him photos of my sons teeth. We sent the pics and he called us back. He reassured us that it probably wasn’t as bad as it seems and he would meet us at his office the next morning. So he opened his clinic for us on his day off! I mean who does that? He gave us instructions to care for the tooth, we made a follow up appointment, and left. Needless to say..our sons tooth looks great. It actually straightened out almost back to its original spot. We went to our follow up appointment and got the good news that his teeth looked great and to just keep a watch on it. I have never in my life experienced customer service from a healthcare provider like this. We are still in shock that someone would care so much about the wellbeing of our son. They have earned a customer for life.

resp.text: It was my pleasure to check your son! Thank you for the kind words!

With no apologies or information given in between all the while people who came in 10, 15, and 20 minutes after me were taken in BEFORE ME. Mind you I did have an appointment I was not a walk in! Right as I was about to leave I was called up and the entire exam plus dentist overview was less than 30 minutes! so I waited over an hour to only be seen for 30 minutes.. The dentist went over my x-rays extremely quick and the exam was maybe 5 minutes. I had to bring up my issues the dentist did not even ask me.. Often times, a patient can come in with their own preconceived thoughts, as to how the outcome should be. However, when a dentist does the exam, and finds something different, they immediately feel upset. No one likes to get news of possible dental work that will need to be done. It's scary, and costly, we get that. Everyone has their own way of dealing with good and bad situations. We would hope that all our potential patients would rather make up their own decisions, based on their own experiences. You may be pleasantly surprised! Be well - Cindy, ADMI

text: My appointment was at 8:45 am. I didn’t leave the office until after 11:00. I was told prescriptions were sent to Walgreens. It’s 7:38 pm and I am still without pain meds & antibiotics. But they called it in to the wrong place. So at 7:15 I get a call stating I could pick it up at Walgreens. WRONG!!!! I am at Walgreens and still no medicine. WHY????? Because it was called in at CVS!!!!! So now I have to wait for CVS to back it out of their system so Walgreens can fill the prescription. And guess what, it’s pain meds but no antibiotics!!!! I’m done. It’s my first and last time using ASPEN Dental!!!

text: I do not recommend. I was financed to get my dental work done through a company that they use (Genesys) . Genesys sent a card via mail to swipe whenever I use the services but aspen dental decided to use the entire amount of the loan and applied it to my account as paid for services I never received. I have been paying on this loan since February and finally opened a dispute with Genesys . I never received any dental work and they are now sending over a refund to Genesys . It is now August , they stated I used services and paid in Full in March 2020. They have sent Genesys a refund and it’s taking forever for the refund to process. I will never use them again. They have my utilization very high on my credit card so until they send Genesys the refund , I can’t do anything. They are a scam. Why would you pay yourself for services in full that a patient never received?

name: Precious King
text: I would’ve been a New Patient on 7/2/2020 @ 2 ( be remindful I sch this appointment a month in advance). Aspen Electronically text my phone 6/30/2020 stating my appointment would have to be canceled. I then contacted one of Aspen Rep. and she told me she would reschedule my Appt. for 7/13/2020; I asked the Rep. if she could find me something soon since it had taken already a month to get a Appt. She then stated o no it’s going to be @ September because you are a new patient anyways and we have to reschedule our patients first. I then lol and stated that ok and very Unprofessional  of your Company to allow me to set appt. then they canceled it ( electronically) I then call and the Rep rescheduled me days later then my original appt. then realize I was a NP so pushed me back 2 more months. If that’s how Aspen Dental do New Patients then I’ll go Elsewhere No Thank You Aspen Dental.

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you for sharing with us so that we can continue to improve patient experiences. - Dawn, ADMI

name: Abigail Kidd
text: I had an appointment scheduled with this dental office since March 2020. Understandably, my appointment was canceled mid-March due to COVID, and I was notified via automated voicemail. I called to reschedule, and they told me there were no available appointments until June 29th. My boyfriend received an appointment for June 11th, arrived 15 minutes early, approached the counter and was told his appointment had been canceled. They offered to reschedule and apologized but said there was nothing they could do, as his appointment had been given to someone else. He had done his paperwork by email and had confirmed his appointment as well. This was not an error on his end. Today, I arrived for my appointment after no communication from Aspen’s end for weeks. I approach the door and it is locked with a note saying the office is closed until July 13th. I was turned away by the lady working inside, while two other patients that had approached the front door were taken inside. I was contacted by one of their managers after I called corporate to explain my frustrations with being turned away after having my appointment for over two months now, and I was told that there was no doctor in office. She explained that the other patients were just “taken inside” and did not elaborate further as to why I wasn’t offered the same efforts. Not sure what exactly the issue is here, besides just poor communication, but I will never be returning. I have no issue with cancelations as I understand it is a very difficult time right now, but I still expect you as a business to have the courtesy to contact your patients and be respectful of their time.

resp.text: I'm really sorry to hear that, Abigail. If you haven't called the Patient Satisfaction team yet, my team would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Dawn, ADMI

text: I wouldn’t recommend this place.  They’re not very professional.  In my experience, they told me I needed periodontal treatment.  I accepted the treatment. Apparently she covered all 4 quadrants in 30 minutes and one sitting.  If it was that easy, why was a periodontal treatment necessary?

text: My whole overall experience was amazing! The staff are all genuine, funny, and outgoing. I was surprised my first initial visit lasted less than a hour! name: Jim S.
text: The people are very nice, but the insurance is a constant battle. My insurance has no copay for routine cleanings but they keep wanting to charge me and then upcharge for "fluoride" and "cancer screening" which do very little if anything at all IMHO. The two times I have been, the dentist on call (different each time) spent maybe three minutes with me, looked in my mouth and xrays and that's all.They did not do any gum measurements not filling adhesion testing as I have always been used to in 30+ years of other dentists. Also entire visit took about 3 hours....easily double of any other experiences. I understand that this is "chain dentistry" so I knew there would be 'some' issues. But again the people are very nice, it just takes a long time and the billing is an issue.

name: Barbra Crippen
text:
If it was possible, I'd give them a negative star rating!!

I took my aunt to Aspen Dental yesterday & feel that we have been totally messed up. She is a cancer patient undergoing chemo & has lost a lot of weight which we told them.
She has a set of dentures but the bottom plate has never been adjusted to fit well. First the technician who I guess makes the dentures, etc., came in & was able to make an adjustment that would have made them wearable till she had a new set made. When they started to make impressions none of the trays that hold the "goop" was small enough to fit in her mouth???? Never had that problem before.
They ended up using her dentures to make the impressions, getting the goop all over her, then giving her a towelette to clean up with that came from a container that was clearly marked "Do not use on skin".
When we got home & took the bottom denture out of it's baggie, it had been ground down till there was nothing but teeth sitting on a flat base. Called them today to tell them they needed to make her a temporary plate & was told they couldn't do that.  Needless to say we are not going to do business with them. I have been told that they will refund her deposit.

We're going to a "real dentist" tomorrow to start over.

name: nhoenshell
text: I've lived in montgomery for exactly a year now, and I finally managed to schedule a dentist appointment because I was definitely past due for a visit. It was a weird experience at Aspen Dental to be sure, and I cant help but feel as if I was swindled somehow. It was the longest and most expensive dental appointment I've ever had. Being a new patient, I expected extra steps like xrays, but the whole ordeal was weird and confusing from the beginning (starting with when I tried to confirm my appointment via email, which ended up being a phone call, and none of my information was correct in their system). After an awkward xray process, I was led to a room and sat in a chair for about 30 mins. The first obvious red flag that had me wondering if I was getting the wool pulled over my eyes was the TV they stuck in my face (attached to the chair) as the tech and dentist did "paperwork" and talked about teeth stuff amongst themselves behind me completely out of my field of vision. Then the dentist said I had gingivitis and two cavities-- which were a complete shock to me since I've never had any in my life and was experiencing nothing unusual in my mouth during my daily life, no pain or discomfort at all. The gingivitis thing I could understand, I guess (i mean it's a reversible condition from what I understand, so I thought it was weird for them to schedule a whole multi appointment treatment process that would take place throughout the month). I dont know anything about teeth, so you could tell me to open up, poke around in there with tools, and tell me it's a whole huge dangerous mess and I'd have to believe you, because what do I know? What I do know is that the visits to my old dentist were always straight forward and I understood everything they were doing because it was clearly explained and they didn't try to schedule 3 visits in a single month. After all that waiting, tv, and a brief examination, I find myself at the cashier's desk and absolutely no work was done on my teeth. I opted out for the 130$ smart brush that was included in my bill. And then they said they could probably fit me in today for my first treatment after I paid for a large sum that was ultimately un-itemized. The paperwork I received was not a receipt for what I paid for in that moment, but a breakdown of all the work they were going to do and how much it was going to cost me later. I agreed to have the first treatment done right away. Finally, I was going to receive some sort of treatment that was physical during this visit, but I didnt truly understand what I was paying for that warranted such a large bill when I was at the cashier's office. The treatment was no different than what any other dentist would do during a routine cleaning so I'm still not sure why it was so expensive. At the end of my visit, I walked away with a lot of fancy products and with the peace of mind that I didnt have mouth cancer...so, that's a relief. The staff was super friendly and kind, and I really appreciated Loretta. She was absolutely fantastic, but I'm not sure I want to go back to this place at least two more times in a single month just to be broke and confused again. I fully understand that I am dumb, but things just didnt add up.

resp.text: Thank you for providing this information.  I would really like to speak with you.  Will you please call me at (844) 296-0187 ext. 201152 — Julie, ADMI

text:
A complete waste of an afternoon and prolonged suffering because there seems to be no communication whatsoever between the appointment setter and the staff.
I needed a broken tooth repaired in my denture.  The appointment setter assured me that there is a lab and a technician on site that can do repairs.  I told them this is all I wanted done because I have a dentist in Dothan that I see twice a year.
When I got to the appointment, they wanted to do x-rays and an exam.  After I explained (again) why I was there...they told me the technician was already gone for the day!  The appointment setter had LIED TO ME.

name: Land Barnett
text: BEWARE!! Very unprofessional and slow establishment.1, Front desk clerk told me to write down my social security number and date of birth on a sticky note instead of just entering into the computer. 2. Unsanitary, Assistants didn’t wash hands prior to putting gloves and conducting X-rays; proceeded to touch the walls and computers and then put hands into my mouth to adjust X-ray device, very nasty and unsanitary. 3. Then the “dentist” came into the room eating and coughing into hands then reaching to shake my hands. I told him I had just coughed in my hand and that he should wash his hands, he stated “no I’m good “. Didn’t wash his hands then proceeded to put on gloves to exam my mouth. Before examining, he adjusts his glasses on his face with the gloves on! Then goes into my mouth with the same nasty gloves. He acted as if he didn’t know what treatment plan I should be on. The hygienist told me one thing and he said another. Had to wait another 45 mins to see the “Consultantion Manager “ who told me I should go with treatment plan that the hygienist recommended. The suspect front desk who asked for my social hadn’t even verified my insurance so when I asked for pricing no one knew because the insurance it was after 530 n they were closed. I left confused and with an sore mouth and nasty feeling funny after this visit which was only an consultation. NEVER again will I visit this office and I suggest anyone else stays away from it as well!!

name: Karey Wilkinson
text: This place is a joke! My mom have an appointment at 11:00am. At 11:30am, she have not been called so I went to ask the front desk girl when will they see her and made her aware that her appointment was at 11am. She looked at me like I was bothering her and told me she does not know or how long and advises me that they take lunch at 12:30pm. So my question is, my mom have three people ahead of her and they take lunch at 12:30 so how will they get all the patiences in before 12:30????? Will not recommend this place to anyone because this is her third time trying to adjust her denture and she isn’t the only one here with the same problem. Jesus help them get more organized and professionalism! I have never been to a dentist where you have to wait half your day to see someone. So another question I also have is........if someone was really in major pain, how long will the wait be?????? If you would like to get in and out and want good CUSTOMER SERVICE and FOLLOW UP’s go see Dr. DUBOSE!

name: N Timms
text:
Aspen Dental is the worst. I was quoted $832 by Tanietha to have two of my wisdom teeth extracted with oral surgery on 12/04/2018 and the woman sent my X-ray over to the dentist that would be doing it. And I was told by Tanietha that if they weren’t able to schedule me then they would call me to reschedule. So I went ahead and paid $832 for two of my wisdom teeth to get removed with oral surgery. And it was scheduled for the very next day but I was told that I had to go to the Prattville location. My mouth was hurting so bad that I didn’t mind going to get that relief.  I show up at 1:15 p.m. to my appointment that was supposed to be scheduled for 12/05/2018 at 1:45 p.m. and at first the woman couldn’t find me stating that my appointment was canceled or taken off the schedule. The woman behind the receptionist spoke up because she’s who the Montgomery office spoke to and said she would ask the dentist if he could do it.
The dentist said that he would be able to remove my teeth. So I sit down to make sure the paper work was okay and I was informed that I would have to pay an extra $850 on the spot because they would rather that I be put to sleep. I already paid in full the price that I was given without insurance and drove to the Prattville location. And I was not prepared to pay an additional extra $850 on the spot for a service that I already paid for. I just told them to refund me the money and now I have to find somewhere else because these people are not organized in the least bit. They felt more than happy to take my money but when it was time for the service...it’s oh no ma’am we need more money now. Ridiculous! I’m still waiting on my refund now.
I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND ASPEN DENTAL.

name: Malika Rogers
text: I had an appointment for a exam and x ray. During the process I was asked if I had a tooth that was bothering me at the moment,  and i said yes. I asked if i could get it pulled that day. I was told to make another appointment to have it pulled.  During the process of going over the procedures that will be done, make sure you look at the prices. They tried to charge me $153 for a toothbrush. They are all about money. I wanted them to do certain things, but instead they claim other things needed to be done first. Yeah, of course so they can get more money.  They are very unprofessional,  talking about the patients in front of other patients. They gossiping about why this patient came back, and the response wasOh he's complaining about his dentures again. A woman came in to bring one of the staff members some fish, and when I tell you most of the staff got so loud and ghetto over some fish. MY GOODNESS,  even the doctor came out and joined in. Out of all the staff I encountered that day, Cynethia has the most professionalism and she does not fit in that group at all. Actually she should teach the regional manager Felicia some techniques.

resp.text: I am sorry to hear about your experience, Malika. I apprecaite your feedback and will certainly pass this along. Thank you. -- Kelsey, ADMI
